loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia forma parte del banco comunal “Esperanza y Fe” de la comuna de Independencia. Ella se dedica a la confección de uniformes, buzos y otras prendas por encargo, desde hace más de 40 años. Tiene 3 clientes frecuentes: un hospital, un colegio y un jardín infantil. Trabaja normalmente sola, pero cuando tiene pedidos muy grandes contrata a una persona para que le ayude. 
Con este préstamo comprará telas, hilos, elásticos, cierres y botones. Patricia  ha sido un importante aporte económico para su hija que estudia ingeniería en turismo en la universidad. Su meta más cercana es comprar una máquina especial para terminaciones y su sueño es cambiarse de casa a una más grande e instalar allí un taller de costuras.  
Patricia siente que en Fondo Esperanza ha podido realizarse como persona, gracias  al apoyo que ha recibido, no solo económico, sino que en la orientación sobre cómo administrar mejor su negocio. 
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Se caracteriza por la presencia de edificios de mediana altura. Aquí se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile, entre otros 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the community bank named "Hope and Faith" in the community of Independencia. She makes uniforms, sweaters, and other clothing items. She has been taking orders for more than 40 years. She has 3 regular clients: a hospital, a school, and a day care center. She usually works alone but when she has very large orders she hires someone to help her. 

This loan will be used to purchase fabrics, threads, elastics, zippers, and buttons. Patricia has been an important financial support for her daughter who is studying engineering tourism in university. Her short term goal is to purchase a special machine to add finishing touches and her dream is to have a larger home where she can set up a tailoring shop. 

Patricia feels that within her community bank she has been able to improve herself. Thanks to the support she has received, not only financially speaking, but also in the orientation on how to better manage her business.

Independencia is one of the 34 communities that make up the city of Santiago (capital city of Chile). It is located in the northern central region of the country and the city boasts medium sized buildings. The Indigenous Peoples Cultural Centre of Chile is and 6 other historical monuments are located in this city.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, threads, elastics, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Compressor Group

texts.en:
Goodliva B. is in her mid-thirties and is married with three children.  Goodliva has been running a table top fish selling business for one and a half years.  The shop is open between 7:30 am and 9:00 pm and earns Goodliva a low monthly profit.

This will be Goodliva's third loan with Tujijenge Tanzania.  Goodliva used her previous loans to increase her business and to make sure that she always has enough liquidity to restock if she needed to.  These loans were all successfully repaid.  Goodliva aims to use this next loan to improve the condition of the stall and to have enough liquidity to ensure a steady supply of fish. 

Goodliva will share this loan with her loan group, Compressor, which totals 10 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Goodliva can be seen wearing red in the front row.

loans.use: To improve the condition of the fish sales stall and to have enough liquidity to ensure a steady supply of fish.

loans.name: Duo Solidario La Union Group

texts.es:
DUO   LA UNION
Se integra por  2 señoras , la representante la señora Lilian Antonieta T. P. de 34 años de edad , tiene3 hijos  su negocio lo inicio hace 4 años   con la ayuda del esposo empezaron con el préstamo de maquinas industriales para la elaboración de ropa de variedad en la cual confeccionan   camisas, pantalones y playeras, hace un año que ella  empezó a comprar sus propias maquinas  industriales  y contratar más personal para su pequeña Fabrica que se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, para estas temporadas invierten más por lo que muchas personas buscan  fabricación de ropa, su  sueño es poder comprar más herramientas para  negocio la señora solicita el crédito para  poder confeccionar  mas ropa en diversidad, la señora Josefina Guamuch, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad   inicio con una venta de tortilla hace 10 años  lo cual vendía hasta hace 2 años inicio con la confeccion de ropa  con la ayuda de su hijo quien le proporciono maquinas para que ella pueda administrar el pequeño taller ella consiguió personal quien le apoyara, y así mismo ella sale todos los fines de semana a vender a diferentes pueblos. Su deseo es poder tener un pequeño local  en su domicilio. Solicita el préstamo para confección de ropa.
texts.en:
DUO LA UNION is a group of two ladies.  The group's representative is Mrs Lilian Antonieta T. P. who is 34 years old and has 3 children.  She started her business 4 years ago.  She set up her business with her husband's help.  They hired industrial machines to make clothes and they make shirts, pants and t-shirts.  One year ago Lilian began to buy her own industrial machines and hire more staff for her small factory which is located in her home.  In this season, they invest more as more people want clothes making.  Lilian's dream is to be able to buy more tools for her business.  She is requesting this loan so that she can make a greater variety of clothes.

Mrs Josefina Guamuch has 4 grown-up children.  She started out selling tortillas 10 years ago.  She did this up until 2 years ago when she started making clothes with the help of her son who provided her with machines so that she could run her small workshop.  She contracted staff who could support her in her work and she goes out every weekend to sell her clothes in different towns.  Her wish is to be able to have a small premises in her home.  She is requesting this loan to make clothes.

loans.use: Confeccion y venta de ropa.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To maintain the health of her crops

loans.name: Sonia Beatriz

texts.es: Sonia Beatriz G. D. P. D. 23 años D. edad, es una madre muy responsable y trabajadora la cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como mecánico, y así mismo junto a su pequeña hija D. 5 años D. edad. Sonia se dedica a la venta D. productos por catalogo como: perfumes, maquillaje, accesorios para la cocina y otros más, su negocio es bastante estable ya que cuenta con una cantidad bastante granD. D. clientes los cuales mes a mes consumen los productos que ella comercializa D. forma ambulante, haciendo visitas D. casa en casa mostrando los diferentes catálogos. D. esta forma Sonia se gana la vida y es así como le brinda el apoyo necesario a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mayor variedad D. cosméticos y así mismo diferentes productos para ofrecer a sus clientes a los cuales en su mayoría compran a crédito por lo que Sonia necesita cierta cantidad D. dinero para invertir en el negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia Beatriz G. D. P. is 23 years old.  She is a very responsible and hard-working mother.  Sonia lives together with her husband, who works as a mechanic, and her 5 year-old daughter.

Sonia works selling products from catalogs such as: perfumes, make-up, kitchen accessories, etc.  Her business is quite stable since she has quite a large number of customers who consume, every month, the products that she sells.  She makes her sales in an itinerant manner, going from house to house, showing customers her different catalogs.  This is how Sonia makes a living and how she supports her husband with their household expenses.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a larger variety of cosmetics and also different products to offer her customers who mainly buy her products on credit.  The fact that they buy on credit means that Sonia needs a certain amount of money to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and household products

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Nhoem's Group

texts.en:
Ten people, who make up a village bank loan in Prey Snuol village in Takeo province, have selected Mrs. Nhoem S. M. to become the village bank president. They will use their portions of the loan in varied ways to support their family living.
Mrs. Nhoem S. M. is a pig breeder and a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family.  It is now the time for growing rice, so she needs some money for cultivation.  Mrs. Nhoem S. M. is applying for a loan for farming during the current year. Her husband, Mr. Kusorl Tuy, is a trailer (taxi driver). They have three children, two of whom are studying in the local public school.   The youngest one is a 2 year-old.

loans.use: To cultivate rice for this year.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 55 años, es una mujer trabajadora y responsable. A pesar de la separación que tiene con su esposo, ella sigue trabajando en conjunto para poder cuidar de sus 2 hijas; con quienes viven en la comunidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica es la “agricultura”, ya tiene 33 años dedicándose al cultivo de la tierra. Lo que más le gusta a ella es la dedicación que le brindan sus hijas, ya que la ayudan a cuidar, limpiar y abonar sus cultivos; que constan en su mayoría de café, el cual después de su cosecha lo comercializa en la Cooperativa de Alto Palomar. Pero lo que le genera ganancias diarias pero menos rentables; son sus cultivos de plátanos y palta, los que cada 15 días los comercializa en  Paucartambo, que es un anexo comercial. Por el futuro de sus hijas, está planeando mejorar sus cultivos de café, para que puedan tener mayor demanda. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de la Unión”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP; donde se compromete a trabajar por el desarrollo de su asociación. María dentro de muy poco cosechará café, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
María, age 55, is a hardworking and responsible woman. Despite being separated, she and her husband continue to work together to support their two daughters with whom she lives in the community of Unión Palomar in the central Peruvian jungle. María has been farming on her land for 33 years. What she enjoys most is the dedication that her daughters provide since they help care for and fertilize the crops, which consists mostly of coffee. After harvesting, the crops are sold at the Alto Palomar cooperative. Her daily earnings are more or less profitable from her crops of bananas and avocados that are harvested and sold in Paucartambo every fifteen days at a commercial annex. For the future of her daughters, she plans to improve her coffee crops since they have greater demand.

María belongs to the Communal Bank “Prestatrios de la Unión” (Borrowers of the Union) and this is her first loan with MFP. She promises to work toward the development of her group. María will be harvesting her coffee shortly, so she is requesting a loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajando Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES TRABAJANDO” iniciará el ciclo número tres en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  una presidenta, la señora Elena, también se encuentra la tesorera la señora  Silvia y la secretaria de actas la señora Delfina.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados: elaboración de productos en macramé, librería, tejido a mano, venta de api (bebida caliente en base a harina de maíz morado, se sirve con empanadas fritas o buñuelos), carnicería, venta de ropa.
 
La señora Elena, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte de la A.C. “MUJERES TRABAJANDO” desde hace quince meses.  La señora presidenta tiene como negocio, desde hace 20 años, el tejido artesanal de camas, se dedicó a este trabajo por necesidad, ella comenta que le faltaba dinero para cubrir las necesidades del hogar,  ahora ha solicitado su crédito para comprar una vaca en la feria de  Patacamaya.    La señora Elena, mujer adulta de 57 años de edad, está casada, es madre de ocho hijos.   
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Trabajando” (Women Working) communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Focal Center.  It has 8 members and is led by a governing body the head of which is Elena, President.  Silvia is Treasurer and Delfina is Recording Secretary.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied: making macramé items, bookstore, hand knitting, sale of “api” (hot beverage made from purple corn that’s served with fried turnovers or fried dough), butcher shop and clothing sales.

Elena, communal bank President, states that she’s been a member of the “Mujeres Trabajando” communal bank for fifteen months.  Madame President has had an artisanal bed weaving business for 20 years.  She states that she needed money to cover household expenses.  On this occasion she is asking for a loan to buy a cow at the Patacamaya livestock fair.  

Elena is an adult woman of 57 years, married and the mother of 8 children.  When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the training.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es: El Solicitante cuenta con casa propia tiene una moto taxi la cual lo alquila  el prestatario es músico toca el cajón en eventos  de manera semanal presenta buena acumulación de bienes producto de trabajo. Su cónyuge tiene un negocio donde vende  golosinas y gaseosas ambos tienen buenas referencias personales, el cliente tiene un crédito con la CMAC ese dinero fue destinado para mejoras de su vivienda, ahora  esta solicitando en crédito para comprar accesorios para su moto taxi es por ello que se propone el crédito.
texts.en: The person requesting this loan has his own home and a motorcycle taxi that he rents out.  He is a musician and plays the box drum at weekly events.  He has a good amount of goods as a product of his work.  His wife has a business selling candy and soft drinks.  Both have good personal references.  This client had a credit with CMAC, and that money was used to improve his home.  Now he is requesting a loan to buy accessories for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora tiene 68 años y es casada con hijos que ya son independientes. Vive en la ciudad D. Morropón en Piura, a unas cuatro horas D. Chiclayo, la capital D. la región D. Lambayeque. DesD. hace 4 años, cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes D. la zona diversos productos D. consumo diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida y una clientela ya establecida, siendo una D. las pocas bodegas en la zona. Desea invertir su crédito nuevos soles en la compra D. más abarrotes para vender en su bodega. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 500 nuevos soles. Isidora es un cliente recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa y cumplió con sus obligaciones anteriores en manera puntual. Es muy conocida en su comunidad y tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en: Isidora, aged 68, is married and has children who already live on their own. She lives in the city of Morropón in the region of Piura, some four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. For four years she has been running a small grocery store in her home. Here she sells to her neighbors and customers many everyday consumer products, including staples and groceries. Her business is well known and has a loyal clientele, since it is one of the few groceries in the area. Isidora wants to invest her loan in more groceries for sale. She thought it was appropriate to come to the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa and apply for a loan of 500 nuevos soles. Isidora is a returning client of Edpyme Alternativa; she met her previous obligations in a timely manner. She is well known in her community and has good personal and work references.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Tun

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Tun (pictured above) and her husband, Mr. May Roeun, live approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and two daughters.

S. stays home. Their main source of income is from her husband’s business. He is a construction worker. S. is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase additional construction materials for her husband’s construction business.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction materials for her husband.

loans.name: Nancy Mugure

texts.en:
Nancy has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 22 years.  She is 48 years old, married to Onesmus M., and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field staff and this will be her second loan.  She repaid her previous loan of Kshs 10,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Nancy hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mercedes Clementina

texts.es: Mercedes Clementina se dedica a la venta de tortillas tiene más de 23 años en su negocio. Es una persona dedicada, abnegada y que le gusta el trabajo, Mercedes tiene una gran fama por este negocio, pues siempre ofrece buena calidad en sus productos y en sus servicios. La mayoría de sus clientes saben que Mercedita como le dicen es bien cariñosa y servicial. Es así que decide realizar este crédito para la compra de leña, maíz, cal, bolsas, servilletas entre otros.
texts.en: Mercedes Clementina has been in the tortilla sales business for over 23 years.  She is a dedicated, selfless person who likes work.  She is quite famous because of the business because she always offers good quality in her products and services.  Most of her customers know that Mercedita, as they call her, is quite affectionate and accommodating.  She has decided to request a loan to buy firewood, corn, lime powder, bags and napkins, among others.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, lime powder, bags and napkins, among others.

loans.name: El Espino Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Espino lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Nindiri ellas tienen 14 ciclos con Adim en los cuales se han perfilado como buenas clientas y han tenido tres prestamos con Kiva. Ellas han participado en las capacitaciones de Adim en las cuales según comentaron han aprendido mucho.

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Vilma de 54 años quien tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en la venta de comida frita en la cual invertirá el crédito con la compra de queso plátano, repollo, aceite… etc. Además los fines de semana realiza sopas especialmente las de gallina.

Ella tiene ocho hijos de los cuales el menor de 16 años es el único a su cargo quien en su tiempo libre junto a dos trabajadoras le ayuda en el negocio. Vilma desea invertir en un futuro en el destace de cerdo.

Las otras dos integrantes son Silvia María de 24 años quien en un inicio vendía Prendas (joyería) ahora tiene una tortillería ya que este negocio le es más rentable y Nidia compra y vende maíz desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The group “El Espino” (The Hawthorn) consists of three hardworking and enterprising women who are originally from Nindiri.  They have participated in 14 loan cycles with ADIM and have emerged as good clients.  Three of their loans were provided through Kiva.  They have also participated in training classes provided by ADIM and, according to them, have learned very much.  

The group coordinator is Sra. Vilma, age 54.  She manages a “fritanga”, a popular type of restaurant that sells fried foods.  Vilma will invest her loan in the purchase of cheese, plantains, cabbages, oil, and other products.  On the weekends she prepares soups, including those that contain chicken.  

Vilma has eight children.  Her youngest child is 16 years old and the only one who is still a dependent.  During his free time, he helps the other two employees in Vilma’s business.  In the future, Vilma wants to invest in butchered pigs.

The other two members are as follows:
•	Silvia María, age 24, started out selling jewelry, but now she has a very profitable business selling tortillas.
•	Nidia has been buying and selling corn for two years.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, plantains, cabbages, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a married man. He has three children. Felix does welding to earn a living. He has been in the business for only one year.  He has employed two people to assist him in his tasks. 

Felix hopes to grow his business and to open other outlets in the future. He has requested for 20,000 KES to buy a grinder and a drill.

loans.use: To buy a grinder and a drill.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 33-year-old wife and mother. Her husband and she have worked at saving money since they got married to buy their own house one day. Fatima and Ibrahim (her husband who is photographed above instead of conservative Fatima) were able to fulfill their dream and buy a house.

Fatima took out a loan from FATEN to cover construction workers' wages for house finishing (painting and installing sinks)  as they want to have the house done before next winter.

loans.use: to pay for house finishing: painting and installing sinks.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 30 years old. She has three children who are 3 to 10 years old. They are all in school and her husband is a driver. 

Clementine sells second-hand clothes and she has been selling these clothes for the past 16 years. This business has enabled her to make some savings and pay school fees for their children. 

She needs a loan to buy a variety of clothes in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to accumulate savings.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda tiene 43 años, está casada con Samuel, de 47 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 4 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Está luchadora mujer se dedica a la agricultura. Junto a su hijo Wilder, se dirigen todas las mañanas a sus cultivos de arveja, papa y maíz; donde trabajan arduamente desde al amanecer hasta el anochecer.  Lo que más le gusta a Nilda, es cuidar de sus animales como vacas, toros, cerdos y ovejas. Ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a ello, y afirma que a pesar de los inconvenientes que se suscitan constantemente, como en temporadas de lluvia, cuando aparece la enfermedad denominada  “la rancha”, termina por malograr los sembríos. Pese a ello,  tiene mucha fe y ganas de trabajar, ya que el campo “es su vida”, ahí nació y creció.  Por ello más adelante desea construir una casa más segura donde pueda vivir y poner un negocio propio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de cumutay” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño apoyo económico para continuar con sus objetivos. Además se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Nilda de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja para su próxima siembra, además de varios sacos de abono orgánico para comenzar con éxito la temporada de sembrío.
texts.en:
Nilda, 43, is married to Samuel, 47.  They have five children but only four of them still live at home; the family lives together in their own house located in Cumutay.

This hard working woman farms.  Together with her son, Wilder, she heads out every morning to tend to her pea, potato and corn crops.  They work hard from sunrise to sunset.  What Nilda enjoys the most is caring for her livestock: cows, bulls, pigs and sheep.  She’s been in this occupation for 20 years and she affirms that despite the inconveniences that constantly arise, like the rainy season when a disease called “la rancha” appears that damages crops.  Despite this, she keeps faith and the desire to work because working in the fields “is her life;” this is where she was born and grew up.  Later on, she’d like to build a more secure house where she can live and open a business of her own.

She belongs to the “Pioneros de Cumutay” (Cumutay Pioneers) communal bank and this is the 9th loan with MFP where she’s hoping for a small economic assistance to continue toward her objectives.  In addition, she commits to pay her installments punctually.

If Nilda were to obtain your support, she will invest the requested money in the purchase of two bags of pea seeds for her next planting as well as several sacks of manure to begin the planting season successfully.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of pea seeds and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 30 years old and lives in West Point. She is single and has a 13-year-old child who is currently in school. For the past few years, Oretha has been selling charcoal in the local market. One of her major problems is that she has fewer customers during the rainy season. Oretha is requesting a loan to purchase fifty bags of coal for her business. She hopes to build her own house in the near future and send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase fifty bags of coal

loans.name: Maria Isolina

texts.es:
María  de 27 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace unos 6 años aproximadamente María se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (todo tipo de productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos,etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su seguridad, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos personales.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías y también aves de corral para incursionar en un nuevo negocio, con el único ideal de que su negocio se amplie y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  con el dinero que gane para cubrirá su préstamo y sus obligaciones de su casa.  María es una persona dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarle más comodidades y tranquilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 27 years old, single and lives at home with her parents.  They have water and electricity and are located in a rural area of Mórrope district, which is part of Lambayeque department.  This area is characterized by its agricultural activity, cattle raising and artisans.

Maria has sold groceries (all types of products used daily such as milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, etc.) and beverages for approximately six years. She has run the business from her home, for her own security, and tries to cover all her personal expenses with profits from her sales.

She has requested a loan of 2,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to support her business and will buy more merchandise, as well as poultry in order to penetrate a new market with the goal of expanding her business and offering more goods to her customers; with the money earned she will repay her loan and meet her household obligations. Maria is a dedicated and hard-working person who is committed to providing more amenities and economic peace of mind to her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store and to begin to offer poultry for sale, as well.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 57 years old and she lives alone in Dusheti, in the Mtskheta-Mtianeti region. She is busy with her handicraft business and she designs and sews various traditional Georgian clothes. Ketevan also purchases handmade traditional Georgian clothes and accessories from other designers and sells them locally. Her total monthly profit from selling clothes and handicrafts is 400 GEL.
	
Ketevan is requesting a loan to purchase traditional Georgian handmade clothes and accessories to sell. She will also use part of her loan to purchase materials to sew Georgian clothes. In the future, Ketevan plans to arrange an exhibition of Georgian clothes and accessories in Dusheti. She thinks that it will be especially interesting for the tourists visiting their region.

loans.use: to purchase traditonal Georgian clothes and materials to sell

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.es: Giovanni, tiene la edad 43 de años, está casado y vive con sus 2 hijos y esposa actualmente. El pretende con el crédito comprar insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El lo que va comprar específicamente es el abono y todo lo necesario para asistir su cafetal. El cuenta con el área de café ya establecida en producción y en un buen estado de producción. El lo que quiere es darle a su cafetal los nutrientes necesarios para así obtener de este los mejores resultados del mismo. El quiere generar el maximo de ganancias para el bienestar de su familia y de su proyecto cafetalero para salir adelante con sus proyectos a largo plazo establecidos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Giovanni is 43 years old; he is married and currently lives with his two children and his wife.  He is planning on buying supplies with the loan to help with his coffee plantation.  What he specifically wants to buy is manure and everything he needs to help his coffee plantation.  He has an area that is already established for coffee production, and has a good level of production.  What he wants is to give his coffee plantation the necessary nutrients to be able to obtain the best results.  He wants to generate the maximum earnings for the well-being of his family and of his coffee plantation, so as to move ahead with his long-established plans.

This is the first loan that he has received through FUDECOSUR.  He hadn't taken any other loans previously from the state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to help with his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is 46 years old. He lives in Vanadzor city with his wife and 5 children: two sons and three daughters. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children, and Andranik is engaged in bee-keeping. He has been  bee-keeping for more than 15 years and he is known in the Lori region as a one of the best honey producers.  Andranik produces high quality honey, so he has many regular customers. 
In early spring, when the flowers are starting to blossom, Andranik moves his beehives to Havlavar village. Bee families stay there during spring and summer months, and in the late summer Andranik transports his beehives back to Vanadzor, where he takes out a large lot of honey. For beehive transportation Andranik rents a truck, and for frames and other parts of beehive transportation he uses his own car. 
Andranik is asking for a 180.000 AMD loan to install in his car equipment for use CNG (compressed natural gas) instead of liquid fuel, because gas is two times cheaper than liquid fuel. 
This is Andranik’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To install in his car equipment for use CNG (compressed natural gas) instead of liquid fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 42 years old, and mother to five children. She is a green grocer, and has been in the business for the past two years. She gets a monthly income of KES 5,000 from the business.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy onions, tomatoes, and greens for stock for the business.

She will use anticipated profits to educate her children and also expand the business. Her hopes and dreams are to own a big business that can sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, and green vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 43 years old, married, and a mother of four children. She runs a food kiosk in Kiwandani, Kilifi. Her business has been in operation for the last two years. 

This marks her fourth borrowing to finance her business which is doing well. With this loan she plans to purchase vegetables and fruits, charcoal, cooking oil, wheat flour and maize meal for her business. 

The anticipated profits which will be generated from the business will be reinvested for the gradual expansion of the business and the repayment of the loan. Her dream is to become a successful businesslady.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits, charcoal, cooking oil, wheat flour and maize meal

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señora Delia es natural D. la comunidad D. T’oqo Rancho D. la Provincia Tiraque del Departamento D. Cochabamba, cuenta con un hijo y está viviendo con su familia en la localidad D. Tiraque.
Actualmente trabaja en el magisterio, es docente D. educación primaria en el núcleo escolar D. Boqueron K’asa km 78 carretera antigua a Santa Cruz.
Es muy conocida en Tiraque porque todos los niños la quieren mucho, se dedica mucho a su trabajo, con mucho cariño. A ella le gustaria darle a su hijo mejores comidades en su casa es por ello que el préstamo que solicita es para comprar material D. construcción para su casa en la localidad D. Tiraque D. modi D. mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Delia lives in the town of T’oqo Rancho, Tiraque, Cochabamba, and has one son living at home.  Delia works as a primary school teacher in 
Boqueron K’asa, km 78 on the old highway to Santa Cruz.  She is well known in Tiraque and all the children are fond of her.  She is very committed to her job and cares deeply for her students.  Delia would like to improve her housing conditions to benefit her son, and for this reason seeks a loan for construction materials to improve her home.

loans.use: Construction and housing improvements

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 42 year old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has four children, aged 14 to 28 years old. They are in school and live at home. For the past twenty years she has been selling soap, soft drinks, tissues, etc. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, soft drinks, and tissues for her business. 

Her main challenge is that during the raining season there are less purchasers. Comfort says she started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this business from her mother.

What she really likes about her business is that it always keeps her with money. She hopes to become a big businesswoman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, soft drinks, and tissue for her business.

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Zachary has operated his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years. He is 23 years old, married to Jane, and they have one child.

Introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients, Zachary is requesting his first loan in order to buy more goods to sell in his retail shop. In future, he hopes to expand his shop into a wholesale operation, earn more income, and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his store.

loans.name: Golden Mothers Group

texts.en:
Precious is a single woman aged 30. She lives in Kwekwe with her four year old child. She also takes care of her brother.

Precious is in the business of  buying and selling fruit and vegetables. The business has been operating for the past four years now. She has two employees who assist her in selling the vegetables. She was granted a loan of $400 which she used to buy cabbages, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. Her problem is that fruit and vegetables may go bad before they are sold which leads to losses and affects her profits. 

Precious is also a hairdresser thus she supplements her income through hairdressing. She sees herself renting her own saloon thus enabling her to pay fees for her child and feed the family.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages, carrots, tomatoes and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan es chofer propietario  y es miembro de un sindicato de trufis (son taxis que tienen una ruta fija). El crédito que solicita es para el mantenimiento total de su movilidad ya que es su herramienta de trabajo. Juan es casado y tiene dos hijos. Vive en casa alquilada ubicada en la Urbanización El Mercedario de la Ciudad de El Alto. Juan es cliente de Impro desde al año 2009, siendo esta la quinta vez que solicita un crédito y la tercera vez que recurre a Kiva para fondeo.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is an independent driver and a member of a syndicate of “trufis” (taxis that have a fixed route). The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for total maintenance of his vehicle since it is the main piece of equipment he uses for work. Juan is married and has two children. He lives in a rented house in the urban section of El Mercedario in the city of El Alto.

Juan has been a client of IMPRO since 2009. This is the fifth time he has requested a loan, but the third time he has returned to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance costs.

loans.name: Matari

texts.en:
Matari is a 62-year-old businessman, who lives in Juba. He is married and has 4 children between the ages of 8 and 19, all of whom go to school. 

Matari runs a furniture store, and he has been in the business for 12 years. He has 3 employees. Matari heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officers’ promotion in the market. He is taking a loan of SDG 3000 to purchase more items like timber, machines for cutting timber, and many others. Aside from this business, Matari has no other source of income. 

In 5 years' time, Matari hopes to enlarge the store by building it from concrete.

His major challenges include importing the timber from other countries into South Sudan. 

Matari says that he appreciates Finance Sudan’s efforts in South Sudan for uplifting them financially: "Without Finance Sudan, I was not going to talk about machines."

loans.use: to purchase more items like timber and machines for cutting timber.

loans.name: Ifrah

texts.en:
Ifrah is a married business lady who lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She owns a clothes shop which has been running for five years. She obtained the startup capital from her husband.

Ifrah is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy more clothes to sell during the festive season. She looks forward to owning a business premise and not having to rent. She will use the extra income from this loan to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 31-years-old man living in Fort Portal Uganda in a semi permanent house. He has been driving a motorcycle for four years. With the income earned from driving, he has been able to provide basics to his family. His goals are educating his children, building a permanent house and buying land land to grow crops.

John needs the loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Gloria Enelcy

texts.es:
Gloria vende hace año y medio aproximadamente productos naturales en su municipio motivada principalmente por generar ingresos con los cuales pueda contribuir económicamente en su hogar para tener mejores condiciones económicas, pues los ingresos que generaba su esposo no estaban siendo suficientes para poder sostener los gastos que allí se generan. Gracias a su negocio, su calidad de vida y la de su esposo y sus 2 hijos ha mejorado considerablemente, es por esto que siempre busca que su negocio siga creciendo y mejorando sus ventas. Gloria busca un préstamo para comprar productos con los cuales pueda ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad y así aumentar sus ventas para mejorar sus ingresos.

De esta manera espera que sus ingresos mejoren para que en su hogar puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida. Además sueña con poder ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos una educación de mejor calidad y un futuro económico estable que les permita progresar.

loans.use: Comprar productos con los cuales pueda ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad y así aumentar sus ventas para mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.name: Markus Mai'unguwa

texts.en: Markus Mai'unguwa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Markus Mai'unguwa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Samson, Barau and Joshua.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Markus Mai'unguwa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Markus Mai'unguwa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Markus Mai'unguwa  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
Carmen Luz es una señora muy activa, depende de su esposo quien de su ardua labor cotidiana como constructor, devenga ingresos que le permiten asegurar el buen vivir familiar, con los ingresos que ella recibe mediante remesas garantiza la alimentación de sus tres hijos quienes estudian, ademas se encarga de realizar las mejoras en la vivienda, ya que su marido es quien trabaja y viaja fuera del domicilio para poder garantizar el soporte familiar; siendo una familia muy unida han logrado su propósito en las mejoras de su hogar.

Este préstamo que hace a kiva sera invertido en comprar cemento, azulejos, arena, arenilla tubos, ducha y otros materiales que utilizará para poder hacer un inodoro con su baño dentro del cuarto donde duerme, tendrá que remover una pared interna esto lleva mayor costo pero valdrá la pena, pues dará realce y comodidad en este hogar, aprovechado por la familia, sobre todo sus nietos que pronto llegaran.

Con otro crédito si Dios le permite desea instalar el Cielo razo en la Vivienda y así poco a poco mejorar las condiciones en esta Vivienda.

loans.use: Construir baño e inodoro en el interior del cuarto para mejor comodidad y seguridad.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell ready to wear. Elvira is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fish net, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fish net, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz was born in 1951. She is is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in Khirdalan settlement, married, has 3 children.
Having borrowed a loan amount of $400, she had bought medicinal preparations and started her business. 
This medicine-chest has been provided with the medicinal preparations by firm.
In the beginning of her business she could not buy the medicinal preparations for cash from firm.
For the second time she borrowed a loan amount of $800 and bought a lot of medicinal preparations for cash.
For the third time she borrowed a loan  of $1000 and bought all medicinal preparations for cash.
Now she needs a loan amount of $1200 to privatize this medicine chest .
She has been engaged in this business for 20 years.

loans.use: To privatize a medicine chest

loans.name: Nay

texts.en: Nay Y. is 54 years old and the mother of four children.  In the past two years, the family has created several sources of income.  Y. plants corn and raises the family's five cows, which they plan to sell soon to a local butcher.  Her husband runs a fishery and can make up to five dollars per day in the high season.  Y.'s two sons are construction workers and make about four dollars per day.  Meanwhile, her two daughters each make $70 per month while working in a garment factory.  Y. plans to use this loan to buy a machine to help harvest crops.  Additionally, the family will buy one more cow to raise.

loans.use: To increase corn production and to buy a cow

loans.name: Gulchekhra

texts.en:
Gulchekhra is married with three children little children. Her husband is a taxi-driver. 

She is a seamstress and has been running this business for one year. She makes to order national style dresses. Her mother trades in  household chemical goods. Her mother needed an assistant and Gulchekra offered her daughter to work with her. 

Gulchekhra has noted that there is a big demand for carrier bags. She has tried to sow and sell the carrier bags made by her. Now she has a lot of clients. She would like to buy material for carrier bags to sell them wholesale. She plans to use the profit to expand the household chemical goods assortment.

loans.use: Buy material for sowing carrier bags.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Mrs. Doris Omoragbon is 40 years old and is happily married with five children.  She hails from Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for four years as a union leader. She sells provisions and food stuff.  This loan will be used to buy more food stuff and provisions.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Make a new tricycle cart for his sales

loans.name: Fahosat

texts.en: Mrs. Fahosat G. is 35 years old, married and has 4 children. She lives in Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells  building materials. This is a business she learnt from her mother.She is in needs of $475 to buy more  building materials for sale.

loans.use: To buy more  building materials for sale.

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en:
Koreti R., aged twenty-seven and the mother of two children, runs an ice cake (popsicle in a bag) and a fishing business. She has fully paid off her previous loans which she used to improve both businesses. Her husband is unemployed and helps out Koreti with the businesses.

The fishing business has helped Koreti in many ways: she has been able to send her kids to school and put food on the table for the whole family. She aims to save up and buy a fishing boat in the future, for she’s sure that her family is better-off because of the business.

loans.use: To buy new fishing gear

loans.name: Malika

texts.en: Malika E. lives in the Nausky region and is married with 4 children. She decided to become a client of MicroInvest in 2006 because she heard so many successful stories from friends on the MicroInvest loan circle. Malika is very experienced in this business (about 5 years) because she has been working in this family business from her young days. She is currently requesting a loan to purchase a milk producing cow.

loans.use: for the purchase of a milk producing cow

loans.name: Sherifatu

texts.en: Sherifatu O. l is a mother of 3 and is 43years old. She hails from Mushin, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells drinks and provisions and has been in business since 1999.She needs a loan of $450 to buy more drinks and provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions

loans.name: Sayaad Agha

texts.en: Sayaad Agha lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married, has 3 children, and provides the only income for his family. He has a gas shop, and has been involved in this business for more than two years now. He wants to take out an individual loan to enlarge his shop by purchasing the necessary materials to make a good business. In the future, he would like to help his family more, as his family makes him happy.

loans.use: To increase his shop's supplies

loans.name: Bakte 3 Group

texts.es:
Blanca Celi is a 24-year-old mother who is raising a son on her own. She would like to start a poultry farming business from home so that she will not neglect her son. With this loan, she would like to purchase hens and roosters so that she can breed them in her yard. She would also like to buy chicken feed and the vaccinations necessary for breeding. The other members of the group are: Dora H. H., and Candelaria H. A., who sell groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

BLANCA CELI TIENE 24 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE UN HIJO AL QUE MANTIENE ELLA SOLA, QUIERE INICIAR EL NEGOCIO DE CRIANZA DE POLLO EN SU CASA Y ASI NO DESCUIDAR A SU HIJO CON EL CREDITO DECEA INVERTIR EN COMPRAR GALLINAS Y GALLOS PARA PODER REPRODUCIRLOS EN EL PATIO DE SU CASA, ASI COMO ALIMENTOS Y VACUNAS NECESARIAS PARA QUE SE CRIEN, LAS OTRAS INTEGRAANTES DEL GRUPO SON. DORA H. H. Y CANDELARIA H. A., LAS CUALES VENDEN ABARROTES.

loans.use: Purchase chickens and new scale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. is fifty two years old. She is a wife and the mother of five children. She sells Kenkey (a local dish) in her town. For the past fifteen years she has supported four of her children to help them complete school.

Rose wishes to increase her production of Kenkey since her customer base has increased. However, she is constrained by inadequate capital. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize and vegetables to store, especially in the face of price hikes that have resulted from the current food crisis. This will allow her to increase production and raise her income.

Rose belongs to the community group called Nkwabin Ladies Trust Group. In this group, members use social collateral to guarantee the loans for one another. They use positive peer pressure to encourage each other to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and vegetables for keep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a small business selling used clothing.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny H., 35, lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, with her husband, Mul Saret, and their five children. Three of their children are in the local schools and the other two are employed and helping to support the family. One works in the local garment factory and the other is a part of a construction business.

Ny H. works out in the fields as a farmer and typically makes $2 USD each day. Her husband is a fisherman and makes $3 USD each day.

She has asked for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase a tractor to plow the family’s farm land, thus eliminating the expense of renting a tractor every year. She can also earn extra income by renting her newly purchased tractor to other people in her village who need their land plowed . She sees this as a valuable investment for her future and that can save the family money right away.

loans.use: Purchase tractor

loans.name: Rosa Libertad

texts.es:
Renting rooms has become the most important source of income for Rosita, the name by which she's affectionately known to all of her renters and friends. Rosita is a much-loved woman, respected and valued in her neighborhood because despite hard economic times and family problems, she's had the strength to endure. With diligence and effort, she's managed to partially refurbish some of her rooms so that they could be rented and generate extra income. Now, seeing the need to make her renters more comfortable, she's decided to complete the renovations in order to better provide for the comfort and well-being of her guests and her family. With the goal of buying construction materials for the refurbishment, she's applying for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El alquiler de habitaciones se convirtió en el ingreso económico más importante de Rosita como cariñosamente la sueñen llamar sus inquilinos y amigos, Rosita es una mujer muy querida, respetada y valorada en su vecindad, ya que pasó por malos momentos económicos y graves problemas familiares, pero tuvo suficiente fortaleza para seguir adelante.Con empeño y diligencia logró refaccionar parte de sus habitaciones para finalmente ponerlas en alquiler y así obtener ingresos extras, pero ahora viendo la incomodidad de sus inquilinos se ve en la necesidad de concluir con algunos detalles, para mayor tranquilidad y bienestar de su huéspedes y su familia.Con ese objetivo, la compra de materiales para construir, Rosita espera obtener el préstamo que solicita.

loans.use: Buy construction materials to refurbish rented rooms.

loans.name: Herlin

texts.es: El Sr. Herling tiene 31 años de edad,  y habita en el Barrio Waspan Norte de Managua, es casado, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 9 años de edad que están cursando la primaria, su esposa es comerciante, vende productos varios los cuales oferta de manera ambulante y también los clientes llegan a su casa de habitación. Don Harling trabaja en topógrafo y tiene un año de estar laborando en esta área. La solicitud que está haciendo es para hacer mejoras en su vivienda en la instalación de  un servicio higiénico y tuberías de  aguas negras, esto es debido que en la parte donde vive ya están instalándose los tubos de aguas negras para el barrio, él piensa que es un gran avance para el barrio donde habita ya que ahora podrán tener más higiene en sus viviendas, sobre todo porque ya no será necesario el uso de letrinas.
texts.en:
Herling, 31, lives in the Waspan Norte barrio in Managua. He is married and has two children, 7 and 9, who attend elementary school. His wife sells various products on the street and out of their home. Herling has been working as a topographer for a year. The loan he is requesting will be used to improve his home by installing a toilet and sewage, since a sewage system is being installed in his barrio Herling believes this new sewage system will be a great improvement to the hygiene in his neighborhood, because latrines will no longer be needed

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installing toilet and sewage

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 46 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. He is  a very hard working and resourceful father. He belongs to the community group called "Adjinyemise" (translation: do not betray your brother) Trust Group.  In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans.

He is a retailer of charcoal in his neighborhood. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all traditional Ghanaian homes.  Joseph obtains his supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Koforidua and sells it retail to his customers. He will use the loan to buy bulk supplies of charcoal. He hopes to increase savings so he can pay his childrens' educational fees.

loans.use: To buy bulk supplies of charcoal.

loans.name: Nimia Idelsa

texts.es:
La señora Nimia Idelsa León M.  tiene 38 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Elena II y vive en la Mz A 28 lote 3 Manuel Arévalo II etapa distrito La Esperanza provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero ya no continuó estudios superiores debido a que vivía en la campiña y era difícil ir a la ciudad porque no había movilidad. Se casó a los 21 años y tiene 2 hijas que dependen de ella.
Nimia tiene una mini granja en la que cría pollos en escala, gallinas ponedoras y pollas ponedoras, su negocio lo realiza en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas compró comida para pollos.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará comederos y bebederos para sus pequeños galpones.
Nimia sueña con tener un establo porque le gusta mucho la cría de animales.
texts.en:
Señora Nimia Idelsa León M. is 38 years old. She belongs to the Community Bank Santa Elena II and she lives at Mz A 28 lote 3 Manuel Arévalo II etapa, district La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad Perú. She finished secondary school completely, but she didn’t continue her studies further because she was living in the country and it was very difficult to go to the city because she didn’t have a way to get there. She was married at 21 years of age and she has two daughters who depend on her. Nimia has a small farm in which she raises baby chickens, laying hens, and stud roosters. She runs her business from her home. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 installments, she bought chicken feed. With this loan of 500 soles that she would repay in 4 installments she would buy food troughs and drinking fountains for her small farm. Nimia dreams of having a stable because she really likes raising animals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy implements to care for Nimia's animals

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline O. sells clothes in Evbareke market in Benin City, Nigeria. She has been in the clothing business for a long time. The demands for her clothing are high and with the holiday season approaching, she expects the demand to increase. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She needs a loan of N50,000 ($425) to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Hanifan M. Ayub Group

texts.en:
Hanifan baji is a 50 year old married lady and resides in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 10 years. Her husband's name is M. A. and he is a daily wage labor. Hanifan baji has one son who is a driver by profession, driving a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Hanifan baji also works with her husband. They both work hard for their son. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw along with money saved by her son.

She is the leader of a group with a few more women. Rani baji also wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw. Zakia baji wants a loan to buy meat to resell. Lalan baji wants a loan to buy chairs for her barber shop. Samina baji wants a loan to buy switches and wires for her electric shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Pertenece al  Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final”, tiene 65 años D. edad, con 4 hijos mayores D. edad, 10 años socia.

El primer préstamo que recibió D. S/. 300  Nuevos Soles puso un lavandero pequeño en el patio D. su casa, y la venta D. bebidas con lo cual ayudaba al ingreso económico en su casa ya que lo que su esposo ganaba no alcanzaba .

Con este préstamo D.  S/. 1,000 Soles compro materiales para arreglar su tanque, ya que por los años se deterioro. 

Esta muy contenta con Manuela Ramos que le entendió la  necesidad que tenia y ahora trabaja tranquilamente, incluso tiene personas que trabajan con ella .
texts.en:
Alejandrina belongs to the Community Bank “together to the end” and is 65 years old with 4 adult children and a partner of 10 years. The first loan she received of 300 Soles she used to put a small washer in the courtyard of her house and to sell drinks which have helped increase her household income as her husband does not earn enough. With this loan of 1000 Soles she will buy materials to fix her gas tank, which has been deteriorating for years. She is very happy with Manuela Ramos who understands her needs and now works peacefully with the people who work with her.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to fix the gas tank used for motorcars.

loans.name: Keng

texts.en: Keng A. is 64 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband have worked together selling bricks and construction tools since 2003 to earn a living. They make around US$ 10 every day. This couple has two children and both are married and live away from home. Mrs. Keng A. is asking for a loan to purchase more bricks and expand her construction tools inventory to meet her customers’ demand.

loans.use: Construction materials for re-sale

loans.name: Nasreen Kanwal Akhtar Abbas Group

texts.en:
Nasreen kanwal baji has been a citizen of Vehari, Pakistan for the last seven years. Her husband's name is A. A. and he has had a business selling garments for the past five years. He runs a shop in the cloth market and earns a good income. Nasreen baji helps him by selling his collection of garments in the community. She is applying for a loan to expand his garment-selling business. 

She is the group leader for some more women in her locality. Zeenat begum baji wants a loan to repair her vehicle named “Shahzore” which she uses for loading. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy paints to sell. Tanveer A. baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy materials (beads, clothes and colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members. Each member will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell

loans.name: Anwar M.ashraf Group

texts.en:
Anwar is a 39 years old married lady and a citizen of a city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan, for the past 26 years.  Her husband's name is M. and he deals with animals.  He sells buffalos to people who order them. 

Anwar is the mother of four sons.  Her elder son drives a donkey cart.  The other two have a burger point in the food market.  Her youngest son is in kindergarten.  

Anwar operates a sewing clothes business.  She takes orders from her neighbors and relatives and charges them $2 for simple stitching and $3 for designer clothes.  Anwar saves her income and wants to marry off her eldest son with the committee amount.  

She successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy animals (buffalos) for her husband’s animal selling business. 

Anwar is the group leader of three another women from her locality. Hajra wants a loan to buy scrap for her business.  Kalsoom wants a loan to buy groceries for her shop.  Nagina wants a loan to buy clothes for her business. 

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy buffalos for animal selling business.

loans.name: Carlos Afonso

texts.pt:
Carlos nasceu em ihambane tem 39 anos de idade estudou ate a 4 classe,vive maritalmente e pai de 5 filhos com idades entre os 1 mês a 16 anos de idade. Tres mais velhos e que encontram se a estudar.

Carlos sai de inhambane quando seu nome sai para fazer o serviço militar obrigatorio, depois de concluir continua com os estudos e teve que abandonar quando e chamado mais uma vez por um exercito denominado( a patria chama por nos), de imediato  sai de inhambane a namaacha uma vila na fronteira de swazilandia a procura de emprego onde começa a trabalhar como empregado domestico durante 5 anos. Em 1996 inicia o seu proprio negocio de venda de potes adquiridas em Maputo e vendidas na vizinha africa do sul. Tem viajado duas vezes por mês pois deve conscidir com o periodo de pagamento de pensao dos idosos, compra 50 potes por 6000.00mt e depois de pagar as despesas de transporte carlos tem tido de lucro 10.000.00mt e consegue poupar por mês 2.000.00mt porque para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua mae esta que vive em inhambane enviando lhes em cada 4 meses um valor de 1.000.00mt.


Este e o quarto emprestimo de carlos na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva.os 3 primeiros foram usados para comprar potes de revenda e este ultimo de 8.500.00mt seram usados para o mesma finalidade, esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo determinado e pedir um novo emprestimo para começar com a construçao da sua obra.
texts.en:
Carlos was born in Inhambane. He is 39 years old and went to school until the 4th grade. He is married and the father of 5 children with ages between one month and 16 years. The three oldest are in school. Carlos left Inhambane when he was obligated to serve in the military. After he concluded his service he continued with his studies but had to stop when he was called another time by the army (The homeland calls for us). Immediately he left Inhambane for Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, to search for work. He worked as a domestic helper for 5 years. In 1996 he began his own business of selling jugs acquired in Maputo and sold in neighboring South Africa. He travels two times per month since he has to coincide with the payment periods for elderly pensions. He purchases 50 jugs for 6,000MT and after paying for transportation expenses Carlos has had a profit of 10,000MT. He is able to save 2,000MT per month because besides his children he is also responsible for his mother who lives in Inhambane, and he sends her 1,000MT every 4 months. This is Carlos' fourth loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first 3 were used to purchase jugs to resell, and this loan of 8,500MT will be used for the same purpose. He is confident that he can pay off the loan before maturity so he can request another loan to begin work on his construction.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of jugs

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian sells second hand clothes and shoes in her shop. She travels to Cotonou to purchase her goods to sell in Lagos state. Lillian is 45 years old and married, with 2 children. Lillian hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 50, 000 ($350 US)to purchase more second hand clothes and shoes to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nasreen Javed Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is married to J. I., who owns a two-room brick house in Kasur, Pakistan, where they have lived for the past ten years. Nasreen baji is a hardworking lady who performs her duties very efficiently. She rises early and gets her two sons ready for school, then prepares breakfast for her family, and afterwards cleans the entire house. She fulfills all her family's wishes regarding care and health. Her husband has run a garment-selling business for the past six years, and Nasreen baji is applying for a loan to expand her husband’s business.

Nasreen baji is the leader of a group of six other women from her locality. Parveen baji, Shazia baji, Mumtaz baji, Salma baji and Sardaran baji each want a loan to buy clothes to sell. Mahwish baji wants a loan to buy shoes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
B. Rustam is a very responsible and optimistic person; he has two children and a wife whom he has to support. Rustam wishes to develop his business. This business consists of raising cows in his village because there is a very high demand for milk from villagers and especially from customers who come from enclosed towns.

Rustam is helped by his wife. He is currently faced with many problems because his children are growing and, accordingly, their expenses are growing, too. The only way to get out of this difficulty is to succeed in business, so we hope that his capabilities and the services provided by IMON International will help him improve the business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves to develop his business

loans.name: Kihara Mothers 3 Musoke Edith Group

texts.en: M. Edith is 20-years old, married, with one child in schooling. She has been dealing in the cassava flour business for over one year. She is using the loan to purchase bags of cassava flour for sale. She is a hardworking business lady who encourages others to work and whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cassava flour for sale.

loans.name: Lenny Dhayly

texts.es: Lenny Dhayly H. D. H. resiD. en Plan del pino ubicado en  San Salvador.  Lenny tiene 28 años D. edad vive con su esposo Salvador quien trabaja como motorista en ruta D. buses y con sus dos hijos Michelle D. 10 años y Briget D. 2 años D. edad. El esposo D. Lenny recibe un sueldo D. 6$ por día; Lenny trabaja en su negocio el cual es una tienda donD. venD. productos D. consumo, el deseo D. Lenny es seguir creciendo en su tienda y surtirla D. más variedad D. productos es por eso que solicita un crédito por que quiere comprar productos D. belleza para colocar en su tienda y así también surtir con mayor cantidad D. insumos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Lenny Dhayly H. D. H. lives in Plan del Pino, in San Salvador. Lenny is 28 years old and lives with her husband Salvador who works as a bus driver and her two children Michelle who is 10 and Briget who is 2 years old. Lenny's husband receives a $6 a day salary. Lenny works in her store where she sells products. Lenny's wish is to continue getting her store to grow and to supply it with a better variety of products, and this is why she requests a loan to purchase beauty products to place in her store and this way supply her business with a greater quantity of materials.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply her business

loans.name: Las Afortunadas Group

texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Afortunadas" (The Fortunate Ones) was founded about four months ago. Most of the group's members live in a neighborhood called "26 de Marzo" (26th of March) in the city of Pucallpa. The bank's president is Teresa R. C..

"Las Afortunadas" has 11 members, three of whom are new this loan cycle. For most members, this loan will be their second from Kiva partner Manuela Ramos. The bank's members are requesting a total of 4,400 soles, which each member will invest in her respective business. The women of "Las Afortunadas" dedicate themselves to a variety of business ventures, including the sale of charcoal, clothing, soft drinks, cooked food and fruits. Several of the women work as seamstresses.

The members of "Las Afortunadas" are grateful to Manuela Ramos for the financial support they are receiving. They also appreciate the business education sessions given by Manuela Ramos loan officers at their communal bank's monthly meetings. The women are dedicated to progressing with their businesses.

loans.use: soft drinks, fruit, clothing, charcoal and other items for sale; materials for sewing work

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, y tiene 03 hijos, los 01 que aun esta estudiando.

Isabel, con la edad que tiene es una mujer luchadora y eficiente, es Técnica en Farmacia y trabaja en el Hospital D. su Distrito. Con el anhelo D. tener un ingreso propio y teniendo los conocimientos en farmacia decidió implementar su propio negocio D. venta D. medicinas básicas, también se dedica a medir la presión y aplicar inyecciones. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que es la única farmacia en la cuadra.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, comprará medicinas como: Aspirinas, tetuman, doloflan, dolocordialan, antigripales como: nastisol, vick vaporub, dristan calientes, mentoles y otras medicinas básicas.

Isabel, se siente una mujer tranquila y contenta con lo logrado. Desea asegurarse una vejez tranquila por lo que agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a cumplir sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel belongs to the Communal Bank “Honestidad y Trabajo” (Honesty and Work), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is married and has three children, of whom one is currently a student.

Isabel is at the age where she has to be strong-willed and efficient. She works as a pharmacy technician at the district hospital. Wanting to earn her own income and utilize her pharmaceutical knowledge, she decided to start her own business selling basic medicines. She also performs blood pressure checks and administers injections. Isabel informs us that her business continues to operate and is doing quite well since it is the only pharmacy on the block.

With her loan of 3000 soles, she will buy medicines such as aspirin, tetanus vaccine, Doloflam (a regional brand of pain reliever), Dolocordralan (another brand of pain reliever), flu remedies (such as Nastizol, Vicks vapor rub, Dristan Hot, menthol, etc.), and other basic medicines.

Isabel is content and satisfied with what she has achieved. She hopes to earn enough so that she can live to a peaceful old age. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her achieve her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicines

loans.name: Ngoun

texts.en: Mrs. Ngoun H. is a farmer in Andoung village in Kandal province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a fish breeder. Now she needs a loan to buy more fishes, fish food, fertilizer, and gasoline to pump water to support the rice field. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Mean Met, is a construction worker. Mrs. Ngoun H. is 27 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fishes, fish food, fertilizer, and gasoline to pump water to support the rice field.

loans.name: God In Work Group

texts.en:
This is Fatmata K., Marie K. and Amidu K. of the "God In Work" group (God In Work is Krio, meaning “The work of God”). They are small-scale businesspeople in the northern City of Makeni. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva.

With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and make better profits. Consequently, their living standards will improve, they will be able to at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills if one of them falls sick.

Fatmata K. (right) is the leader of this group. Fatmata was born in a place called Sanda, in northern Sierra Leone. She is approximately age forty-eight, is married to a businessman, and they have five children. One of her children is a nurse and the others are in secondary schools.

Fatmata sells gara clothes (locally dyed clothes). She has been a businesswoman since childhood days.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Yolanda De

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 48 años de edad, en su carnet de identidad figura como casada, pero actualmente está separada de su esposo desde hace mucho tiempo atrás. Tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales solamente uno depende  de ella. La vivienda con la que cuenta es propia. Yolanda es propietaria de una carpintería, donde elabora una variedad de productos tales como puertas, ventanas, catres, roperos y otros. Cuenta con dos ayudantes, uno de ellos está a tiempo completo y el otro a medio tiempo. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace diez años. En la zona donde está ubicado su negocio no existen otras carpinterías, por lo tanto el nivel de competencia en la zona es relativamente bajo, pero a nivel de departamento existen muchas personas que se dedican a esta actividad. El destino del crédito es para compra de equipo para la carpintería, una máquina cepilladora y para compra de madera. Es el tercer crédito al que accede Yolanda. Presento un  buen comportamiento en los dos anteriores créditos. No presenta antecedentes negativos el sistema financiero.

loans.use: COMPRA DE EQUIPO Y CAPITAL DE OPERACIÓN

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of iron for the manufacture of hoes

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en: Khoem V. is 42 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province. Khoem V. earns a living by raising some poultry from her home. She raises it for both slaughtering and for chicks. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver. The family has been building their house for months, but their new house is not finished since they don't money. Therefore, Khoem V. has decided to seek a loan on Kiva through HKL to be used to finish building her new house.

loans.use: To finish building her new house

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Victoria M. from Tukuyu, married with four children between the ages of 1 and 20.  Victoria, who has been running a crops  business since 2007, works 9-12 hours per day, six days per week, earning about 100 USD per month.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk for her enterprise, and in the future she plans to open a new business. Victoria thanks you for your support!
