SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for business

loans.name: Llapanchis Tticarisun Group

texts.en:
The members of our group, Llapanchis Tticarisunchis, are part of the Asociación Arariwa. This communal bank consists of ten members: four men and six women. Many of the members live in the region of Santiago in Cusco, and the group members make their living in varied occupational sectors. One works in a grocery shop, another is a cashier, and a third is a teacher. Another group member works in the upholstery business.

One member of the group, Marina, makes a living selling vegetables in the Monjaspata Market in Cusco. This is a cramped yet lively market just next to the better-known San Pedro market in Cusco. Monjaspata market draws a more local crowd than its bigger neighbor next door, and the atmosphere is lively with vendors and buyers bartering for their daily vegetables, fruit, meat, and potatoes. Marina will use the loan from Kiva to further her business selling vegetables.

The name “Llapanchis Tticarisunchis” is a Quechua phrase meaning “We will all flower”. All of the members appreciate and thank you for the loan. They promise to pay the monthly payments on time.

Julia is not pictured in the photo.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: America Del Rocio

texts.es:
America M. de 33 años de edad, vive en una casa de cemento que esta ubicada en La Perimetral en Guayaquil, America comenzó desde muy joven cuando vio que su mama  necesitaba un ingreso mejor en su hogar y comenzó a investigar que hacia falta en su sector para poder tener éxito en su negocio, puso una pequeña tienda de confitería.

Ahora America trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00 en la que vende los jugos a $ 0.75 c/u, colas a $ 0.55 c/u, dulces según su precio, una de las complicaciones es no tener una de mejor construcción en su negocio para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Tiene 4 hijos uno de 13 años, 10 años, 4 años y 2 años ellos le ayudan en la tienda.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar 2 docenas de jugos, 2 docenas de colas y confites, en el futuro quiere agrandar su local y que sus hijos continúen estudiando.
texts.en:
America M. is 33 years old. She lives in a cement house located on the outskirts of Guayaquil. America started working very early when she saw that her mother needed a better household income. She began researching sectors that were missing in the community and in which she could have a successful business. Eventually she decided to open a small confectionery shop.

America currently opens her shop from 7am until 9pm. She sells juices for $0.75/each and colas for $0.55/each. Sweets vary in price. One complication is that her business is not located in a well-built structure that will allow her to satisfy the needs of her customers. She has 4 children (ages 13, 10, 4, and 2) who help around the shop.

With this loan she wants to buy two dozen cases of juices, two dozen cases of colas, and an assortment of sweets. In the future, she wants to enlarge her shop and see her children continue their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase juices, colas, and sweets

loans.name: Chheoun

texts.en:
Mr. Chheoun C. is 39 years old and lives with his wife, Mrs. Tha Sieb, in Knong Preaek village in Kandal Province. They have two children, one of whom attends the local public school and the other of whom is too young to go to school or work.
Mr. Chheoun C. is a construction worker and his wife is a vegetable seller. Since her vegetable-selling business is going well, Mrs. Tha Sieb wants to expand it. Therefore, Mr. Chheoun C. decided to apply for a fourth loan to buy more vegetables for the business. His wife is shown with him in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora Fátima del Rosario G., Labora día a día en el mercado Israel Lewite de Managua vendiendo golosinas, galletas, jugos y frutas.
Fátima va usar el crédito en compra de mercadería para su negocio.
Ella quiere el crédito para abastecer su negocio.
Su negocio empezó cuando Fátima dejo de trabajar como domestica, fue entonces cuando decidió poner su propio negocio.
Fátima ha tenido su propio tramo en el mercado para 15 años trabaja de 10 am a 6pm todos los días.
Ella espera que con este  préstamo su inventario incremente por lo que ahora tendrá mas productos para ofertar.
Fátima es madre soltera de dos hijos y uno de ellos se encuentra en edad escolar.
Este es el crédito numero 22 que ha tenido con ceprodel. Ha trabajado con ceprodel durante 5 años.
Fatima dijo que sus créditos con ceprodel le han ayudado mucho a crecer su negocio y mejorar su casa
texts.en:
Fátima del Rosario G. works every day in the Israel Lewite market in Managua, where she sells candies, cookies, juices, and fruits. Fátima is going to use the loan to purchase merchandise so that she can restock her business. She decided to set up her own business when she left her former job as a housekeeper. Fátima has had her own stall in the market for 15 years and works every day from 10 am to 6 pm. She hopes to increase her inventory with this loan so that she will have more products to offer. Fátima is a single mother with two children, one of whom is of school age. This is Fátima’s 22nd loan with Kiva partner CEPRODEL. She has worked with CEPRODEL for 5 years. Fátima says that her loans with CEPRODEL have helped her a lot in growing her business and improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in the purchase of cookies, juices, and candies

loans.name: Fawusat

texts.en:
Fawusat is an advanced woman who is very optimistic and energetic about the growth of her business. Although her husband works as a commercial driver, he still supports their home. She is 50 years old. She is very enthusiastic in pulling her family out of poverty. 

She sells loaves of bread to earn a living. She has 4 children who attend school and still depend on her. 

She is hoping for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase food to cook and sell. She hopes to start to sell cooked foods in addition to her bread business. This will enable her to meet the basic needs of her family. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase  food to cook and sell.

loans.name: Nurra

texts.en: Mrs. Nurra P., 35, is a tailor in the village of Khokhana-Dobato. She has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 2 and her son is studying in grade 7. Both Nurra P. and her husband, Surendra P., make different types of dresses for both ladies and gentlemen. Tailoring is their traditional work. Mrs. P. plans to use the loan of Rs 20000.00 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to use her income for self improvement and for her children's education. In Nepal the cost of a good education is increasing and Mrs. P. is saving her income to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buys raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Mrs. Marife J. is from the village of Northern Poblacion, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old, married, and is blessed with two school-aged children. Marife owns and operates a business selling of variety of food products in the local community and earns 2,000 PHP monthly from her business. In 2009, Marife joined PMPC to access its programs and services. She's obtaining her first loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Mrs. Som C. is 54 years old and is a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Som C. owns a rental kiosk in the local market where she sells food to people who come to shop. Also she relies on the income from her husband who owns a car he uses to pick up students, for a fee, who study in a private school.

This couple is married and is blessed with seven children. One of their children is now married and lives away from home while the remaining six are single. Two daughters are employed and provide their small income to support their family.

Som C. is applying for a loan to buy attractive accessories for her food shop and to repair an old car that often breaks down during her husband’s use.

loans.use: To buy attractive accessories for her store and to repair an old car used in her husband's business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz C., 55, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Eduardo C., a driver, they are blessed with two children. Beatriz makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store while also having a direct-selling business for quite some now.

Beatriz has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her direct-selling business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she is applying for a 37,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying advance orders for her direct-selling line.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow. She also dreams to have her own outlet of the popular brands that she sells.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy advance orders from her direct selling line and additonal inventory for her variety store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, bags, and jewellery to sell.

loans.name: Gulzat's Group

texts.en:
Нынешнее время диктует свои условия и людям приходится каждый день совершать очень важные поступки и принимать важные решения, чтобы их дела шли вперёд. Порой эти решения диктуются чутьём, знаниями или интуицией. Результаты не заставляют себя ждать и рано или поздно человек начинает понимать, правильно ли он поступил или нет. Однако боязнь делать подобного рода шаги, совсем не помогает. Излишняя осторожность приводит к тому, что человек просто остаётся на месте. Герои нашей истории -  люди, которые принимают решения и не боятся их последствий. Алтымышова Гульзат – лидер данной группы. Гульзат живёт вместе с семьёй в г. Карабалта. К своим сорока годам, Гульзат имеет четверых детей. Все эти годы, прошли в кропотливом труде, чтобы достойно содержать семью и дать хорошее воспитание детям. Шесть лет назад Гульзат и её муж начали разводить скот, и параллельно продавать молоко. Это им удалось в результате огромного терпения , ведь им пришлось на протяжении многих лет откладывать средства, чтобы купить скот. Сейчас они уже приумножили поголовье скота, как крупно - рогатого, так и мелко – рогатого; успели также приобрести кое – какую бытовую технику. Сейчас их месячный доход составляет около четырёх тысяч сомов. Гульзат решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы закупить овец для разведения. Она уверена, что увеличение поголовья овец позволит ей в дальнейшем иметь больший доход от их перепродажи. 

Партнёры Гульзат по группе:

Усупбекова Анара – мать троих детей. Анаре пятьдесят лет. Её старшей дочери тридцать, а младшей дочери восемнадцать. Дети уже выросли и давно сами зарабатывают себе на жизнь. Анара до сих пор предпочитает не зависеть от детей и ведёт розничную торговлю продовольственными и товарами. Анара нуждается в кредите, который позволил бы ей закупить товар и увеличить товарооборот. 

Токтогоновой Алтынай шестьдесят лет. Она вдова. Алтынай с мужем вырастили пятерых детей. Все дети уже с давних пор живут самостоятельно. Алтынай вместе с сыном и снохой сейчас занимаются животноводством. Это занятие приносит Алтынай ежемесячно около пяти тысяч сомов. Алтынай обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить ещё одного бычка для содержания. 

Касмакунову Нурбеку тридцать четыре. Он отец двоих детей и чтобы содержать семью занимается перепродажей скота на рынке. Жена Нурбека работает на вино – водочном заводе. Нурбек нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить овец для перепродажи.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep in order to increase the number of livestock

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
EL Señor Luis Avilés López tiene 30 años y convive con la señora Costa Corrales Peña por más de 8 años total tiene 2 hijos dependientes de el, que estudian, El señor se dedica a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca,  papa liza y lleva a vender a la feria semanal de colomi, su esposa le ayuda en la producción agrícola aparte de ser como ama de casa y cuidado de sus animales. 
                                                                                                                                                                                       El señor Luis Avilés López vive hacia el norte de Colomi Segunda Candelaria sindicato Jatun Rumy zona rural, el crédito está sacando de CIDRE; El señor Luis Avilés López utilizara este crédito para compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) para agrandar más su producción agrícola.      
                                                                                                                                                              El señor Luis Avilés López nos comenta que su sueño es seguir mejorando sus recursos económicos así para que sus hijos sigan estudiando hasta salir profesionales, también mejorar su calidad de vivienda para vivir más cómodos con su familia; Por ultimo nos cuenta que sembrara en mas superficies sus cultivos de producción agrícola (aumento la producción), porque son los primeros de la canasta familiar a nivel Bolivia, a la vez es un recurso económico para mantener la seguridad alimentaria de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Avilés López is 30-years-old and has lived with Ms. Costa Corrales Peña for more than 8 years. He has two dependent children who are currently in school. Mr. Avilés López grows potatoes, broad beans, and root vegetables. He sells them at the weekly food market in Colomi. His wife helps him with the farming in addition to maintaining the house and taking care of the animals. Mr. Avilés López lives in the north of Colomi, Segunda Candelaria, in the rural township of Jatun Rumy. He is taking out the loan from CIDRE and he will use it to buy organic fertilizer (chicken manure) to enlarge his agricultural production. Mr. Avilés López tells us that his dream is to continue improving his economic resources so that his children can continue studying and become professionals. He'd also like to improve his quality of life to live more comfortably with his family. And, finally, he tells us that he will plant his crops on more productive areas because they are the primary component of a family's basic expenses in Bolivia as well as being an economic resource in maintaining the security and health of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma T. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Emma is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase pesticides and fertilizers. Emma is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to pay services extended by laborers plowing her corn field. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida lives in the historical city called Lahore in Pakistan. She is a housewife as well as a working woman. She operates a domestic sewing business to support her family financially.  She takes orders from the families of her community and stitches their clothes at reasonable charges.  

Her husband is also a very hard-working person. He operates a sanitary supplies sales business. He has a shop in the market and has a good customer base.   

Rashida has applied for a loan from Asasah to invest the loan amount in her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy the sanitary supplies such as taps, water pipes etc. in bulk and increases his household income and fulfill the larger orders on time.

loans.use: Purchase plumbing parts for resale

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren O. is 40 years old and lives with her three children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger (a traditional housing tent). Her three children attend a local middle school and the family has been living in the city for four years.

Lhagvasuren operates a food retailing business out of a small rented kiosk. She started her business in 2006 with the working capital of 100,000 MNT and since then, it has increased 6 times. Her business is very important to her and her family. She says, "My only wish is to be able to support my children to be better and well-educated people in the future”. Lhagvasuren is an easy going and hardworking woman who is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Kitondo United Farmers, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
Operating an agricultural farm has been an adventurous and paying business venture for Constance K.. She is aged 48 years and is from Kitondo village, Rukungiri. Being such a determined, energetic and a hardworking lady, she worked tirelessly to start up the poultry business alongside the sale of bananas, which are commonly used to prepare a local dish by customers here in Uganda.

She is so fond of her enterprise, thus is always able to earn 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings (about $682) monthly through doing her daily business transactions both inside and outside Uganda, like transporting her goods to Rwanda. 

This loan is to help her purchase chicken feeds and, furthermore, to expand the project to a large scale. This will help to improve Constance’s yields and production, thus leading to an increase in sales revenue, which will enable her to enjoy a self-sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: Purchase chicken feeds

loans.name: Pork

texts.en: Pork S., 44, is married and lives with her four children in Takeo province. She is a farmer, who works for less than US$1 each day, while her husband is a musician, making US$2 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Pork S. included. Pork S. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike for her family transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina B., age 52, works hard to cover her daily expenses. For the past ten years she has owned and run her own direct-selling clothes and shoes business. She often has trouble with customers who purchase goods on credit, not paying her for the orders they made, but she has still managed to generate a steady income stream from her business.

Carolina has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to help her purchase additional inventory, including new clothes, shoes, etc. She hopes that the loan will enable her to continue to meet customer demands and hopefully attract additional business.

Carolina has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) since 2005, and has consistently attended its weekly fellowship meetings.* She hopes that someday she will have her own house and be able to purchase a motorcycle tricycle so that her children can use it to generate additional income.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia S. is from the village of Bitnong Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 48 years old and is married with five adult children. Ofelia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ofelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Bitnong Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice K. runs a shop and is requesting a loan to stock more goods like bags of sugar and cartons of salt.  Alice is 45 years old and married to a business man. She has three children in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more goods like sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Dolores Del Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco La Nueva California.

La señora Dolores es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la tesorera  y le agrada el Banco por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero aun viven con ella, los dos estudian en la Universidad. Su esposo es profesor de colegio.
 
Se dedica a la venta productos Avon, Esica, Yanbal (artículos de belleza y perfumería). También vende  ropa y productos naturales,  lo que más vende es ropa intima de mujer que son muy solicitadas por las damas, trabaja todos los días unas cinco horas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, cobra semanalmente y dice que le encanta vender.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar mas mercadería. Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank, "Banco La Nueva California," meet every two weeks in the citadel La California de Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  It has been known for many years as the city of "Los Reales Tamarindos," (a stadium where football matches are held).

Dolores is a founding member of the communal bank.  She is the treasurer and likes the bank for the additional benefits offered by the institution and the ease of loans.  She is 51 years old, married, and has two children from this relationship who are now older but still live with her.  They both study at the university.  Her husband is a college professor.

She sells Avon products, ESIC, and Yanbal (beauty products and perfumes).  She also sells clothing and natural products.  What she sells the most is women's underwear that is sought after by the ladies.  She works every day for about five hours. Her form of selling is door to door, she pays weekly and says she loves to sell.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise.  Her dream is to see her children finish their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, clothing and natural products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy suitcases of different sizes.

loans.name: Mrs. Nhanh Mom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people in Trapeang Ronoung village in Takeo province are making up this village bank loan. Mrs. N. M. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members.  The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living.    

Mrs. N. M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Huot Brak, is a traditional medicine man and he is also a chicken breeder. Since her husband’s chicken breeding is going well, she wants to expand. Mrs. N. M. is applying for a loan to buy more chickens. 

She is 33 years old and has three children, one of whom is doing housework while the others are studying in public school.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
El señor Marcelo Q. tiene 30 años se encuentra casado con la señora America Quiroz Mences, tienen dos hijos pequeños uno de los cuales se encuentra estudiando en una escuelita de su zona el otro es todavía muy pequeño. Marcelo vive en  el barrio Copacachi ubicado en la provincia Quillacollo de Cochabamba. Él trabaja vendiendo periódico por las mañanas y el resto de su tiempo trabaja brindando servicios de transporte en su taxi y cuidando de su familia.

Marcelo es una persona joven trabajadora, se dedica a la venta diaria de los distintos matutinos locales y nacionales que circulan en la ciudad. Luego trabaja como taxista, el junto a su esposa pretenden alcanzar un mejor bienestar para sus hijos. Él quiere este préstamo para incrementar la mercadería con la que comercia y mejorar su herramienta de trabajo.

Marcelo entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para comprarse un lote de terreno y pueda construir su vivienda donde puedan habitar él y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Marcelo Q. is 30 years old and married to America Quiroz Mences.  They have two small children, one of whom is studying in a school in the neighborhood, while the other one is still very small.  Marcelo lives in the Copacahi neighborhood located in the Quillacollo province of Cochabamba.  He works selling newspapers in the mornings and the rest of his time he works providing transport services in his taxi and taking care of his family.  

Marcelo is a young, hardworking person, who sells the daily paper of the various local and national morning newspapers that circulate the city.  After working as a taxi driver, he and his wife intend to achieve better welfare for their children.  He is requesting a loan to increase the merchandise that he markets and improve his business tools.

Marcelo's future plans are to roll out a new loan to purchase a plot of land so that he can build a home where he and his family can live.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for his newspaper trading post.

loans.name: Susan Muthoni

texts.en:
Susan 33 years old and has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last six years.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for the next planting season.  

In the future, Susan hopes to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes U. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 65 years old. Lourdes is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a business operating tricycle transport services. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lourdes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lourdes from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Reyna Isabel A. S. ella es trabajadora activa del colegio público “Farabundo Martin” de Villa el Carmen desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Secundaria tiene Veinte y tres años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo solicita para realizarle cambio de techo a su hogar, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Reyna Isabel A. S. is a secondary school teacher for the "Farabundo Martin" high school in Villa el Carmen. She has been working for the school for 23 years. She is married and has two school-age children.

She has taken out seven previous loans through CEPRODEL, each of which she has used to purchase construction materials like sand, cement, stone, gravel, etc. She used the materials to expand and improve her house. She is requesting this loan to replace the roof of her home.

The CEPRODEL loans that Reyna has received have been of great benefit to her. With them, she has been able to improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like corrugated metal roofing, tiles, etc. (to replace the roof of her house)

loans.name: Gloria Liliam

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 41 años de edad, es soltera y sin hijos. Ella reside junto a sus padres y hermana en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo que ofrece a sus vecinos en una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio donde ofrece también productos de consumo diario, golosinas y bebidas como cerveza y gaseosas. Su negocio tiene una antigüedad de tres años y desde entonces con muy buena acogida, debido a la buena atención que ofrece a su clientela.

La creciente demanda que la bodega de Gloria ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, permitiéndole incrementar sus ingresos.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Gloria es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Gloria is 41 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She lives together with her parents and sister in Tambogrande district, an agricultural area in Piura province, in the region of the same name, which is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Gloria's business is selling cosmetics through catalogs.  She offers her products to her neighbors in a small store located in her home.  In her store she also offers her customers essentials, candy and drinks such as beer and sodas.  She has owned her business for three years and it is very popular owing to the good customer service that she provides.

The growing demand that Gloria's store is experiencing has led her to think of expanding it and acquiring more products.  This will allow her to increase her profits.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Gloria is a hard-working woman of good character.  Those who know her have a great deal of respect and affection for her.

loans.use: To buy more products to expand her store

loans.name: Santisima Trinidad Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama Santisima Trinidad, por motivos religuiosos, y se ubica en el estado de Puebla en Mexico. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Maria Y. es integrante del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de nieve, que inició hace 18 años. Solicita el prestamo para la compra de frutas de temporada y hielo para la elaboracion de nieve. Tiene 36 años, estudió hasta el 3 año de primaria. Es casada y tiene en total 3 hijos varones de 17, 11, y 4 años de edad. Sus clientes opinan que realiza una deliciosa nieve ya que la elabora con fruta natural, y además de lleverla hasta su domicilio, porque cuenta con un triciclo para su reparticion. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente alegre porque va a poder comprar su fruta y elaborar nieve con fruta de temporada y asi obtener mayores ganancias debido a que se avecina la temporada de calor. Tambien espera que sus ventas tengan crecimiento y obtener mayores ganancias y seguir apoyandoce economicamente para salir adelante  ya que decea que sus hijos sigan estudiando y logren una carrera profesional.
texts.en: The religion-minded members of this group call themselves Santisima Trinidad for the Holy Trinity.  The group is located in the Mexican state of Puebla and has 9 members.  Sra. Maria Y, a member of the group, has operated a business selling snowcones for 18 years.  She is applying for a loan so that she can buy seasonal fruits and ice to make snowcones.  Sra. Maria is 36 years old and has just 3 years of schooling.  She's married and has 3 children, 17-, 11- and 4-years old, respectively.  Her customers say that she makes delicious snowcones because she makes them with real fruit.  She also delivers the snowcones directly to her customers, on a pedacycle that she uses for deliveries.  She says that she is grateful for the loan because it will allow her to buy the supplies she needs to carry on her business and increase her income.  She expects her sales to increase because spring is around the corner and demand for her snowcones will go up as the weather gets hotter.  Your support will allow her to pay for her children's schooling and help the whole family to get ahead.

loans.use: Buy fruit and ice for snowcone business.

loans.name: Ariel Carlos

texts.es:
Ariel S.  de 28 años vive en el barrio La luz de Barranquilla, y tiene un punto comercial donde vende todo tipo de mercancía especialmente calzado , camisetas, papelería, variedades y detalles para regalos que amas de casa, jóvenes estudiantes y en general   pequeños  artículos que sus clientes compran al detalle. Ariel inició su idea emprendedora porque no encontró posibilidades de trabajar en una empresa y necesitaba generar ingreso para su familia, así  comenzó con la compra de productos para manualidades y útiles escolares y estos son los productos en los que actualmente debe realizar su mayor inversión, porque son de rápida rotación.
Este es el primer financiamiento con la Fundación Maro Santo Domingo y está aplicando a su credikiva con el cual comprará  útiles escolares, accesorios e insumos para manualidades, inversión que planea será exitosa,  porque son productos que no tiene  constantemente, porque cuenta  con un capital de trabajo muy pequeño, es así como con esta inversión estaría surtiendo  con mercancías que  sus clientes  solicitan y no habían encontrado respuesta. De esta manera Ariel estaría dando los primeros pasos,  para construír su sueño de tener mas adelante un almacén en el sector del centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, que es un punto de gran movimiento comercial.
texts.en:
Ariel S.  is 28 years old and lives in the neighborhood of La luz de Barranquilla. He has a commercial store where he sells all types of merchandise, especially shoes, T-shirts, paper products, a variety of options and retail items for gifts for housewives, school children and in general little items that retail customers buy. Ariel began his enterprising idea because he couldn't find options for work in a business and he needed to generate income for his family. That is how he began buying craft products, school supplies and these are the products in which he must make his largest investment because they have the fastest turnover rate.
This is his first financing with Fundación Maro Santo Domingo and he is applying to his credikiva in order to buy school supplies, accessories and craft supplies, an investment that he plans to be successful because they are products that he doesn't always have because he has a very small working capital. For this reason, with this investment he will be supplying merchandise that his customers request and have not been seen. In this way, Ariel will be taking the first steps towards his dream for the future to have a store in the center part of the city of Barranquilla, which is a place of great commercial movement.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, accessories and craft supplies.

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Chuon O. has been operating her own small business in the local market for years in Kompong Chhnang province. She sells various kinds of vegetables and makes a profit about $7.5 each day to help support in the whole family. She doesn’t have a life partner because her husband died of an illness several years ago. Presently, she has two children with her; one of them also sells vegetables in the market, and the other one is an unemployed man. In order to earn extra income and to make her business successful, Chuon O. is taking out her loan to use as capital to buy more vegetables for sale. With the rest of the funds, she will buy a boat for assisting her jobless son.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale and to buy a boat for assisting her jobless son

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She has operated a retail shop, for the past three years, in the market, whereby passersby and neighbours are her potential customers. Her husband is a shop keeper and he helps his wife in the shop. 

Mwanapili faces a major challenge in the high cost of paying the business permit license. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of rice, beans and coconuts to sell. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, beans and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza De Corcona Group

texts.es: Félix es el presidente de la Alcancía Comunal” La nueva esperanza de Corcona” es casado y tiene cuatro hijos que se encuentran estudiando, uno en la universidad, dos en academia preparatoria y uno  aun en la escuela. Félix es un buen hombre que junto a su esposa trabajan en el restaurante que se llama RESTAURANTE LIZ., en donde brindan desayuno, almuerzo y cena esta ubicado en plena carretera central por lo que nos manifiesta tiene comensales fijos y viajeros que pasan por su negocio. Félix nos cuenta que empezó hace 15 años vendiendo en una carretilla en forma ambulatoria  y luego de mucho esfuerzo se estableció. Con el préstamo invertirá en menaje y compras de insumos para su restaurante. El desea ampliar su restaurante para apoyar en la educación de sus hijos. Los socios de “La nueva esperanza de Corcona están agradecidos por apoyo incondicional.
texts.en:
Félix is the president of the community bank "La nueva esperanza de Corcona" [The new hope of Corcona].  He is married and has four children who are in school.  One is in college, two are in high school, and one is in lower school.  

Félix is a good man who works with his wife at their restaurant, called Restaurant Liz.  They serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  It is located on the main road, so they serve regular customers and travelers who pass by their business.  Félix started the business 15 years ago selling from a cart as a street vendor, and with a lot of effort, established his restaurant.  

With this loan, he will invest in kitchen items and food supplies for his restaurant.  He wants to expand the restaurant to be able to support his children's education.  

The members of "The new hope of Corcona" are thankful for the wholehearted support.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to expand his restaurant.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is from the village of Tupsan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old and widowed with six adult children. To make a living, Rosa owns a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies like rice cakes, instant noodles, breads and snack foods. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like rice, flour & eggs. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw needed ingredients like rice, flour & eggs

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Amina has a small retail shop, which she has run for five years.
To help expand her business, Amina has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Amina hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to build a poultry farm house.
Amina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri lives in village Sartichala, Kakheti Region. He lives with his wife Tamar and three children – 2 daughters (17 and 16 years old) and his 5-year-old son. 

Badri works as a driver in a local company. Also he helps Tamar in their family-owned dairy farm. They have two milk cows, which give them approximately 20 liters of milk per day. From the milk Tamar makes approximately 55 kg of cheese per month and sells it on the local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris, including Badri’s salary. This amount isn’t enough for the family to provide their children and themselves with all necessary books, toys and household goods. 

Badri requested credit to purchase an additional milk cow and calves. With three cows, Tamar will be able to produce and sell 50% more cheese. The calves will be raised and sold in fall for an increased price. 

An increase in income will allow the family to purchase more goods for their children and more household items, which will improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and two calves for the dairy farm.

loans.name: Koli Aminatou

texts.fr: Agée de 26ans et maman de 02 enfants, Koli est à son second cycle de prêt et vend des produits de premières  nécessités (huile, sucre, riz, tomate, cube) à domicile. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Lomé et a démarré en 2005. Elle veut cet argent pour renforcer son activité afin d’assurer son devoir de femme au ménage. Son conjoint est revendeur.
texts.en: Koli is 26 years old and the mother of two children. She is on her second loan cycle and sells basic necessities (oil, sugar, rice, tomatoes, bouillon cubes) at home. She gets her supplies from the market in Lomé and started this activity in 2005. She wants to use the money to strengthen her business and fulfill her duties as housewife. Her spouse is a reseller.

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA GENERACION III”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elva; la socia tiene 37 años de edad, la socia es casado, La socia tiene 2 hijos 7, 1 y medio años de edad; La socia es docente de profesión la socia labora en la provincia de Paucartambo, ella trabaja con sus propios recursos en cuanto a la compra de materiales didácticos que ella misma se provee para demostraciones, la socia  desea invertir el crédito en la compra de  1 libro didáctico y de materiales para este trimestre del año.  La socia es docente de secundaria. La socia desea el crédito para poder comprar materiales para elaborar actividades en grupo y 1 libro.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Elva is a member of the "Nueva Generación III" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Elva is 37 years old, married, and has two children aged 7 and 18 months.  She is a teacher by profession and works in Paucartambo province.  She works with her own resources.  When it comes to giving demonstrations, she buys and provides the materials herself.  She would like to invest her loan in buying one educational book and materials for this term (semester).  She is a high school teacher.  She would like this loan to buy materials for preparing group activities, and one book.

Elva is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy materials for preparing group activities, and one book

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry business selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of disease outbreak in her poultry business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Saroueng

texts.en: Saroueng, 35 year old, is working in a factory with her husband. Their income is $6 per day. She has one child who is studying. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $25 on transportation, and $35 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy Khmer skirts to sell in the factory where she is working. In the future, she wants to get a tailoring shop for herself, so that she can take care of her children and property at home. She will work hard to send her children to study at the university.

loans.use: To buy Khmer skirts to sell in the factory

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 38 years old; married to Agnes. They are blessed with three children aged twelve, six and two years. He has been a mechanic for the past ten years with the monthly income of 30,000 Kes. which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan from KADET. He will use the loan to buy vehicle spare parts which will boost his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open other mechanical branches which will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Mujeres Empresarias Group

texts.es: Susana tiene 34 D. edad y su familia está conformada por ella su esposo y 03 hijos que en la actualidad depenD. D. ellos. Susana se dedica a la venta ambulatoria D. mazamorra, la cual lleva aproximadamente 02 años dedicándose a dicha actividad, esta idea surgió con la idea D. querer progresar es por ello que  Susana toma la decisión D. emprender su propio negocio, también nos cuenta que se dedica a la confección  D. tejidos  D. chompas, carteras, chalinas, entre otros, la cual trabaja sobre pedidos. Susana tiene como meta instalar una bodega en su domicilio donD. ofrezca productos D. primera necesidad, pues sabe que D. este modo generaría  mayores ingresos. Con el fin D. mejorar su economía  Susana solicito su último préstamo para la compra D. insumos D. la preparación D. mazamorras como maíz, arroz, leche, azúcar, etc. La alcancía comunal “Mujeres Empresarias” es un grupo conformado por 07 socios comprometidos con el Programa- Prosperidad.La señora Magna no pudo estar presente en el desembolso por motivo D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Susana is 34 years old and her family consists of herself, her husband and 3 children who are currently dependent on them. Susana is a street vendor of mazamorra [corn pudding], an activity which she has been doing for approximately 2 years. The idea came about with the thought of wanting to progress, which is why Susana decided to start her own business. 

She also tells us that she knits sweaters, purses, scarves and other things, which she makes upon request. Susana has a goal of establishing a store in her home that offers basic necessities, since she knows that she will generate a better income that way. With the goal of improving her finances, Susana's latest loan request is for buying ingredients to prepare mazamorra such as corn, rice, milk, sugar, etc. 

The communal bank "Mujeres Empresarias" is a group composed of 7 members partnered with the program Prosperidad. Magna was unable to be present for this loan due to work-related reasons.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья замужем, ее дети уже взрослые и самостоятельные. Наталья из Каховки. Там она работает на местном городском рынке в продуктовых рядах, торгуя продуктами питания, а именно кондитерскими изделиями и сладостями. Наталья всегда реализует только свежие сладости по доступной цене. Свое дело открыла еще 6 лет назад. На сегодняшний день у нее товара на сумму 10 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль составляет 6 000 гривен. 

Наталье необходим кредит в 12 000 гривен для приобретения дополнительного количества кондитерских изделий для последующей розничной реализации. Полученную прибыль Наталья планирует использовать для последующего реинвестирования в свое дело, а часть – на разные семейные нужды и обустройство быта.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Natalya is married, and all of her children are grown and independent now.  Natalya is from Kahovka.  She works there at the local city market in the food rows, selling food products, specifically, confectionery goods and sweets.  Natalya always sells only fresh sweets at affordable prices.  She started her own business six years ago.  Today, she has merchandise valued at 10,000 hryvnia.  Her net profit is 6,000 hryvnia.  Natalya needs a loan in the sum of 12,000 hryvnia to buy an additional quantity of confectionery goods for future retail sale.  She plans to invest part of the resulting profit back into her business and use part of the profit for various family needs and living arrangements.

loans.use: to buy an additional quantity of confectionery goods for future retail sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en: Melitona is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Melitona has a tailoring shop that makes and sells wedding gowns, uniforms and dresses for special occasions. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw materials like fabric and needles. Melitona is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Melitona hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like fabric and needles.

loans.name: Yosra

texts.en:
Yosra is a 65-year-old woman.  She is married and has two sons and three daughters.  Her husband has a decent pension from the Palestinian National Authority.   Yosra has a grocery store and wants to improve its conditions by purchasing more groceries for sale, but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she needs to take a loan in the amount of $2,000 from FATEN. 

When Yosra gets the loan, she will be able to purchase more groceries and have more products to sell.  This will improve her grocery store positively and increase her income, which will enable her to provide better living conditions for her family. 

Yosra is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in her grocery store.

loans.use: buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Berta Colombina

texts.es:
Berta Colombina tiene 75 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo de treinta años de edad en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC Vuelve la Esperanza está conformada por 13 socios y socias, está ubicada en la Parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la Oficina.
Berta se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, soya y cacao las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, insumos, urea, abonos agrícolas, líquidos para la maleza para los cultivos.
Con la ayuda del crédito mejorara  y aumentará la producción para obtener mejores ingresos.
El sueño es llegar a comprar más hectáreas de terreno para así tener más productos para ofertar.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta diariamente es la competencia entre comerciantes, vías de comunicación, las enfermedades.
En los tiempos libres le gusta caminar por el capo es tranquila, responsable, honrada, trabajadora y le gusta disfrutar de los carnavales.
texts.en:
Berta Colombina, 75, is married and has a son; she lives with her 30-year-old son in Chillanes, Bolívar Province. 

The “Vuelve la Esperanza” (Hope Returns) communal bank has 13 members, both men and women, and is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from the Office.

Berta is a corn, soya and cocoa bean farmer.  Her purchases and her sales take place in San José del Tambo every weekend.

She is asking for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, supplies, urea, farm manure and weed killers for the crops.

With help from the loan she will improve and increase production and earn better income.  

His dream is to buy more hectares of land to have more products to offer for sale.

The challenges she faces daily are competition among merchants, the roads and illnesses.

In her free time she likes wandering through the countryside.  She is tranquil, responsible, honest and hardworking and enjoys the carnivals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en:
Nelyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Nelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Nelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Nelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Laban

texts.en:
Laban has operated his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last year.  He is 47 years old, married to Margaret, and has four school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more goods to sell in his retail shop.

In the future, Laban hopes to expand his retail shop to wholesale and later open a supermarket, thereby becoming one of the leading businessmen in the area.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell in his retail shop.

loans.name: Rusebil

texts.en:
Rusebil is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Rusebil is making and peddling snacks like sweet potato and banana cue. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy sweet potatoes and bananas for making snacks. Rusebil has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Rusebil hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes and bananas for making snacks

loans.name: Lumiere Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe LUMIERE sont  toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de chaussures à travers Madame MARIAM, en deuxième position à partir de la gauche. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt des matières premières : 20 kg de guéni et 10 bidons d’eau déodorant. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso.
Après transformation de ces matières en l’encens, elle les vend sur le marchés de SIKASSO et en famille à une clientèle composée principalement de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle
texts.en:
The four members of the LUMIERE group are all married with an average age of 36 and an average of five children. For the most part, they live in polygamist families in Hamdallaye, a popular suburb of Sikasso. 

They are on their eighth loan with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet the needs of their clients. 

This group of women has a business dealing shoes through Mrs. Mariam, the second from the left. With her loan, she plans to buy some raw materials : 20 kg of guéni and 10 cans of deodorant water. She purchases materials from a large market in Sikasso. After turning these materials into incense, she will sell it in the markets in Sikasso and to family to a clientele mainly made of women. 

She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA which she will use for daily family expenses. She hopes to increase her business to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make incense.

loans.name: Kinbongin Group

texts.fr:
Mme Rasmata  est la représentante du groupe KINBONGIN. Elle est  célibataire  et mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé  a 20ans et  le moins âgé a 03ans. 04 vont  à l’école. Elle a 07 personnes  en charge.

Elle vend du jus de bissaps, jus de gingembre (gnamakou) et des légumes depuis 01an. Elle s’approvisionne  à Laafie yaar en ville. Ses clients sont  les femmes, les hommes et enfants.

Elle veut  s’acheter  01sac de bissaps, 01sac de sucre et 05 plats de gingembre.

 Mme épargne ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne  agrandir son affaire et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Rasmata is the representative for the Kinbongin Group.  She is a single woman and the mother of five children from ages 3 to 20.  Four of the children are in school. She has seven dependents.

For one year, she has been selling hibiscus flowers, ginger juice (gnamakou) and vegetables.  She buys her stock in town at Laafie Yaar [market]. Her customers are men, women, and children.

She would like to purchase one sac of hibiscus flowers, one sac of sugar, and five flats of ginger.

Rasmata saves her profits.  She aspires to grow her business and ensure her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase one sac of hibiscus, one sac of sugar, and five flats of ginger.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 33 years old. He is married to Everline and they have six children of the following ages: 15, 10, 10, eight, six, and four years, respectively. 

He does motorbike repair and has been in business for seven years. Right now his monthly income is KES 10,000. 

He is taking out his first loan of KES 20,000, with which he wants to purchase 10 litres of oil and brake fluid. He plans to use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to boost his business by purchasing 10 litres of oil and brake fluid.

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Her name is Precilla, aged 47, from Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Ever since her husband died she has focused on  raising her family. Her being a widow did not cause to settle where she is, she worked hard to provide for the education of her children.

Her main source of livelihood is her "carinderia" which is a local eatery that sells and serves viands with wooden benches. She is now requesting an amount of Php 9000 to buy meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings to cook, sell and serve affordable viands for the masses. She trusts for your positive response and wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Precilla aims for her "carideria" to become a restaurant someday. She dreams for her youngest child to finish her College Education to allow her better opportunities in life.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies .

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: To pay for fresh meat, veggies and seasonings to prepare dishes to sell at her food stall

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca sells charcoal to a large number of people and institutions within her locality. These institutions include schools, clinics and small enterprises in her vicinity. Rebecca experienced high sales during the Christmas festivities. She wants Kiva loan of $1150 to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital to expand her charcoal selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Young Rolando has been farming for the past 7 years. Each day he is gaining more experience in the cultivation of rice which is the most profitable crop in this region.

Rolando wants to use the money to purchase farming implements in order to be more productive in the short growing season.

Currently, Rolando is single with no children. He lives in a house made out of reed. He has live there for the past 25 years. His dreams are to one day have more land to farm and to work on improving his home by making it more stable. He plans to do this with a lot of effort and dedication!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Rolando es un joven agricultor en la cual se a dedicado a la agricultura desde hace 7 anos ganando cada día mas experiencia en el manejo del cultivo de arroz, ya que en esta zona la producción de dicho cultivo es rentable.

Rolando necesita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas en su totalidad, para manejar el cultivo de ciclo corto de la manera mejor correspondida, ya que solamente dedicaría el préstamo netamente para la agricultura.

Actualmente Rolando es soltero donde no a llegado a procrear hijos, donde su vivienda es de estructura de cana, que en la actualidad tiene viviendo 25 anos. Sus objetivos es llegar a tener mayor cantidad de tierras y así producir más, a más de mejorar netamente su vivienda para una mayor estabilidad, con esfuerzo y dedicación.

loans.use: Farming supplies to cultivate rice

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine S. is 48 years old, married, and has 7 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, in Nigeria. She sells groundnuts, onions, and sweet potatoes to her community. She will need a loan to purchase more goods for sale, and will be grateful if her request is granted.

loans.use: To invest on my business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase live pigs

loans.name: Feride

texts.en: Feride M. (her employee is pictured) owns a small market in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. She is a single 53-year-old businesswoman. Feride has already successfully repaid three prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit, which shows that she is a trusted and valued client. She is currently requesting a loan of $1,000 so that she can increase and diversify her inventory.

loans.use: To increase and diversify her inventory

loans.name: Sophun

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Sophun, 52, has been married for 15 years to her second husband.  Between the two of them they have several children, but only one still lives at home with her husband and young son. Also under their care are one granddaughter and Sophun's elderly mother. Since they are older, Sophun and her husband now mainly take care of the family and tend their fruit trees. They also raise cows. Sophun's granddaughter, 20, and daughter, 28, are two of the primary supporters now as they have secure jobs in the local garment factory.  

Sophun is requesting her third loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $500. She will use this loan, in addition to other money she has saved, to purchase supplies for improvements to their home. Previous loans were used for similar purposes and to build a cow shed. With this new loan, Sophun hopes to purchase the necessary bricks, rebar and concrete needed to further enclose the open first floor of their modest stilt home. They will also pour a concrete slab floor in place of bare earth. This new space will allow the seven family members to live together with more privacy and comfort.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Nabweru North A-2078(V) Group

texts.en:
Florence is 35 years old and married with five children and two dependents. She has a beauty salon. With the extra business profits, she intends to pay school fees for the children. Aida and Josephine are both poultry farmers and they want to purchase more poultry birds with the loan.

Note: This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics, wall mirrors and hair dryers.

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat O. is  married and has 3 children. She lives in Mushin in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells drinks and clothes. She is 35 years old. She has been a LAPO member for the past 3 years. She is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more drinks and clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more ready made clothes for sale

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam A. S. is from a small lush green town of Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She is married with seven kids: one boy and six girls. All of her kids are studying at local schools. It is her great desire and passion that all her kids finish their schooling and can become successful. Her husband is an auto mechanic and runs a small auto spare parts shop.

Mariam is a group leader of few other women, who are her neighbors and fellow entrepreneurs: Zubaida M. is borrowing for their motorcycle rental, Shamim B.’s husband runs a furniture store, Seema B. will invest her loan to fix her husband’s taxi, and Sughran Sadiq wants to buy a cow.

This is a group loan and the funds will be distributed among all group members.

loans.use: Expand spare parts shop

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Mrs. Yolanda L. F. belongs to the "Eucalyptus Communal Bank". She lives in the San Martin Region, San Martin Provence, Tarapoto District. She resides in Jr. Progreso #172, where her grocery store is also located. The communal bank loans have allowed her to start and grow her business. She is planning to increase her business with school supplies and groceries that she lacked to cover the needs of her customers. With the 500.00 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which she will pay back in 4 months, Mrs. L. will buy: sack of rice and sugar, toilet paper, soft drinks and othe products to supply. She is 48 years old, lives with her husband and 3 children who help her with customer service and house chores. That way she has time for her personal things.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Yolanda L. F. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Progreso Nº 172, donde también se ubica su negocio de venta de abarrotes – bodega. Los préstamos del Banco Comunal le han permitido implementar su negocio y seguir creciendo, tiene planificado incrementar su negocio con pasamanería y útiles escolares y abarrotes que le faltan para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Con el crédito por S/. 500.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: sacos de arroz, azúcar, papel higiénico, gaseosas y otros productos para surtir. La señora Yolanda tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, quienes le ayudan en la atención al cliente y en los quehaceres del hogar, por lo que ella tiene tiempo también para hacer sus cosas personales.

loans.use: Buying more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah S., fifty one years old, is a wife and mother of five children who are currently in school. In the community market, Hannah sells palm oil, corn dough, onion, pepper, vegetable oil and other products. Hannah is driven to work by her vision of a better future for her children.  Her warmness and kindness is admired by all members of her community, the Acherensua Batch 1. On numerous occasions, she has lent a helping hand to those struggling. Now, in her time of need, she desperately needs your help. Using your loan, Hannah will be able to by more products, increasing her revenue. Finally, her community promises to repay the loan. Please help Hannah. Donate now, for a better tomorrow.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of palm oil, vegetable oil, pepper and onion.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mr. Leng S. is a subsistence farmer in Snam Pok village in Kampong Speu province. He is also a construction worker. He does not have enough plow equipment and needs some draft animals. Thus, he is applying for a loan in order to buy two cows to plow his rice field. His wife, Mrs. Kheng Rin, is also a farmer. Mr. Leng S. is 33 and is the father of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while four others are attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or enroll in school. His wife is also pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows to plow the rice field

loans.name: Kai

texts.en:
Kai T. lives with her husband, Mao Eng, in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She has been traveling around and selling a traditional Khmer food made from rice, pork, vegetables, and a fish sauce for the last eighteen years. They have four children who are all married and employed locally, selling fruit, rice, etc.

Kai T. makes her traditional Khmer dish that she walks around and sells locally. Her husband works at a rubber company and makes $3.30 USD each day. However, rising inflation has forced the family to look for ways to increase and diversify their income.

Kai T. and her husband would like to venture into an ice business and begin to sell ice to local restaurants. She has asked for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase a car to distribute the ice to customers. She believes that this business venture can increase the income that the family will generate. She looks forward to the opportunities that this loan presents and would like to see her family’s standard of living improved.

loans.use: Purchase vehicle to distribute ice in their new business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina is a member of the Banco Comunal Manantial community bank.

Paulina is married, is 39 years old and has 2 children. Paulina runs a cafe within the Señor de Agonia school that is located near her home. She pays a monthly rent for the space. She sells sweets, fruits and food. She depends on her daughters' help because she runs the business from 7a.m. to 8pm every day from Monday to Friday.

Paulina requests a loan in the amount of 1050 soles. These funds will be invested in the purchase of pots and pans, cutlery, and various sweets.

Paulina's dreams is to have a more stable business, and one that is less labour intensive but still enough to be able to provide her children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.

Paulina es casada, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Paulina tiene un cafetín dentro de la escuela Señor de Agonía que esta ubicado cerca de su domicilio, por el cual paga una renta mensual, donde vende golosinas, frutas y comida, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijas, actividad que realiza desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, de lunes a viernes.

Paulina necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas, platos, cubiertos, golosinas variadas.

Los sueños de Paulina son tener un negocio estable, menos trabajoso y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Paulian requests a loan in the amount of 1050 soles.  These funds will be invested in the purchase of pots and pans, cutlery, and various sweets.

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en: Zaki is 57 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in a small village close to Nabatieh located in Southern Lebanon. Zaki owns a small bakery that attracts many clients from the region. He has requested a loan of $US1,000 to fund his purchase of ingredients for his tasty treats. This is Zaki's seventh time requesting a loan from Al Majmoua. Zaki has consistently repaid his monthly installments in full and on time.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for bakery products

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en: Maleyka M. is 43 years old. She is married and has three daughters. Her husband has no fixed job, so Maleyka must work to support her family's needs.
