For 12 years she has rented a place in the local bazaar where she sells women's clothes, underwear, and socks. She gets help from her children, who take care of the store in the afternoon. Thanks to her hard work, her customers have increased. She is now requesting a loan of $1000 USD, which she will use to buy new clothing for the winter season. Maleyka is thankful for your generosity and help.

loans.use: To buy new clothing for the winter season

loans.name: Various Services Group

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn thị N. năm nay 45 tuổi Ms 01030004 là một phụ nữ rất năng động, hàng ngày chị làm nghề sửa chữa xe máy và chồng chị là thợ cắt tóc. Hiện tại chị có 2 con đi làm công nhân nên mức thu nhập của gia đình chị cũng khá ổn định từ 200.000VNđ/ ngày. Chị và nhóm đã tham gia vay vốn qua 2 chu kỳ đèu trả rất tốt, chị rất thích hình thức vay trả này vì nó giúp chị được trả dần, đồng thời tiết kiệm tiền để lo cho con cái chị có công việc làm ổn định. Chu kỳ này chị đăng ký vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua phụ tùng về bán và sửa chữa xe máy. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên như sau:
  Chị Đặng thị N. Ms 01030001 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để kinh doanh và sửa chữa điện thoại .
 Chị Lê thị Quý Ms 01030003 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để kinh doanh hàng ăn sáng. 
 Chị Đặng thị ngọc Thanh Ms 01030005 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua đồ sửa chữa máy tính.
 Chị Nguyễn thị H. Ms 01030035 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để kinh doanh và bán nước giải khát.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Nguyen, 45 years old, is a hardworking woman. She works as a motorscooter mechanic and her husband works as a barber. Currently they have two children who are working as factory workers, so their income is relatively stable at 200,000 VND per day. She and the group has been participating in the Fund for two cycles, and have done well in repaying their loans. She very much enjoys this method of borrowing and repayment, since it allows her to repay slowly while saving money to care for her children and make sure they can work steadily. In this round of funding she registered to borrow 4,704,000 VND to buy equipment to fix and sell motorscooters. Her group also includes: Mrs. N. Thi Dang, borrowing 4,704,000 VND to do business in fixing telephones; Mrs. Quy Thi Le, borrowing 4,704,000 VND to do business buy running a breakfast service; Mrs. Ngoc Thanh Thi Dang, borrowing 4,704,000 VND to computer repair equipment; Mrs. Hoa Thi Nguyen, borrowing 4,704,000 VND to do business selling beverages.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: motorscooter repair, telephone/computer repair, breakfast/beverage sales

loans.name: Yann

texts.en:
Mrs. Yann H., 44, who sells groceries in her home in Kompongkdey Commune, Siem Reap Province, is married to Mr. Roueng Chok, 45, a fisherman. They have three children, two of whom are students while the third is a construction worker currently earning an income of $2 per day.

Yann is now seeking a loan of $150 to purchase more groceries to sell. Her husband and daughter are pictured because she was not available.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Khut's Group

texts.en:
There are four members in this group loan. Mrs. Khut N. is the leader of the group. She is married with two children, who attend school.  She is 35 years old and makes a living by selling fresh coconut in her area of Psakroam Market in the Siem Reap Province, where tourists stay to visit Angkor Wat Temple. She buys coconuts from villagers and then sells them. She earns approximately $5 a day. Her husband, Mr. Noun Dara, is a trailer-motorcycle (tuk tuk) taxi driver who earns about $7 per day. To expand her business, N. seeks a loan to buy more coconuts to sell. 

The other borrowers are:
Rours T., 47, makes a living by selling Khmer cake. She is applying for a loan to purchase construction materials for her husband's business.
Ros S. is 31 years old.  She sells cakes and is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to make cakes to sell.
Keoun Choeun, 51, is a cake wholesaler. She is applying for a loan to expand her business. 

The borrowers live in Salakomreuk Commune in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Amavi G. est une jeune femme revendeuse de charbons et des légumes et fruits au grand marché de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants tous à l’école. Elle désire avec ce crédit se réapprovisionner afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle sans cesse exigeante.
texts.en:
Amavi G. is a young woman, a retailer of charcoal, vegetables, and fruit at the grand marketplace in Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is 35, married, and the mother of two children, who are in school. She would like to do better in meeting the needs of her ever-demanding customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruit, and charcoal for resale

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Mrs. Vanna U. is a villager in Thlork Roling village in Kampong Chhnang province. She owns a small store and sells coffee. She is a 42 year-old widow with a child who helps the mother business. Mrs. Vanna U. is applying to a loan so that she can buy a printer for her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a printer for her business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Mrs.Juliet Pepania of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, is 29 years old and married, with two children. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 1999 and is engaged in fish vending. Her husband is a fisherman.

Having completed her 9th loan, she is requesting a new loan of twenty thousand pesos  Php 20,000.00 ). She requests the additional capital to purchase fish in volume at a lower cost. The increased profits along with her husbands income will enable them to send their children to school and finish college in the future.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing nets and additional capital for fish vending

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Riffat Rasheed Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Riffat baji is a 38-year-old married lady who has lived in a city named Kot Radha Kishan for the past 18 years. Her husband, R. A., has a brick-selling business. He has been in this profession for the past 5 years. Riffat baji is the mother of six kids: three sons and three daughters. None of her children go to school. Riffat baji makes and embroiders dresses to order and earns income. Her elder daughter helps her make embroidered dresses. She successfully repaid her past three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to expand her husband’s brick-selling business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Maqbool baji, Razia baji and Rashida baji each want a loan to buy bricks to sell. Rasoolan baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bricks to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La Sra.: SONIA,  es socia nuestra, ella es natural de la provincia de Urubamba, está ubicado a 1 hora y 20 minutos del departamento de Cusco.

L a socia tiene 29 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos de (9, 6, 4, 1) años, ella es casada y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de fruta en el mercado central de la provincia de Urubamba, ella compra al por mayor la fruta de los dueños de cultivos frutales en la provincia de Quillabamba cada 2 semanas.

La socia esta muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia was born and raised in Urubamba province, an hour and twenty minutes outside of Cusco. She is 29 years old, married, and has 4 children, who are 1, 4, 6, and 9 years old. As well as taking care of the home, Sonia sells fruit in Urubamba's central market. She buys her produce from farmers in Quillabamba province every 2 weeks. This loan will be used to buy fruit in larger quantities at once. Sonia is grateful for this loan and is committed to paying off her debt on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Adewumi

texts.en:
Adewumi sells kerosene and provisions. She is 35 years old and married with three children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria.

Adewumi is requesting a loan for the amount of 50,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says, "Thank you."

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Razia Amanuel Masih Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is a wife of A. M. and resides in a two-room brick house in a city named Vehari, Pakistan. Her husband runs a clothes-selling business. He has three years of experience in this business. He buys clothes from Lahore, a city famous for its varieties, and sells in his native city of Vehari. Razia baji operates an embroidery business, preparing embroidered dresses to order to earn income. She is applying for a loan to buy clothes to expand her husband’s clothes-selling business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her area. Asifa baji wants a loan to buy bed sheets to sell. Irshad baji and Nasreen baji each want a loan to buy sewing machines for sewing clothes. Sarafeen baji wants a loan to buy medicines to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is 24 years old and lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their two children. Adel has been working as an aluminum distributor for four years and has requested a US$1500 loan -his first loan- from A. Majmoua to do some maintenance work on his van.

Adel is a particularly speciA. businessman because he is very punctuA.. His main clients are aluminum stores. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties and decided to set up this business based on his good reputation as a worker. He plans on improving his business further in future.

loans.use: Adel will use the loan to do some maintenance work on his van.

loans.name: Otabek

texts.en: T. Otabek is 50 years old and lives in Shahristan town with his wife who helps him with the living expenses. Otabek has two children who also help him. For seventeen years he has worked his land which produces potatoes and onions. His greatest dream is to be able to establish more crops to that he can leave equal parts to his children. He started farming when his parents taught him to work in this way. Otabek is requesting financing to be able to buy supplies to apply to his crops in order to get a good yield and sell more in the market. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
At her age, which is 55 years old, Carmelita has to earn money to save for her future because she is single. She also has to earn enough money to take care of her mother who is very old. She is one in charge of looking after her mother, and they live together with no one else to share the responsibility. However, Carmelita's membership in ASHI is a great opportunity that changed her perception towards life and being single. Now she has a lot friends in ASHI and she has found a family where she belongs. Aside from the opportunity of having a business, she also found the opportunity to release her burdens by sharing them with her co-members. This is what encourages Carmelita to go on.  

Carmelita S. started her dressmaking business ten years ago. This was the only livelihood she knew then, until she was encouraged by women in their community to try direct selling of Avon cosmetics. Her loan from ASHI, when she became a member in 2008, gave her the option of trying this business. She realized then that her new found business was good and she enjoys doing it. She makes large profits and she has had the opportunity of meeting and dealing with a lot of people within and outside her village. Therefore, she wants to increase this business by continuing with the loans from ASHI. She will be able to reach to more people when she has more capital to purchase more Avon products. Furthermore, if her business will create larger profits, she can offer a better life for her mother while she is alive.

loans.use: To purchase more Avon (company that sells cosmetics) products to sell.

loans.name: Gleen

texts.en: Gleen M. is from the village of Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Gleen owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily financing and harvesting mangoes for sale. Gleen has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 12,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Gleen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and pesticides. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva A. is from the village of Poblacion, Sagay Camiguin. She is 48 years old and married with 12 children. To make a living, Eva owns a sari-sari (variety) shop.  Eva has run the shop for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

Eva joined HSPFI earlier this year to gain access to financial services that would help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a 4000 PHP loan and is now requesting a second loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell so she can improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her sari-sari shop.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
At the age of 43 Imelda C. is the mother of six children. For her, having a big family is not easy but being a responsible mother, Imelda is doing her best to maintain her family and provide them with their important necessities, especially their need for education. Her husband is Florentino, who is 48 years old and works as a farmer.

Her dream is to have a growing business and a higher net income to provide for the needs of her children, especially the four who are currently studying. Through her general store, she is able to provide daily allowances for the four children and also help support their daily immediate needs. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP8,000 from KIVA lenders as additional capital for her general store.  She hopes that through the loan her business will grow further.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Renka Group

texts.en:
This is Mariatu K., Ibrahim K., Aminata T. and Isatu T.. They named their group Renka group.   They are local entrepreneurs in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva Lenders. With this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses, make better sales and consequently improving their living standards. With the profit they make, they can better look after themselves and their children.  They will use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees.  They will also use it to feed and clothe themselves and their children.    To achieve these, they are requesting a loan of Le 500,000.00 for each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Mariatu K. is the leader of the group. She is forty-five years of age. She was born in a village called Wala Maboleh, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a farmer and they have three children. Two of her children are in secondary schools and one is already married. Mariatu sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), bread and fried cakes. She has been a businesswoman for over twenty years now. With this loan, she will buy forty gallons of palm-oil, five gallons of vegetable oil, one bag of sugar and one bag of flour.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Benkadi. Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 2 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à Kokouna un des villages de la commune rurale  de Loulouni, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur deuxième  prêt. Le précédent a été bien remboursé. 
Elles font la vente de poissons fumés, de cous- cous et de condiments alimentaires.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 1panier et ½ de poissons fumés,  200kg de sorgho, 25kg de sucre et 6 paquets de condiments alimentaires.  Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Loulouni ville et les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent aux marchés de Loulouni, Dallen et à domicile, au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille; l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un endroit pour leur vente.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra es una mujer perseverante y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 39 años, es madre de un hijo menor de edad. Sandra se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y a la crianza y venta de pollos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es trabajador independiente. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Innovadoras” desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que invirtió en la compra de ropa interior para damas, en la actualidad Sandra necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar productos de belleza y artículos de lencería. Su sueño es tener una tienda de prendas de vestir bien surtido.
texts.en:
Sandra is a dynamic and persistent woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in Ucayali region. She is 39 years old and the mother of a dependent child. She sells beauty products and breeds chickens for sale. Sandra has the support of her husband who is self-employed.

She joined the Communal Bank “Las Innovadoras” (The Innovators) three years ago. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy ladies’ undergarments. At the moment, Sandra is requesting a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy beauty products and lingerie. She dreams of owning a clothing store that is well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products & lingerie

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Mrs. Nary S., age 28 (shown in the picture with her husband) and her husband, Mr. Sopheap So, age 29, have been married since 2003 and have two children. Both of them are still young and have not yet started their education. They live in a small village on National Road number 2 about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Nary has been a garment factory worker for seven years, while her husband has been a driver for a company for three years. By the way, the couple is in the process of building a new house, but they lack some money to finish it. Therefore, Nary is requesting her first loan of $1,000 in order to finish  the house.

loans.use: To finish building her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate her business place

loans.name: Lidia Mercedes

texts.es: Lidia Mercedes tiene la actividad económica de mercadería en general. Ella tiene 44 años de edad, por lo que siempre le ha gustado ganarse la vida de una manera muy humilde y lo realiza con esta actividad que es su medio de vida. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que fue su principal fuente de ingresos que obtuvo para su familia  esta señora es muy responsable y además le gusta mucho su trabajo. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para pantalones, camisas, faldas shorts, sabanas, cosméticos y toallas ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y le gustaría ofrecer de todo un poco. Ella sueña con seguir trabajando con su negocio ya que  es muy importante.
texts.en:
Lidia Mercedes' economic activity is to sell general merchandise. She is 44, she has always liked earning a living in a humble way and she does it through this activity. She has worked in this business for more than six years, it's the main source of income for her family, this lady is very responsible and she likes her job. The loan requested is for working capital to puchase pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, sheets, cosmetics and towels, holiday season approaches and she would like to offer a little bit of everything. She dreams to continue on working in her business because it is very important for her.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 32 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband and to provide for the children. Mary is a food vendor. She prepares and sells doughnuts. She buys bags of flour from nearby towns. Mary has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing O. is married with five children. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. Her husband is a carpenter. She is 40 years old. She sells drinks and groceries such as milk, noodles, bread, biscuits, and toothbrushes. Blessing says her business is not moving as expected due to a financial setback that affected her family recently. She needs a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.)  Blessing says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Nos

texts.en: Nos S. R., 39, is a fish seller who started her business more than eight years ago. She has a partner in her husband, who works as a domestic carpenter. The couple has been married many years, and they have three young school-aged children. Nos S. R. always uses her old motorcycle to deliver fish to the market.  Unfortunately her motorcycle is prone to breakdowns.  To solve this problem,  Nos S. R. has requested a loan to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the broken one. Not: Nos S. R. was busy selling her fish when the photo taken so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a single man who is 31 years old. He opened a restaurant in his town in 2008. He services all type of platters, sandwiches and soft drinks to his customers. He's known for the delicious chicken sandwiches he presents to his clients. He's happy with his new business. 

He's asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a refrigerator specifically designed for restaurants to protect the food products and attract more clients in order to earn a higher profit.

loans.use: To purchase a commercial refrigerator for his restaurant

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie R., 25 years old, is a retailer of beverages on the island of Nocnocan. She has two children, the eldest child being two years old while the youngest is only one. She started her business in 2007 and she is still selling beverages because it is a very good business.

Marjorie would like to apply for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy more beverages to sell. She will also use some of the loan to buy batteries to sell to the pump boat (an outrigger canoe powered by a small gasoline or diesel engine) operators on their island.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise like batteries and beverages

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth D., is from the village of Gotokan Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Ruth operates a snack vending business. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Ruth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase cattle for her farm. Ruth plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy cattle for her farm

loans.name: Mrs. Sophal Khieng Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group, which is made up of residents of Daeum Doung village in Takeo province, has come together to apply for a loan which its members will use for many different purposes. Mrs. Sophal K. is a village bank president who has been chosen by the members to lead this group. She makes a living selling rice, and because business is good she has decided to apply for a loan to expand her small company. Her husband, Mr. Yin Voeurn, helps her acquire and sell rice. Mrs. Sophal K. is 43 years old and the mother of two children, both of whom attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice for resale

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma M., 50, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Ibrahim M., an NBI (National Bureau of Investigations) Security Officer, and they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own food-processing business while also managing a direct-selling business and a tube-ice business.

Vilma has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her businesses, she would like to apply for a 47,000 Philippine peso loan. This amount will be used for her expanding businesses to buy raw ingredients needed for food processing and for other needs of her other businesses.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buying raw ingredients needed for her food-processing business and other needs of her other businesses

loans.name: D. Éric

texts.fr: O. D. Éric est né le 04 Janvier 1978 à Savè, dans le département des Collines au Bénin. Marié à SEDJAME Gislaine, une revendeuse, Éric est père de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Éric vit avec ses enfants et sa femme au quartier Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis près de cinq ans. Éric subvient en grande partie aux différents besoins de sa famille. Éric a fréquenté l'école et s'est arrêté à l'université. C'est un instituteur, qui exerce en plus de sa profession, la vente du charbon de bois à son domicile. Cette autre activité l'aide à subvenir sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Éric s'approvisionne à Savè. C'est la deuxième fois que Éric sollicite un appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser son activité et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires. Le premier crédit que Éric a obtenu de ALIDé a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Éric O. was born January 4, 1978 in Savè in the district of Collines in Benin. He is married to Gislaine Sedjame, a stockist. The couple has five children and a few attend school. Éric has lived for 5 years with his wife and his children in the neighborhood Agbalilamè in the village of Sèmè-Podji. Éric provides for a large part of his family's needs. He did attend school, but did not go to university. He is a teacher, but supplements his income by also selling wood coal from his home. These sales have helped him provide for his family without many problems. Éric gets his provisions from Savè. This is the second time that he has sought financial aid through ALIDé, with the goal of building up his business and to increase sales. The first loan that Éric recieved through ALIDé was repayed in full.

Translated from French by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of wood coal.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 45 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Beverly owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for to sell. 

In December 2006, Beverly joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Beverly has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Beverly is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Beverly from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Allah Kan Dèmè Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Allah Kan Dèmè est composé de six femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Château de Ségou et d’appartenance à une même association des femmes du quartier. 
Elles mènent des activités d’achat et de vente de pagnes wax, de mangues,  de gousses d’arachide,  de popeline  et d’habits  pour enfants à l’image de Oumou D.. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les deux précédents.
Madame Oumou D. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 7 douzaines d’habits  pour enfants. 
Elle se ravitaille à Bamako en gros et revend ses habits à domicile et en ambulant dans les quartiers de Ségou au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. 
Madame Oumou D.  espère  réaliser un bénéfice de 28 000FCFA par mois en moyenne qui sera utilisé pour la prise en charge des petits besoins du foyer et la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
The Allah Kan Dèmè group is composed of six married women living mainly in monogamous family; on the average, they are 34 years old and have three children. They all live in the Hamdallaye district of Ségou (the fourth administrative district of Mali) and know each other as neighbors, fellow vendors at the Château de Ségou market and members of the local women’s association. They sell and purchase wax “pagnes” [traditional fabric for wrap clothing], mangoes, unshelled peanuts, poplin fabric as well as children’s clothing, which is Oumou D.'s line of business, for example. Mrs. Oumou D. plans to use her loan to purchase 7 dozens of children’s outfits. She buys her goods wholesale in Bamako and resells them out of her home and as a street vendor in Ségou, for cash and on credit, to a mixed customer base. Mrs. Oumou D. hopes to achieve an average monthly income of 28,000 West African Francs, which will be used towards everyday household necessities and school fees of her children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing children's clothing [for resale]

loans.name: Joseph Otieno

texts.en:
Joseph has been in the car wash business in the town of Naivasha for 8 years. He is 37 years old, married to Rasoa Anupi and they have three children.  

Joseph was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 2nd loan. He used the first loan of KES 15,000 to buy a mopping machine. He plans to use the proceeds from this loan to buy a buffing machine, which is used to add sparkle to old faded cars or to remove stubborn stains from a car's paint.

In the future, Joseph hopes to expand his business and his number of clients.

loans.use: To buy a buffing machine

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline S. is from the village of Lawigan, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old. Jacqueline is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jacqueline owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products, and also making and selling snacks or native delicacies in the local community. Jacqueline has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jacqueline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacqueline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jacqueline is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jacqueline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Mrs. Kieng Poch Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of thirteen people who live in Daeum Thlok village, Takeo province. Mrs. Kieng P. is a village bank president who was born in 1969, selected by the other members who will use portion of their loan for varied ways. She is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Hey Nang, is a furniture maker at his home. Since her husband’s business is going well she wants to expand. So to improve this business, Mrs. Kieng P. is applying for a loan to buy more timber to make furniture for sell to earn large profit to support their family. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a dry fish seller, while the other one is a furniture maker, and the other is attending in local public school. All the members are shown in the picture but one of them is blocked.

loans.use: To make furniture

loans.name: Philip Maree

texts.en:
Philip currently operates a motorcycle transport business in the town of Naivasha. He has been in this field for over four years. He is 29 years old, married to Mary Keya, and has one child.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend, and this will be his third loan. He repaid his previous loan of 50,000 KES in full and on time. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to open a grocery store in his neighborhood, which will be managed by his wife.

He hopes to grow this business and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To open a grocery store.

loans.name: Chanra's Group

texts.en:
Chanra U., 47, is the village bank president having been selected by its eleven members which located in Preak T. village, Kandal province.  With this loan, each member hopes to increase his or her income, to improve the living standard of their family.

Chanra is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living.  Her husband is a fisherman.  With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family.  Chanra will use the loan to buy a fishing machine for her husband.  This couple has three children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, another is a construction worker.  The third is a student.

loans.use: Buy fishing machine for fishing.

loans.name: Protea Group

texts.en:
Theresia M., who is in her mid-twenties, is married and has a two-year-old daughter. She runs a food shop and has had the business for one year. She works from 10am to 8pm every day and is able to make a monthly profit of around $32.

This will be Theresia’s sixth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania and she aims to use the loan to increase the shop’s inventory. Her earlier loans were used to open up the shop and to expand the business. She has paid back the previous loans successfully. Telesia’s dream is to start selling her shop products at wholesale prices. She is very happy with her previous loans, which have allowed her to start and expand her own business.

Theresia will share this loan with her loan group, Protea, which has 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

In the picture, Theresia is the second from right in a kitenge (kiswahili "fabric").

loans.use: To increase shop inventory

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.ru:
Rovshan B. 48 let. On yavlyayetsya otcom 2 detey. Sin kotoromu 18 let on v etom qodu postupil v universitet i doch 16 let uchitsya v shkole a takje zanimayetsya risovaniyem. Rovshan B. i yeqo semya jivut v Absheron regione. 

Uje 10 let kak Rovshan zanimayestya zemledeliyem. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u brata kotoromu v svoye vremya nauchil ix otec. Ranshe Rovshan imel vinoqradniy sadik , no potom on reshil zanatsya zemledeliyem.
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit neobxodimoye obarudivaniye dlya postroyki parnika.
texts.en:
Rovshan B. is 48 years old. He is the father of two children. His son, who is eighteen, entered the university this year. His sixteen-year-old daughter studies at school and draws. Rovshan B. and his family live in the Absheron region. Rovsham has been working in agriculture for ten years. He started this business with the help of his brother, who, in his own time, started with their father. Rovsham used to have a vineyard, but he later decided to take up farming. Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to buy materials to build a hotbed.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy materials to build a hotbed

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La  Sra. Maria 26 es madre de 2 hijos menores .
Ella se dedica a la confección prendas de vestir para dama ,caballeros y niños ,trabajó desde muy pequeña con su madre de quien aprendió el oficio, luego de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logro montar un pequeño taller con  tres maquinas.
Ella necesita de este crédito para comprar telas en cantidad y de esta  manera abaratar el costo de sus prendas. 
María    desea  abrir un salón y exhibir sus prendas.
texts.en:
Maria is 26 and the mother of two underage children.
She makes clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children. She has worked since she was small with her mother, who taught her the trade. After much effort and dedication she succeeded in setting up a small workshop with three machines. 
She needs this loan to buy cloth in quantity and in this way reduce the price of the clothes.
Maria wants to open a shop to exhibit her clothing.

loans.use: To buy cloth, thread, glue, buttons, zippers, emroidered strips.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is married and has five dependants. She has received schooling through senior high. Mary cooks rice and sauce to sell in Abura, which she has been doing for six years now. Her husband is a prison officer. Mary uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Mary will use this loan to purchase more bags of rice and other ingredients to cook in large quantity to meet the needs of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to further her children's education. The photo shows Mary serving her waiting customers with rice.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice and other ingredients to cook

loans.name: Rosa Mariana

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa Chongoluisa socia del banco comunal Mujeres de la Bahía, vive en la comunidad de Chiquipata en la ciudad de Azogues que es conocida por sus hoyadas, su iglesia catedral es muy conocida por estar en la alto de toda la ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y muchos han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo y  así brindar un mejor futuro a su familia.
 
La Señora. Rosa tiene 58 años, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 26, 22, 14 años de edad, su primer hijo está en el país de Bolivia en donde estudia y trabaja, su segunda hija estudia  en la universidad y su ultimo hijo estudia en el colegio, en esta ciudad no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando pero en su ciudad natal si tiene una casa propia.

Doña Rosa es oriunda de la ciudad de Quito, ha llegado a esta ciudad hace 10 años y se ha quedado  por el estudio de sus hijos y por que hay mejores oportunidades de trabajo. Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y aseo, actividad que la viene realizando hace 20 años, en feridos realiza ensaladas de frutas, huevos chilenos lo que tiene una muy buena acogida, vende su producto ambulantemente, labora de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.

Este es su segundo créditos y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos como pastas dentales, papel higiénico, etc., para la venta. Su meta es  tener un puesto propio para vender su producto.
texts.en:
Rosa Chongoluisa is a member of the Bay Women community bank.  She lives in the Chiquipata neighborhood in the city of Azogues, which is known for its depressed land areas.  Its cathedral is famous for being at the top of the city.  The residents are engaged in commerce and raising livestock, and many have migrated in search of a better job and to secure a better future for their families.

Rosa is 58 years old and single.  She has three children, who are 26, 22 and 14.  Her oldest son is in Bolivia, where he works and studies.  Her second child, a daughter, studies at university and her youngest son is in high school.  In her current city of residence Rosa does not own a home and lives by renting; in the city of her birth she does own her own home.

Rosa is a widow in the city of Quito.  She arrived there 10 years ago and has stayed for her children's education and because there are better work opportunities.  She sells staples and toiletries, which she has done for 20 years.  She also makes fruit salad and Chilean style eggs that are well liked.  She does traveling sales and works from Monday to Saturday from 8 am to 6 pm.

This is her second loan and she plans to invest it in the purchase of products such as toothpaste, toilet paper, etc., as sales inventory.  Her goal is to have her own place to sell her products.

loans.use: To buy toothpaste, toilet paper, soap, etc.

loans.name: Ntamugabumwe Group

texts.fr: M. Theophile est commerçant, et il est un membre du groupe Ntamugabumwe.  Il est marié, et il a deux  enfants entre 6mois et 3ans, aussi il a 28 ans.  Avec son prêt, il veut acheter les maniocs pour les détailler au marché de sake.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargne sur son compte.  Il voudrait avoir la capacité d’autofinancement.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait satisfaire leur besoins.
texts.en:
Theophile M. is a 28-year-old merchant and member of the Ntamugabumwe solidarity group. He is married and has two children, a 3-year-old and a 6-month-old. 

With his loan, he wants to buy cassava for resale at the Sake market. His strategy for business growth is to boost his savings, as he would like to be able to self-finance. He also wants to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy cassava

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Chhuon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people make up this village bank loan in Samraong village, Takeo province. All the members have selected Mrs. T. C. as the village bank president. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes, all of which can improve their family's standard of living. 

Mrs. T. C. and her husband, Mr. Soa Toek, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support their family, and she is a pig breeder as well. To make a daily income, she has a problem because her pigs are too small to sell, so she is requesting a loan to buy pig food. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are attending school, while the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa G. G.  se dedica la venta de artículos personales y de ropa por catalogo 
Ella tiene ya un año de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio, pero ella desea mejorar su negocio y crear un capital de trabajo para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Es por eso que ella necesita ₡603 000(seiscientos tres mil colones) para  la compra de mas mercadería para la venta. 
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Rosa G. G. sells personal products and clothing from catalogs. She has already been in this business for one year but she wants to improve her business and grow her working capital to improve her service to her customers. For this reason she is requesting a loan of ₡603 000 to purchase more merchandise to sell. 

She is a member of the Canalete Communal Bank, one of EDESA's 100 partner organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is twenty-seven years old and married with a child, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He wants to secure a sustainable income for his family. For five years he has been into the motorcycle transport business, and so far owns two motorcycles. His dream is to have at least five of them on the road. Godfrey needs the loan to complete payments on a motorcycle.

loans.use: Completing payments on a motorcycle.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario A. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 39 years old. Hilario is married and has 2 children aged 13 and 10. To make a living, Hilario owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from gathering and selling seaweed to the market. 

Hilario joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Hilario has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Hilario is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase an engine for his fishing boat. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: to purchase an engine for his fishing boat

loans.name: Sharipakhan's Group

texts.en:
Kyrgyzstan benefits greatly from having China as a neighbor. With a flourishing economy, China sees Kyrgyzstan as a bridge for export to Europe and the Middle East. An overwhelming majority of goods in Kyrgyzstan are imported from this growing neighbor.  China exports a vast variety of consumer goods, which lets many entrepreneurs in Kyrgyzstan run their businesses without having to cross the borders and leave the country.  

Sharipakhan U., 51, is the treasurer for this loan group.  She is a widow and a mother of a seventeen-year-old son.  She works in a government department, and runs a small retail business selling clothing on the weekends.  Her wholesaler delivers clothing and shoes from the town of Kara Suu, which is several hours away from her hometown.  

Being a year in business bore fruits, and Sharipakhan could afford to purchase new carpets and a TV set from her business earnings. She has many plans for the future, which include giving an education to her son, expanding her business, and maybe opening her own boutique. She is requesting a loan to purchase more wholesale clothing and shoes and also a head of cattle to resell. 

     --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and one cattle

loans.name: Rene Ruben

texts.en:
Rene is married with two children. He operates a minibus business, transporting students and workers around the highland region of Totonicapan. He has been working in the transport business for over eight years, and he started his business from the ground up. His wife works at home. 

He is requesting a loan to use as working capital for his minibus business in order to keep it running smoothly. He has hopes of growing his business with help from ASDIR and Kiva lenders. This is Rene´s 3rd loan through ASDIR.

loans.use: working capital for his minibus business.

loans.name: Alegria Del Cristo Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en casa de la señora Aleida U. tesorera del grupo "Alegria del Cristo" que esta ubicado en Orizaba estado de VeraC., se ve al grupo alrededor de la foto, ella se dedica a la venta de articulos para el hogar que inicio hace 7 años, solicita el prestamo para la compra de nueva mercancia, tiene 36 años, estudio la primaria, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, quiere este crédito para la compra de nueva mercancia, también espera poder mejorar su economia y mejorar su calidad de vida, para poder brindarles a sus hijos una C. profesional.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in the home of Aleida U., the treasurer of the 'Alegria del Cristo' (Joy of Christ) group which is located in Orizaba, in the State of VeraC..  The group's members can be seen around the table.

Aleida's business is selling household items and she started it 7 years ago.  Aleida is 36 years old, has an elementary school level of education, is married and has two children.  She is requesting this loan to buy new merchandise.  She also hopes to be able to improve her financial situation and her quality of life, so that she can provide her children with an education all the way up to university level.

loans.use: to invest in her business (to buy merchandise)

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora. María T. es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive por el sector de los Héroes de Verdeloma en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza arquitectónica la misma que fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999, su variedad  gastronomía cautiva a propios y extraños, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora María tiene 47 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 24, 21 y 19 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en la universidad y su ultimo hijo en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo le ayuda en su negocio, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña María es propietaria de un comedor hace 10 años, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Ella solicitó este prestamo para tambien poner un local de frutas.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su cuñada y su hija. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para su nuevo negocio
 
Su meta es que su hija que estudia medicina se especialice en chile.
texts.en:
María T. is a member of the community bank El Arenal.  She lives in the Héroes de Verdeloma neighborhood of the city of Cuenca, known for its beautiful architecture, which was named a cultural heritage site in 1999, its variety of food which captivates natives and visitors, and its people that maintain their culture and traditions.

María is 47 years old, married, and has three children, who are 19, 21, and 24 years old.  Her two oldest children study at university, and her youngest is in high school in the city.  Her husband helps with her business.  They do not own their own home, so they rent.

María has owned a cafeteria for ten years.  She works from Sunday to Sunday from 5:00am until 10:00pm.  She is asking for this loan to start a fruit stand.

This is her second loan with the community bank, which she was invited to join by her sister-in-law and her daughter.  The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of fruit for her new business.

Her goal is to have her daughter who studies medicine specialize in Chile.

loans.use: to purchase fruit.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and is a married woman. She has two children aged 24 and 4.

Gloria is a farmer. She tills a plot of land located in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. Her husband is also a farmer. She said that they both work hard to improve their harvest and earnings. Gloria also does her best to be the best mother to her children.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Kamolidin

texts.ru: Зоиров Камолидин проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 34 года. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Его брат находится в России на заработках. Сам Камолидин уже год как занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кроме того в свободное время он предоставляет услугу, такси. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Kamolidin Z. lives in Yavan. He is 34 years old, married, and has four children. His wife is a housewife. His brother is working in Russia. Kamolidin has been working in animal husbandry for a year.   He raises cattle for resale.  In his spare time, he runs a taxi service.  He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: María Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora. María S. es socia del banco comunal María Reina de la Paz, vive en el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica y muchos lugares  para visitar, cuenta con una variada gastronomía la misma que cautiva los paladares de quienes la visitan, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora María tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 32, 30, 25 y 11 años de edad, su primera hija es casada e independiente, su segundo y tercer hijo trabajan y le ayudan  economícamente. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora en una empresa privada, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María tiene un su negocio propio, es un bazar en el que trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Hay veces que realiza trabajos de costura ya que también sabe sobre este arte y realiza todo tipo de arreglo a prendas de vestir.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su bazar.
 
Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Señora María S. is a member of the communal bank María Reina de la Paz.  She lives in the Monay sector in the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate, beautiful architecture and many places to visit.  It has a diverse cuisine that captivates the palettes of those who visit.  The people maintain its culture and traditions.

Señora María is 48 years old, married and has 4 children ages 32, 30, 25 and 11.  Her oldest daughter is married and living independently.  Her second and third children are working and help her financially.  Her husband is a driver and works for a private company.  As a result of their joint work efforts they were able to build their own home.  

Doña María has her own store where she works seven days a week from 6:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night.  There are times when she takes seamstress jobs as she also knows the art of the sewing and can fix all types of clothing.  
 
She has been a member of the communal bank for 4 years.  She is going to use this new loan to purchase merchandise for her store.
 
Her dream is to be debt-free.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Amgalanbaatar

texts.en:
Amgalanbaatar is 24 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. His wife is a dancer who is taking care of their daughter. 

He manages a meat and dairy product trading business in his town. He started his business in the beginning of 2010. Before his business operation he used to help with his parent's business. Therefore he gained much experience and is skilled in accounting. 

Now he is planning to have one more stall in order to increase his sales channel. He is a friendly man who says, "I am planning to expand my business in the future. " He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase meat for his business.

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María tiene  40  años de edad ella es  casad,  vive en casa propia y  tiene 01 hijo menor de edad.  María  vive en el  caserío Fanupe Barrio Nuevo, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope, en el departamento de Lambayeque.

Mercedes se dedica a la comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral, ella cría patos, pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta quincenalmente en el mercado de Chiclayo.  Adicionalmente Mercedes  posee una pequeña bodega en su domicilio.

Ella  desea adquirir alimentos para sus aves ya que la demanda aumenta durante la temporada navideña, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Mercedes es una persona  trabajadora, con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos   Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
María tiene  40  años de edad ella es  casad,  vive en casa propia y  tiene 01 hijo menor de edad.  María  vive en el  caserío Fanupe Barrio Nuevo, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope, en el departamento de Lambayeque.

Mercedes se dedica a la comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral, ella cría patos, pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta quincenalmente en el mercado de Chiclayo.  Adicionalmente Mercedes  posee una pequeña bodega en su domicilio.

Ella  desea adquirir alimentos para sus aves ya que la demanda aumenta durante la temporada navideña, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Mercedes es una persona  trabajadora, con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos   Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.

loans.use: comprar más animales, con sus respectivos alimentos, para su porsterior comercializacion.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son is 34 years old and married with two children. He and his wife own a store selling fruit, vegetables and basic commodities.

He plans to get a loan to partly invest in his business and to partly cover the cost of school fees for his children. 

He and his wife hope that the expansion of their business will enable them to earn more income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To invest capital in their business and cover the cost of school fees

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 37 years old. She is not married. She separated from her husband. They had no children. Constance sells utensils such as cups, flasks, etc. and she has been doing this business for the past 10 years. This business enabled her to buy a family house and 2 pieces of land. It has also enabled her to meet most of her needs. 

She needs a loan to buy more utensils in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: buy utensils, such as cups

loans.name: Albertina Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Albertina de  44 años de edad es casada, trabaja como docente en una Escuela del muncipio de Nueva Guinea, su esposo la ayuda con los gastos del hogar y con los pagos de sus compromisos. Albertina esta solicitando su 3er  crèdito para areglar un poco su vivienda, se caracteriza por ser una docente muy responsable, honesta y bien luchadora, es muy querida en su comunidad por ser una docente muy abnegada con su trabajo, su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia gozen de mucha salud y permanezca  unida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Albertina is 44 years old, married and works as a teacher at a school in the municipality of New Guinea.  Her husband helps with home expenses and with loan payments.  

Albertina is requesting her 3rd loan to fix up her home.  She is known to be a responsible teacher, who is honest and a good fighter.  She is a very well-liked teacher in the community for being devoted to her work.  Her biggest dream in life is for her family to enjoy good health and stay close.

loans.use: to repair her home.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha Lorena es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien desde 1986  es docente de una escuela rural. Ella ha tenido con Adim seis créditos con los cuales ha ido mejorando su vivienda poco a poco.
Con este crédito ella cambiara el techo ya que está muy deteriorado y su sueño es poder tener su casa cada día mejor.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is a hard working, enterprising woman who has been a Teacher in a rural school since 1986.  She has had six Adim loans that she’s used to gradually improve her home.

She will use this loan to replace the roof which is very deteriorated.  Her dream is to improve her house more each day.

loans.use: to replace the roof.

loans.name: Salin

texts.en: Salin, 29 years old, teaches weaving. Her husband is a Tok Tok driver. Their income is $10 per day. She has three children. One of the children is studying at school. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $8 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,100 to buy a new motorbike to continue her husband's career. The current motorbike is old and needs a lot of fixing. For her children, she wants to send them to study at the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo kuña guapa es un comité de 15 mujeres que son muy bien organizadas, unidas, trabajadoras y solidarias unas con otras. Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Villarrica, las cuales son vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad. Se reúnen mensualmente para brindarse apoyo y ayuda las unas a las otras en su esfuerzos de mejorar su situación económica.
La señora Luz es artesana, ella se dedica a esto desde hace mucho tiempo, ya que desde pequeña ha aprendido como hacerlas. Este ha sido su sustento durante toda su vida. Comenta que tiene una buena venta, en especial con los turistas, ya que ellos admiran mucho la artesanía Paraguaya. Uno de sus sueños es que sus artesanías se vean en el exterior, lo cual sería un paso muy importante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los insumos necesarios para la realización de sus artesanías, como ser telas de ao po'i, hilos, bastidores y demás. Ella tiene muchas esperanzas en el crédito, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa group is a communal bank of fifteen women who are very well organized, close-knit, hardworking and supportive of one another. These women are from the city of Villa Rica and are neighbors and friends from this city. They get together monthly to offer support and help one another in their efforts to improve their financial situation. 

Luz is a artisan who has been doing this for a long time, ever since she learned how to make crafts when she was little. This has been her livelihood for her entire life. She says her sales are good, especially among tourists, since they really admire Paraguayan craftsmanship. One of her dreams is that her crafts be seen abroad, which would be an important step. 

She asks for a loan in order to buy the necessary supplies to make her crafts, such as fabric for traditional needlework, thread, frames, and so on. She has high hopes for this loan since it will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric for traditional needlework, thread, frames, and so on, for craft making.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
La señora  Juanita  tiene  treinta y tres años de edad , se  dedica  a la venta de abarrotes  desde hace siete años y a  la venta de quesos desde hace tres años  con su esposo , Gregorio  tiene la edad de  cuarenta años.
Es una  señora muy trabajadora  le gusta  ayudar  a su esposo  en lo necesario  cuando  ella va  ordeñar  ella se queda  atendiendo la tienda .
Tiene la cantidad de tres hijos  una  mujer  Tania  y dos varones Ricardo  y Enrique.
Ella pidió el préstamo  para comprar  más  mercancía para su tienda como es: arroz, maíz, productos enlatados, jitomate, fríjol, aceite, tomates, etc.
Esta muy contenta  con su negocio  cada día gana más clientes  tanto en sus  quesos  como  en su tienda.
Uno de sus sueños  es hacer su tienda de abarrotes más grande  de la que horita tiene  ya que desea vender también medicamentos.
Le da las gracias  a fundación realidad  por el apoyo que les da a las personas que desean tener su propio negocio  y salir adelante  para ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
Juanita is 33 years old and has been selling groceries for the last seven years; she’s also sold cheese for the last three years with her husband, Gregorio, 40.

She is a very hardworking woman who likes to help her husband as much as possible.   When he goes off to milk the cows she stays to watch the store.

She has three children; one girl, Tania and two boys, Ricardo and Enrique.

She asked for the loan to buy more stock merchandise for her store like: rice, corn, canned goods, red tomatoes, beans, oil, green tomatoes, etc.

She is very happy with her business.  Every day she acquires new customers both in the store and for the cheese.

One of her dreams is to enlarge the grocery store because she’d like to also sell medicine.

She thanks Fundación Realidad for the support it gives people who want to have their own businesses and get ahead to help their families.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Nejma

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 52 years old, widowed and lives with five family members, all of whom work.

Nejma has been an owner of a food market since 2009 selling meat, soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. Her market is located in an area where they are in need of foodstuffs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in her area.

She decided to apply for a $1,200 loan in order to buy an electric diesel generator and a fridge and to make shelves for her market. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy an electric diesel generator and a fridge and to make shelves for her store

loans.name: Juan Celestino

texts.es:
El señor Juan Celestino es casado, tiene 49 años de edad, no tuvo ocasión para estudiar, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, inició este negocio siendo trabajador para otro negocio, hasta el momento lleva 20 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para ampliar su capital de trabajo en la compra de mas mercadería para la venta y poder incrementar sus ganancias, va a usar el dinero para comprar chumpas deportivas y casuales, etc. Espera en el futuro ver su negocio grande.
texts.en:
Juan Celestino is 49 years old and married.  He didn't have the opportunity to study.  He has two children who are students.  He works selling clothing of all types.  He started this business while he was working for another business.  At present he has 20 years of experience.

He is requesting a loan to extend his working capital in the purchase of more merchandise to sell and be able to increase his earnings.  He is going to use the money to buy athletic and casual jackets, etc.  He hopes to see his business bigger in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married and the father of five children.

Majed is a veterinarian. In 1991 he opened his own veterinary clinic. He treats animals and sells medications and pharmaceuticals. He has experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area and the surroundings.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his clinic. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his clinic.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is a 28-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Cicilia requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase more charcoal for sale. She will use the profit from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Rick And Alaycia

texts.en:
Rick and Alaycia are the owners of The Pampered Pet Boutique – a mom-and-pop pet groomers with a robust pet accessories department. They got the idea for the business after adopting their dog Chopper in 2006 and quickly realizing that there was nowhere in town to buy the pet accessories they wanted. Rick, who had spent 18 years as a store manager for a large company, knew he had the experience necessary to open their own store to fill that gap. “Having my own business is something I’ve always wanted, and I had been thinking about it for years,” said Rick.  

In 2010, Opportunity Fund approved Rick and Alaycia for a loan of $5,000. With the help of Kiva lenders backfilling this loan, Rick repaired and upgraded old equipment and built up their business credit.  Over the past year, business expanded so much that they opened a second location in Brentwood, California! They are now employing six people and hope to add even more jobs in the near future.  

With the excitement of the grand opening of their second location comes the need for more money to put up new signs in front of the store. Having enjoyed their experience with Opportunity Fund the first time, they approached their local MFI for a second microloan. With this $10,000, they will improve their current marketing efforts and expand their clientele as they open a second location.

loans.use: to purchase new signage and improve marketing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a 33-year-old Lebanese single man living with his one parent and seven siblings. Two of his siblings are still attending school and three others are working. In cooperation with his siblings, Bilal is responsible for paying his siblings' educational fees in addition to all other family expenses. He has been working in wall foliage for the past five years and is waiting for the perfect time to grow in this field. Today, he’s looking to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new equipment for his business. In the future, he plans to open his own wall foliage shop.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his business.

loans.name: Merlelyn

texts.en:
Merlelyn is 33 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 
Merlelyn has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for three years. 
In the future, Merlelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Maria Ermelinda

texts.es: María, solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de materia prima, condimentos, maíz, y productos no perecederos para la elaboración sopas, tamales, chilate, ella considera que los préstamos anteriores y este nuevo préstamo son de mucha utilidad y le han ayudado para mejorar su condición en el negocio, su familia está gozando de buena salud y apoyándole cada decisión.
texts.en:
María is applying for a new loan to buy raw materials, such as condiments, corn, and non-perishable products for making soups, tamales, and chilate (a Central American drink made from peppers, corn and cocoa).

She considers the previous loans, and this new loan to be very helpful, and they have helped her to improve the condition of her business. Her family is enjoying good health, and supporting her in every decision.

loans.use: To buy condiments, corn, and non-perishable products.

loans.name: Rommel

texts.en:
Rommel is 34-years of age, happily married to Milagros and currently working as a farmer. He is a responsible and industrious father of five children. His priority is to increase his income through improving his farming business to provide the necessities needed by his family.

He is requesting a loan amount of P15,000 as additional capital in buying inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used to develop their livelihood. He hopes, through these inputs, he can achieve his priority.

loans.use: to buy inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used to develop their livelihood.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 39-year-old man from Kisumu City, Western Kenya.  He is married to Rose and together they have four children aged 10, 12, 14 and 16 years.

John sells music compact discs (CDs) and movie discs in Kisumu town.  He has operated this business for 11 years and earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. He is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy additional music CDs and movie discs to sell.  He plans to reinvest the anticipated profits in his business.

His dream is to have a big music store in Kisumu town in the future.

loans.use: to buy music and movie discs to sell.

loans.name: Carla Patricia
