texts.es: Carla, tiene 37 años de edad, es una joven de escasos recursos económicos trabaja como mesera en un negocio familiar de comedor junto a su hermano, ella estudia los sábados la carrera de Ing. en sistemas, razón por la que solicita el apoyo de crédito para poder ingresar al curso de titulación para finalizar sus estudios que con tanto esfuerzo ha venido realizando.

loans.use: Para pagar curso de titulacion.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 39 years old and has four children. Marisa is a woman and has two children who are in school.

Marisa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Marisa requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marisa has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his computer sales business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en: Elisabeth K. is a dynamic young lady of 26 years old with one child. She lives with her partner who is a primary school master in Yopougon, a township in north of Abidjan. Elisabeth opened her food store in 2002, when she left a technical grammar school. Her dream was to be self-sufficient and be able to help her husband with the home expenses. Elisabeth is very conscientious and rapidly developed her products to offer. There is a great demand for milk powder in her area and she wants to capitalize on this opportunity. Elisabeth benefited her first loan from AE&I in February, 2004 and has been always paid her loans in a good manner.

loans.use: Elisabeth will use the loan to diversify her products range particularly the sale of milk powder.

loans.name: Hiris  Cristal

texts.es:
Hiris, 25, is married with one child. Her husband is a musician with a group that plays at various places that hire them. She has a grocery store in her house. She belongs to the Tres Estrellas 2 group along with dona Engracia Gomez L. (grocery store). Both hope to combine their loans to buy stocks of groceries for their stores and, consequently, have more to offer their customers in the communites where they live.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

HIRIS, está casada tiene un hijo y su edad es de 25 años, su esposo es músico y toca junto a un grupo en lugares donde los solicitan, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas 2 junto con doña ENGRACIA GOMEZ L. (tienda de abarrotes). Ambas esperan juntar sus préstamos y comprar mercadería de abarrotes para surtir sus tiendas y así tener más surtido que ofrecerles a sus clientas de la comunidad donde viven.

loans.use: Grocery store.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is 43 years old and is married with two children, ages 24 and 22. She lives with her family in one of the Bateyes, which are migrant camps owned by the nationalized sugar-cane industry in the Dominican Republic. She hopes to use her portion of her group's loan to sell small food items to her community, such as chicken and rice. She is going to name her small business ¨Creciendo Juntos¨ (Growing Together). Edita has dreams of buying her own house one day and not having to live in the company barracks.

NOTE: This $600 loan will fund Edita's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective businesses and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To buy food items such as chicken and rice for resale

loans.name: Mah

texts.en:
Traoré Mah is a dynamic 49-year-old tradeswoman. Mah goes door-to-door to sell clothes. She delivers fashionable clothes to her customers at their home,office,or workplace. This marketing approach has brought her many customers.

She works hard, and contributes significantly to the household expenses of her family. She has also developed a fruit juice business that does very well.

Mah heard about AE&i from her sister last year. Mah received her first loan 4 months later and was very successful.

Mah is married and has one child. Her daughter is in secondary school. Mah lives with her family in Attecoube, a suburb in the northwestern area of Abidjan.

loans.use: Purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Gadir

texts.en: Gadir lives in the Salyan region, in the village of Yenikand. He was born in 1983, and has 3 years of experience in his business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to purchase baling presses.

loans.use: To buy baling presses

loans.name: Nabweru South B-2079(Iv) Group

texts.en: Aida is 30 years old and divorced with three children. She sells used clothes to earn a living. She wants to use the extra business profits to start purchasing fruits and vegetables for sale. Grace sells raw foodstuffs and wants to use the extra profits to add inventory. Afua offers catering services; she wants to purchase more untensils with the loan. Grace and Irene sell new clothes and they want to use the loan to increase their stock. Note: This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes thus enlarge business

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest A. is a carpenter by profession. Business is moving well. He wants to increase his production, but he does not have adequate funds to meet his target.

He is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more wood for manufacturing furniture.

loans.use: To buy more wood for manufacturing furniture for sale.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old. He is married and has one child. He is living with his parents in a rented house. His father and mother are elderly. He has an old taxi and he wants to borrow $1200 to replace this car with a new one in order to increase his income. He wants to save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Replace the old car with a new one

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa Maria is a very active woman and with desires to succeed. Since a very long time Rosa sells cosmetics of the most recognized brands in the country. Thanks to her graciousness and patience she has a vast list of clients that come to her month after month. Her wishes to improve motivate her to add a space for cosmetic consulting, in order to continue to advise her clients and offer them the best products.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Maria es una mujer muy activa y con deseos de superación, se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la venta de cosméticos de las marcas más reconocidas de su país, gracias a su gentileza y paciencia tiene una gran gama de clientes mes a mes. Sus deseos de mejora la motivan a implementar un espacio de asesoramiento continuo con los mejores productos para satisfacción de sus queridas clientas.

loans.use: To Add Space for Cosmetic Consulting

loans.name: Rubia

texts.es:
For the past five years Rubia O. has earned a living working in her small grocery store. With a lot of effort and hard work she was able to set up her store in her home located in the Cinco Pinos municipality in the city of Chinandega. She has distinguished herself as an excellent worker and for the way she cares for her three school-age children.

Currently, Rubia is in need to purchase her merchandise, for this reason she has come to Ceprodel requesting a loan that will allow her to buy products such as groceries, personal care products and products for the home, to sell them to the customers that live in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rubia O. desde hace cinco años ha laborado en el negocio de pulpería el cual con muchísimo esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado surtir en su casa de habitación citada en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente trabajadora por la responsabilidad que posee de mantener a sus tres hijos en edad escolar.

La situación que actualmente atraviesa la señora Rubia es la necesidad de invertir en la compra de sus productos, es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito que le permita la compra de los productos como lo son comestibles, personales y del hogar para comercializarlos a sus clientes el municipio donde reside.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Itika J.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Itika J. M.. She is married and has four children between 9 and 18 years old. In 2006, Itika established her batik business. Itika has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA and now requires a new loan in order to expand her range of clothes, shoes, and handbags. In the future, Itika plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothes, shoes, and handbags.

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru:
Bahtiyor S. lives in Vakhsh region. He is 46 years old, married and has 9 children. Bahtiyor has a college degree and is a cook. He works in the middle school No. 9. Aside from his work, Bahtiyor sells wheat. He has a trading spot in the market, where he sells wheat. He has been involved in this business for 28 years. He would like to increase his profit by receiving a loan. This will help develop his business and increase profits from the business. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Шоимов Бахтиер житель района Вахш. Возраст 46 лет , женат и имеет девятерых детей. Образование высшее , по специальности повар. Работает в средней школе №9 . Кроме того занимается торговлей муки. Имеет торговую точку на рынке , откуда и пролает муку. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 28 лет. Хочет увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Это поможет развитию бизнеса и увеличению прибыли дела. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Ruth Pilar

texts.es:
Ruth is a member of the Pura Vida Communal Bank. She is a 25-year-old single mother with one child and has a restaurant in the Hatunpampa community that is located two hours from the city of Ayacucho. Ruth started her business there but, in search of more income, she went to the city of Ayacucho where she opened a restaurant in a rented locale. Unfortunately, it didn’t go well for her because she had few sales while incurring more expenses and for that reason she returned to her small town. Now the business offers more products and, in the same locale, she sells groceries and candy and is able to count on the help of her parents.

Ruth needs a loan for 2,000 soles – money that will be used to buy rice, sugar, candy and soft drinks.

Ruth’s dream is to buy her own home, grow her business, enjoy some recreation and give her son the best education.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Primer Préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=30408&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida

Ruth es madre soltera, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Ruth tiene un restaurante en la comunidad de Hatunpampa que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Ruth inicio su negocio en el mismo lugar pero en búsqueda de mayores ingresos se fue a la ciudad de Ayacucho donde aperturó un restaurante en un local alquilado y que desafortunadamente le fue mal no tenia muchas ventas e incurría en más gastos, razón por la cual retorno a su pueblo, actualmente su negocio esta mas surtido y en el mismo local vende artículos de abarrotes, golosinas, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de sus padres.

Ruth necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, golosinas y gaseosas.

Los sueños de Ruth son tener casa propia, ampliar su negocio, tener un recreo y brindar la mejor educación a su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, candy and soft drinks

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia, socia D. Banco Comunal  Mujeres Talentosas y domiciliada en el Jr. 7 de junio Nº 649, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 51 años, es madre de 5 hijos y su esposo es Técnico en petróleo. Alicia con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300 decide invertir en venta de comida.

 En la actualidad cuenta con una ferretería en la cual se siente muy contenta ya que día a día ve crecer más el negocio.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de 5 rollos de alambre de diferentes números, 6 docenas de interruptores, 3 docenas de focos, 7 docenas de fluorescentes, 15 martillos y otros.

Alicia se siente muy agradecida de poder contar con una institución como es  Manuela Ramos, ya que gracias a ello ha podido crecer en el negocio y en su estabilidad económica. Y su gran deseo es seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia is a partner in the Talented Women Communal Bank. Alicia lives at Jr. 7 of junio, Number 649, in the Callería district of Ucayali. She is 51 years old, and a mother of five. Her husband is a petroleum technician. Alicia used her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos to invest in food sales. Now Alicia has a hardware shop, and she’s happy to see it growing day by day. With a loan of 1,500 soles, Alicia will invest in five rolls of barbed wire of various grades, six dozen light switches, three dozen lightbulbs, seven dozen fluorescent lights, 15 hammers, and other supplies. She’ll repay the loan in four months. Alicia is very grateful to be a member of an institution like Manuela Ramos. Thanks to her participation, she’s been able to grow her business and improve her economic stability. Her greatest wish is to continue to grow as a micro entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in barbed wire, light switches, light bulbs, hammers, etc.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace T. is married with eight children, two of whom are working while the others are either studying or recent graduates of high school.  For over 20 years, Peace has worked as a trader of clothes and clothing materials to support her family, but has been unable to develop her business due to a lack of funds.  In order to increase her inventory of clothes and attract more customers, Peace recently joined the Good Mind Trust Group, which allows it members to support one another as they repay loans, and has subsequently requested a loan of $875.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Mrs. Nan P., 53, and her husband, Mr. Sokhem Ros, 56, live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1979, and have six children; three sons and three daughters. Two of their children were married and live outside the family home. Other two children are in school. One daughter is a silk weaver and one son has full time employment in Phnom Penh.

Nan has been weaving for over thirty years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a mechanic who repairs machines and also repairs bicycles.

Nan is requesting a loan of $500 to buy silk and thread for weaving and to purchase bicycle spare parts for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy silk and thread for weaving and to purchase bicycle spare parts for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Married with 5 children between the ages of 8-23, 38 years old Annet M.  runs a clothing business on a retail basis. Her shop is located along Iganga road, in Jinja town and has been in existence for 4 years. She has one lady employee who helps her with the daily transactions of the business. 

This loan will enable Annet to buy more gomeses (Ugandan traditional wear), handbags, and shoes, among other fine fabrics, for her shop. This is timely, because the Christmas season is at hand, and clothing sales are shooting up. From the profits, she saves a portion that will help her attain her dream of running a wholesale clothes shop within the same locality.

loans.use: Buy more gomeses (Ugandan traditional wear), handbags, and shoes, among other fine fabrics, for her shop.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Mrs. Rom L. was born in 1962 and she now lives in Bro Vash village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Some Noeurn, is a pig breeder. Since his pigs are getting bigger and bigger, he does not have enough money to buy enough feed to support them. Thus, Mrs. Rom L. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig feed. Mrs. Rom L. is 46 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a garment factory worker, while the other three attend the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only four years old. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for her husband's pigs.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marco Antonio V. D. es casado, tiene 2 hijos, el y su familia tienen 2 años de vivir en su hogar, su esposa trabaja como empleada domestica es una casa habitación, mientras que el señor Marco Antonio trabaja como cajero, en el cual ya tiene 10 años de antigüedad. 
El señor Marco Antonio está solicitando un préstamo para construir un cuarto en la planta baja de su casa, el cuarto se construirá según el material mas económico ya sea madera o concreto. (En la fotografía no aparece el señor Marco Antonio, sino aparecen su esposa y sus 2 hijos).
Esta construcción ayudará a que el señor Marco Antonio y su familia tengan un hogar más amplio para vivir.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio V. D. is married and has two children. His wife, who appears in this photograph with their two children, works as a maid in another house. Marco Antonio has worked for 10 years as a cashier. He and his family have lived in their home for two years. Marco Antonio is requesting this loan so that that he can add a room on the ground floor of his house. The room will be constructed using the most economical materials, either wood or concrete. It will be a great benefit to the family to have extra room in their small home to accommodate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Molloy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room on the ground floor of his home.

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
Rasul lives in Kanibadam, the town in Northern Tajikistan. He is 46 years old, married with two children. Rasul is the sole provider for his family and earns his living by raising and selling cows and sheep at the local market. Every year he purchases young animals from local villagers and raises them over an 8-9 month period and later sells the adult cows and sheep to local butchers.

Today Rasul is thinking about expanding his business, as his current earnings are not enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase young sheep and feed for them. That’s why he is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD for the term of 9 months.

Please extend your solidarity to Rasul so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, new West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing small sheep and feed for them.

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar M.arshad Group

texts.en:
Parveen Akhtar baji is 41 years old and a married lady. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family since last year. Parveen baji is married to a man whose name is M. A. and he is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Parveen baji is the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. All of her kids are getting an education from a school located near their home. Parveen baji is involved in a clothes-selling business. She buys clothes from famous cities (Multan and Faisalabad) and sells them in her native city. She has been doing this work for the past 10 years. Parveen baji does this work to share the financial burden of her husband and pay the school fees for her kids. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Irshad baji and Mumtaz begum baji each want a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy cold drinks for her cold drink corner. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese E., 30, is married with two children. She has many years of experience in the fresh fish business. She sells to the villagers and the public five days per week.

She has had two previous loans with Kiva's partner SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (about $125). SPBD loans are Akenese’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

Ake's loan will be used to buy fishing equipment and some part of the loan will be spent on paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase fishing equipment and pay school fees

loans.name: Tupokigwe P.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Tupokigwe M. from Kyela. She is married with 8 children, between the ages of 10 and 18. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants because they are orphan their parents died for HIV. 
Tupokigwe has been running a Cereals business since 2006. Client’s business is to buy cocoa from farmers and sell in town for higher price.
She works at the business for 9 - 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Tupokigwe currently earns about 140 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more cocoa in bulk for reseling. In the future, she plans to increase the stock. Tupokigwe thanks you for your support!
ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cocoa in bulk for reseling

loans.name: La Florida Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Florida, el Banco inicia su tercer ciclo con 18 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. Medicamentos, abarrotes en general, condimentos, comidas, ropa, animales menores y frutas.
	
Como es el caso D. Cristina es casada, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Cristina tiene una pequeña botica en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días con L. ayuda D. su esposo, el préstamo que obtendrá Cristina será invertido en L. compra D. medicina.
	
Por otro lado Edilberta es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo, Edilberta junto a su esposo tienen un carro con el cual su esposo realiza taxi. Su préstamo era invertido en el pago D. las letras del carro.
	
Mientras que Diana es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 3 hijos, Diana tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días con L. ayuda D. su esposo. 

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 12,950 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. verduras, azúcar, arroz, leche, ropa, frutas variados.

Los sueños D. las socias son terminar sus estudios, equipar su negocio, comprar un terreno, abrir un negocio mas rentable y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Florida Community Bank: the bank has initiated its third cycle with 18 members. The members have different businesses such as the sale of medication, general groceries, condiments, food, clothes, young animals and fruits. To take the case of Cristina, she is married, aged 30 and has 3 sons. Cristina has a small boutique in her house, which she opens every day with the help of her husband. The loan Cristina will obtain will be invested in buying medicine. On the other hand, Edilberta is a co-habitee, she is 29 years old and has one son. Edilberta together with her partner have a car which her partner uses to work as a taxi driver. Their loan will be invested in paying for the car's paperwork. Meanwhile Diana is also a co-habitee, she is aged 24 and has 3 children. Diana has a house with groceries in his house, an activity she undertakes everyday with her husband's help. The members need different-sized loans such as 300 soles, 600 soles and 900 soles, making a grand total of 12 950 soles from the Community Bank. These loans will be invested in the purchase of vegetables, sugar, rice, milk, clothes, various fruit. The dreams of the members are to finish their studies, equip their businesses, buy land, to open a more profitable business and to build a house respectively.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, sugar, rice, milk, clothes and various fruit.

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr:
G. Françoise est née vers 1958 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin dans le Département du Littoral au Sud du Bénin. Françoise est mariée à FALOLA Raphël menuisier de profession. Françoise vendait des divers. Depuis six ans, Françoise livre du vin de palme et des œufs dans les restaurants de Cotonou parce que cette activité lui est plus rentable. Françoise a déjà eu trois crédits de ALIDé pour le compte de son activité. Actuellement, Françoise sollicite un quatrième crédit pour renforcement son fonds de roulement afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
G. Françoise was born around 1958 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, in Littoral County in southern Benin. She is married to FALOLA Raphël, a cabinet maker by profession. Françoise used to sell various goods. For six years, she has been delivering palm wine and eggs to Cotonou restaurants because this business is profitable for her. She has already had three ALIDÉ loans on her business account. Currently, she's requesting a fourth loan to boost her working capital in order to respond better to the demands of her customers. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy in bulk some eggs and five 50-liter drums of palm wine

loans.name: Abed Al Hassan

texts.en:
Abed Al Hassan is a 45-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Abed Al Hassan has owned a pick-up truck for 20 years. Abed Al Hassan requested a loan of S1500 USD from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his truck. This is his second loan cycle and he paid his previous loan on time. 

Abed Al Hassan is special in his work because he does it well and has competitive prices. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had financial issues. Abed Al Hassan decided on doing his business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on his truck

loans.name: Burigul

texts.ru: Аликулова Буригул проживает в Варзобском районе. Возраст 62 года. Муж занимается сельским хозяйством. Буригул более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Сын находится на заработках в России. Клиентка просит кредит, для закупа крупно рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Burigul A. lives in the Varzob region. She is 62 years old. Her husband is in agriculture. Burigul has been in animal husbandry for more than fifteen years. Her son is now working in Russia. The client is asking for a loan to buy large cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en:
Dolgorsuren D. is a single mother living with her two children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her daughter is 23 and lives with Dolgorsuren and her son is 18 and studies in the Mongolian National University of Pedagogy in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Dolgorsuren has a small retail business in dairy products. She rents a small stall at the local food market and sells various dairy products, including cheese, curds, cream, etc. She travels to herder families in the nearby towns and purchases dairy products at discounted prices. She mostly sells dairy products at the local market; however, when there are many leftover products in her inventory, she brings them to the wholesale markets for dairy products in Ulaanbaatar. 

She has been in the dairy business for the last four years and she has done well. Her business capital has increased from 800,000 MNT to 3,000,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,420 MNT). She says that she would like to save some portion of her profit for her two children. 

She requests a loan to purchase more dairy products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Rhina Elizabeth

texts.es: Rhina Elizabeth G. G. vive en el departamento de La Libertad. Desde hace ya catorce años, Rhina se dedica a la venta de ropa, mediante una venta que monto en su propia casa. Rhina no lo hace sola, su esposo y tres hijos le ayudan y colaboran en la venta, a pesar que sus dos hijos menores, tiene tan solo 8 y 6 años. Rhina Elizabeth solicita un préstamo, para comprar nueva mercadería y diversificar la gama de productos que comercializa, pues considera de mucha importancia conservar  el espíritu de superación que tanto le ha ayudado a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rhina Elizabeth G. G. lives in the La Libertad department. Rhina has been selling clothes since she was 14 years old. She sells from a location she set up in her home. Rhina does not do this alone. Her husband and three children help her and work with her. They do this in spite of the fact that her two youngest children are only eight and six years old. Rhina Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy new merchandise and diversify the range of products that she sells. She feels it is very important to keep the spirit of improving herself that has helped her so much to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Maritchel

texts.en:
Maritchel A. is from the village of Poblacion, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 31 years old. Maritchel is separated from her spouse and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Maritchel owns & operates a business making & selling food.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Maritchel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maritchel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maritchel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Maritchel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Aide Plus Group

texts.fr:
« Aide Plus » est une banque communautaire constituée de 29 membres dont André U. est président. Elle est solidairement unie et engagée à recevoir des crédits de Kiva à travers l’IMF HOPE RDC. 
André U. 26 ans, est micro-entrepreneur dans le monde de communication. Il gère sa propre cabine téléphonique et vend des cartes prépayées. Le nombre de ses clients ne cessent de croitre et le poussent à augmenter la quantité des cartes prépayées qu’il compte acheter avec le prochain crédit. André travaille durement avec détermination pour réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour un shop d’accessoires téléphoniques qui sont bien vendus dans son milieu. Il est âgé  de 26 ans, célibataire sans enfant.
texts.en:
“Aide Plus” is a community bank made up of 29 members, with André U. as president. The bank is firmly united and engaged to receive loans from Kiva via the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC.

André U., 26, is a micro-entrepreneur in the communication business. He manages his own phone booth and sells prepaid cards. His customers do not cease to grow in number. The next loan will allow him to increase the number of prepaid cards that he can buy. André works hard and with determination in order to realise his dream of one day opening a shop selling telephone accessories in his local area. He is 26 years old, single and has no children.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on prepaid telephone cards for resale

loans.name: Jose De Marlin

texts.es:
José es soltero, tiene 25 años de edad y vive con sus primos en el pueblo joven Cerropón, en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años tiene una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la cual trabaja y solventa sus gastos personales; el pertenece a una asociación cuyo paradero se encuentra en el distrito de La Victoria, a 20 minutos de donde vive.

Todos los días se dirige muy temprano hacia su paradero para trabajar, pero el continuo uso de su unidad móvil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas en el motor, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el mantenimiento de su instrumento de trabajo..

José sueña con seguir trabajando para juntar el suficiente dinero que le permita comprarse un carro con el cual pueda seguir trabajando y comprarse un lote donde pueda  construir su propia casa, él es  muy estimado por sus vecinos y familiares debido a que es muy responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
José is single and is 25 years old. He lives with his cousins in the town of Cerropón in the city of Chiclayo. For two years he has had a motorcycle taxi, which he uses to transport passengers and goods. With this work he pays for his personal expenses. He belongs to a taxi association whose taxi stand is located in La Victoria district, twenty mintures from his home. Every day he leaves very early for his taxi stand to work, but the continual use of his vehicle has led to some damage to the motor. This is why he is applying for a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa. The loan is for 500 new soles which he will invest in maintaining his vehicle. José dreams of continuing to work and make enough money to purchase a car and keep working as a taxi driver. He will then work to buy a lot to build his home. He is held in high regard by his neighbors and relatives because he is very responsible and hardworking.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs and maintenance of taxi

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia is 35 years old woman who is divorced with two children. One of her children is currently in school. She is a very hardworking young woman who is a hight achiever. Emelia bakes bread and supply to her loyal customers. For the past sixteen years, she has been baking bread and other food pastries while taking care of her household. In spite of the challenges she faces she manages to handle the demands of her customers and successfully meet their requests on time. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are shooting up. She is requesting a loan to remain in business. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family and most especially her children’s educations and her business’ growth.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika es una socia dinámica y emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región  de Ucayali, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad, se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y zapatos, ella viaja a la ciudad de Lima a traer esta mercadería.  Su esposo de dedica a la venta de motos. 
Erika forma parte del Banco Comunal “Loreto” desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en ropa interior para damas, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 3000 soles que será utilizado para comprar prendas de vestir para niños y adultos, ya que ella venderá a crédito esta mercadería. La meta de Erika es tener una tienda de artículos para toda ocasión, y seguir trabajando para progresar.
texts.en:
Erika is a dynamic and enterprising member of her community bank. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, region of Ucayali, Peru. She is the mother of two young children and makes a living selling clothes and shoes. She travels to the city of Lima to bring back this merchandise to sell. Her husband makes a living selling motorcycles. Erika has been part of the "Loreto" Community Bank for the past three years, and her first loan of 300 soles allowed her to purchase women's undergarments to sell. Currently she is requesting a loan of 3,000 soles (approximately $1,050), which she plans to use to purchase clothing for children and adults to sell on credit. Her goal is to have a store selling items for all occasions and to keep progressing with her work.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes for children and adults

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny A. is 43 years old. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. Since 2008, she has been selling fried bananas to earn a living. She is able to make about US $4.00 each day. Her husband sells yams at the local market and makes an average of US $13 in revenue each day. 

Ny A. would like a loan of US $600 to buy her husband a motorbike. He will use the motorbike to transport yams to the market to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport yams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals in bulk

loans.name: Lelei

texts.en:
Age:                            42
Marital Status:             Married
Children:                      1   (adopted)
Business:                    planting & harvesting taro for sale
Loan purpose:             to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives
Weekly profit:              WST $500  (US $208)

Overall Social Metric Score*:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.6 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.9 out of 3

Lelei owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Lelei needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to financially support extended members of her family.

In 2009, Lelei joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lelei's 1st loan with SPBD. 

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from secondary/high-school.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Adjoua Florence

texts.fr: L. Adjoua Florence est née en 1960 et vit au quartier Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 12 ans environs. Mariée à OZON Pascal un pêcheur, Adjoua Florence est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Adjoua Florence a un autre enfant à charge. Adjoua Florence vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Adjoua Florence n’a pas été à l’école. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Adjoua Florence vend des poissons fumés au Port de Pêche à Cotonou. C’est au bord de la mer que Adjoua Florence s’approvisionne. Adjoua Florence a déjà obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé, et les a bien remboursés. C’est pour agrandir davantage son activité, pour mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle que Adjoua Florence sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Adjoua Florence L. was born in 1960 and has lived in the Fiégnon district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for the past 12 years. She is the mother of three children who are enrolled in school and has another child at home. She lives with her husband Pascal OZON, who is a fisherman, and her children. As a couple, they work together to meet the household expenses. Adjoua Florence did not go to school.


For about 10 years, Adjoua Florence has been selling smoked fish at the Fishing Port in Cotonou. Adjoua Florence gets her supply of fish from the ocean. Adjoua Florence has previously obtained two loans from ALIDé, and both have been fully repaid. Adjoua Florence is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to improve her business and better satisfy the needs of her clients.


Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish

loans.name: Rose Akeyo

texts.en: Rose Akeyo Nyang’ong’a  is the proud owner of a clinic. She started with a pharmacy and then expanded her business into a clinic in 1994. She is 49 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children. She says her clinic has a many clients, mainly common villagers from Rongo District, Kenya. Occasionally, they run out of drugs, so she would like a loan of Kshs.90000 to increase her drug inventory at the clinic.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of drugs for her clinic

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Rice farming is the main source of income for Conchita, 47.  She supports two children in her family.  Her 2-hectare rice field is just enough to provide their basic needs. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner, to seek a loan to finance her business with a low interest rate. She’s requesting 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy farm necessities and sustain her family.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Rwenyerere Bakyara Kweterana Group, Kihihi

texts.en: N. Aggrey is a hardworking and cooperative 55-year-old man. He is a farmer from Buzaniro that grows cash crops as well as keeping goats and cows for meat and milk. He is married with two children and he takes care of one orphan. His biggest business challenge is changes in the weather that affect his income. He has been in business for 10 years and is able to make 50,000/= in profit every week. Customers come to him because he is trustworthy. He hopes to continue selling good quality products and increasing his income as well as to continue educating all his children. Aggrey needs a loan to help buy more goats for farm expansion.

loans.use: To buy more goats for farm expansion

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Primitiva tiene 60 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y el ultimo de sus tres hijos en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado a la venta de jugos de fruta desde hace más de 20 años. El ofrece sus jugos durante todo el año desde las seis de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde en un pequeño puedo ubicado cerca al centro de la ciudad. El negocio le ayuda a solventar los gastos familiares.

El negocio de Primitiva goza de buena acogida, gracias a la calidad con la que los prepara y al buen trato que ofrece. Adicionalmente su esposa trabaja vendiendo helados en su vivienda. Con estos ingresos ha logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante.

Las fuertes lluvias que se presentaron en la zona norte del Perú hace algunas semanas han hecho que parte del techo de su vivienda se caiga, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a reparar los daños.

Primitiva es un hombre honrado y serio con su trabajo. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Primitiva, 60, is married and lives with his wife and the youngest of his three children in Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, located three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. He has sold fruit juices for over 20 years. He sells year-round form 6am until 2pm at a small stand located near the center of town; the business helps him meet household expenses. Primitiva's business is well received thanks to the quality of his product and the good customer service he provides. In addition, his wife sells frozen treats from home. Their combined income has made it possible for them to raise their children. The heavy rains that occured in the north of Perú a few weeks ago caused parts of his roof to collapse. This has made it necessary for him to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to help do the needed repairs. Primitiva is an honest man who is serious about his work. He has collaborated with our institution in the past and has demonstrated punctuality and responsiblity with respect to his repayment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his rain damaged roof.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly C. has been engaging in fish selling business since the time she joined ASHI in 2005 together with her loving and supportive husband. Loans she requests are used to purchase fish from the fishermen in their village to be sold directly to people in the market. With the profits that this business makes, Nelly is optimistic that her dream of supporting the education of her two children (two and six years old) until they graduate from college is possible. Just recently, Nelly had ventured on a new business which is hog fattening. This is her sort of saving their profits and has it increased. Hogs/pigs they fattened in four months time will be sold either slaughtered or alive to a meat vendor in the market or to people in their village. By then they will have a profit in addition to the profit of their fish selling business. 

Though Nelly has enjoyed her hog fattening business, she really wants her fish selling business to grow because she is not only working hard to improve her family way of life but she is also helping her husband have his own source of income as well as giving the rest of the fishermen in their village have an access to market their fish. With that she is requesting for a loan to Kiva through ASHI with the amount much larger to the one she received recently.

loans.use: To purchase large volume of fish for selling.

loans.name: Duyen's Group

texts.en:
Duyen T. N. is 23 years old and lives in Xuan Non, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She is married with a small child.

Since Duyen’s family is quite young, Duyen has T. work hard T. scratch a living. At the moment, she owns a small grocery store serving the customers of the local community.

Joining SEDA micro-finance program in 2007, Duyen has been a dynamic, energetic and respected leader of a eight-member group. Even though her monthly income is rather unstabL. and not high at all (2,500,000 VND per month), she has always managed T. repay on time.

In the next round, she would like T. borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately 270 USD) T. invest in her business. Hopefully, that will enabL. her T. increase her profit and therefore have more money T. provide for her child and send him T. school in the not-too-distant future.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Nguyệt Thị Nguyễn is 45 years old. She wants T. take out a loan of 5,014,000 VND (approximately 270 USD) sell fish in the local market. 

Hường Thị Nguyễn is a 34-year-old farmer. She needs T. borrow 4,142,000 VND (approximately 225 USD) T. buy feed for her poultry.

Giang Thị Tô is 26 years old. She also wants T. borrow 4,142,000 VND (approximately 225 USD) T. expand her business.

Dung Thị Tô is 47 years old. She would like T. take out a loan of 5,014,000 VND (approximately 270 USD) T. finance her plan T. raise poultry.

Diên T. Lê is also 47 years old. She wants T. borrow 4,142,000 VND (approximately 225 USD) T. invest in raising animals.

Vân Thị Nguyễn is 51 years old. She would like T. take out a loan of 5,014,000 VND (approximately 270 USD) T. make tofu.

Ý Thị Lê is 28 years old. She is requesting a loan of 4,142,000 VND (approximately 225 USD) T. raise ducks.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Bushran's Group

texts.en:
Bushran is from the city of Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

She is a responsible lady. She manages her family and her house very efficiently. She is fond of cooking. Her specialty in cooking is “Chicken Biryani” and “Kababs”. Her family admires her a lot when she cooks these two dishes. 

She has given birth to five children: two sons and three daughters. Her kids are older than 15. Her sons work in a factory on a monthly wage. Her daughters help her with her domestic chores. Her husband's name is A. M.. He is a tailor by profession and runs his own tailoring shop in the market. His stitching is limited to gents wear. He has a good number of customers. He has been operating this business for over five years. His earnings allow him to meet his financial expenses. Now they are planning to purchase an electric sewing machine, which will help him to complete more orders on time. To purchase it they require a loan.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
María Juana tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su familia en el sector El Tabacal, una zona rural que tiene como principal actividad económica a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Túcume y pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque, el lugar se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de chicha desde hace cinco años, adicionalmente también vende cerveza en un bar instalado en su domicilio, su establecimiento se encuentra ubicada a un lado de la carretera, lo que ayuda a que este tenga muy buena acogida. Su negocio le permite ayudar a su esposo, quien trabaja como peón agrícola, a sostener la economía familiar, por lo que se esfuerza siempre para mantenerlo.

La chicha es una bebida tipica de todo el país, se prepara tanto en la costa como en la sierra del Perú desde tiempos ancestrales, está elaborada en base de una variedad de maiz y es muy consumida por las personas que viven en las zonas rurales ya que se cree que les da energía para continuar con sus trabajos.

María Juana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de insumos para la elaboración de más chicha, así como en la compra de más cerveza de modo que pueda mejorar la atención de su bar, tratando de lograr su objetivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María Juana es una mujer entregada a su familia y que siempre trabaja para lograr que ellos salgan adelante. En la zona donde reside ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos, quienes la consideran una mujer honorable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Maria Juana is 46 years old. She is married and lives with her family in the El Tabacal, a rural area where the principal economic activity is agriculture. It is located between the district of Tucume and is in the Lambayeque province. It is 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She works making and selling chicha, a traditional corn-based drink, for the last five years. She also sells beer at the bar she has installed in her house. Her establishment is on the side of the highway and has a very welcoming environment. Her business helps allows her to help out her husband, who is a farm worker, with family expenses. She always works hard to maintain. Chica is a traditional drink common in all of Peru. It has been drunk on the coast as well as in the mountains of Peru since ancient times. Chicha is made with different types of corn and is consumed by many people in rural areas because they believe that it gives them the energy to continue with their manual labor. Maria Juana wants to grow her business by purchasing supplies to make more chicha and also more beer in order to be able to improve her bar. In order to reach her goal she is applying for her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 new soles. Maria Juana is a family woman, and she has always worked to improve their lives. In her neighborhood she is well known and appreciated by her neighbors, who think she is an honorable and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make chicha and to buy beer for her bar

loans.name: Visal

texts.en:
Mr. Visal H. is 45 and his wife, Mrs. Nary Chin, is 40. They have been married since 1990 and have three children: two daughters who attend school and one son who is a construction worker.

Mr. Visal H. has been driving a motor taxi for twelve years and his wife has been a garment factory worker for four years. Besides his construction work, Visal’s son wants to supplement his income with a new business driving a motor taxi. He will be able to earn extra income.

Hence, Visal is asking for his first loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for his son to launch the new business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his son to drive as motor taxi

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Doña Josefa es una mujer trabajadora, desde horas tempranas se levanta para poder palmear sus ricas tortillas que vende día a día,  ya que tiene cinco hijos unos casados y otros solteros, junto a su esposo trabajan para poder lograr equilibrar los gastos ya que todo esta caro, y las ventas se ponen bajas, es por eso que vende también cuajada y pinol para lograr vender mas y aumentar sus ingresos ya que son de pocos recursos económicos,  el trabaja en construcción ambulante.

Con el financiamiento quiere comprar varios quintales de maíz, carbón, aumentar la venta de cuajada para lograr mejores ganancias. Y poder ganarse el sustento cada día digno para su familia.
texts.en:
Josefa is a hard-working woman who wakes up early every morning to make her delicious hand-made tortillas to sell. She has five children, some married and some not, and works with her husband in order to be able to pay their expenses now that everything is so expensive and sales are low. Because of this, she also sells cuajada [cheese curd] and pinol [a flavored corn flour used to make a popular beverage] in order to sell more and increase her income as they have few economic resources and her husband works as a mobile construction worker. With this loan she would like to purchase several quintals [100 pound weight measure] of maize and charcoal. She would also like to increase sales of cuajada [cheese curd] to achieve better profits and be able to make a living to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of several quintals [100 lbs] of maize to produce more tortillas and pinol [corn flour for beverages]

loans.name: Koyai Ene

texts.en: Koyai has been rearing animals for sale for nine years. She is 36 years old, married to Seriten D. and they have three children. She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to buy more goats and sheep, which she will rear to sell. In future, Koyai hopes to be a big meat supplier in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy more goats and sheep to raise and sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda E. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 59 years old. Erlinda is widowed and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 29-year-old married lady with two children.  She earns her living from Lucy’s Fashion and Design shop where she makes dresses.  Her business is just one year old and she has one employee. Previously she operated a butcher shop.  Lucy works hard together with her husband, who works in a hotel, to pay school fees for their children. 

She is a member of Faith Imani group in Faulu Kenya.  Being in the group, she has previously taken out 20,000 KES which she used to boost the business. The group has guaranteed her another loan of 30,000 KES because she paid her previous loan well.  She wants to use this loan to buy fabric for making clothes.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making clothes

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, de 26 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos tienen dos  hijos, Renzo y Madeleine, de 8 y 2 años respectivamente. Juntos viven en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tienen su propia casa. Edith es una persona empeñosa y trabajadora, ya que desde muy joven empezó a trabajar  en la chacra de sus familiares, cultivando cacao y café, con el tiempo se dio cuenta de que quería enrumbar por nuevos horizontes. En el presente tiene su propio negocio, que es una tienda y cuenta con un número de clientes que van a su establecimiento, debido a la cordialidad y el precio justo que ofrece. Por lo general expende sus productos por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja, y su punto de venta lo realiza en su propio barrio, de lunes a domingo, a partir de las 5:30 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche.  Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su tienda con la finalidad de que pueda vender al por mayor, para que de esa manera incremente sus ingresos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está satisfecho con banco comunal, ya que todos son responsables en sus respectivos pagos. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad con la finalidad de que pueda abastecer su tienda y de esa manera pueda atender a sus clientes sin complicación alguna.
texts.en:
Edith, who is 26 years old, lives with her partner and two children, Renzo, 8, and Madeleine, 2. They live together in their own house in the beautiful Ayacucho woods, in Santa Rosa. Edith is hardworking and enterprising. At an early age, she started working in her relatives' plantation, cultivating cocoa and coffee, but she wanted to expand her horizons. Now she has her own business, a shop, and she has many clients who frequent her establishment, thanks to her hospitality and the good prices she offers. She mainly buys her products herself, but sometimes her partner helps her, and she sells to people in her own neighborhood, every day of the week, from 5.30 in the morning to 9 at night. Her plan for the future is to expand her shop so that she can sell more and thus raise her income level. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she promises to meet her payment schedule. She is happy with the community bank, since everyone is responsible about making their respective payments. With the money she is requesting, she wants to invest in buying stock for her shop so she can take care of her clients without any problems.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop.

loans.name: Okasana's Group

texts.en:
Okasana S., the leader of this group, is 24 and married. She has two daughters, 6 and 4 years old. Okasana and her husband are farmers, but her husband works as a builder when there is an opportunity. Right after their marriage, her husband suggested breeding cattle. They started breeding cattle together 2 years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms. With the help of profits from cattle breeding they improved their living conditions significantly. Now, they receive 1500 soms a month as a profit from cattle breeding and in order to increase their profits they want to buy farm animals. With money received from the loan Okasana wants to purchase two farm animals and hay to feed them during the winter season. This loan would help them increase their profits and provide better living conditions for their two little daughters. 

Group members:

Shaiyr O. is treasurer of the group. She is 60 and married. She has a daughter who is 20. Her daughter works as a seamstress. Her husband is farmer and Shaiyr has been  breeding cattle for almost 2 years. She started breeding cattle with an initial investment of 2500 soms. Now, she makes 1500 soms monthly from cattle breeding. In order to increase her profits, she's planning to buy 4 more ewes, then fatten and sell them at a higher price. She already has educated her daughter about the profits from cattle breeding. Now, she wants to prepare a dowry for her daughter, also from the profits from cattle breeding. 

Ulan O. is 35 and married. He has two sons, 9 and 8 years old.   Both of his sons go to school. His wife is a seamstress. Ulan in his turn combines cattle breeding with a job as a taxi driver in order to provide for members of his family. He has been in the cattle breeding business for two years; he started with initial investments of 20,000 soms. Now, it brings him 2000 soms monthly. Like other group members, in order to increase his profits from cattle breeding, he needs more head of cattle. So, this is the first reason for his application for a loan. The second reason is that he needs to make car repairs so as to continue his job as a taxi driver. With the profit from a loan, he is planning to increase significantly the number of head of livestock he has and buy a flat in the capital of Kyrgyzstan (Bishkek) where his children can enjoy better educational opportunities. 

Almazbek O. is 40 and married. He has two daughters, 6 and 4 years old. His wife is a teacher of the Kyrgyz language at a local school. Almazbek as well as Ulan has to combine his job as an engineer with agriculture in order to provide for members of his family. 7 years ago, he received as a present from his parents an area under cultivation, which pushed him to start sowing potatoes and wheat. He started sowing potatoes and wheat with initial investments of 3000 soms. Profit from agriculture provided for his family and improved the living conditions of his family. Besides this, he bought furniture for his house. His profit from agriculture is 1500 soms per month. Now, he wants to start cattle breeding. In order to start cattle breeding, he needs to buy at least one head of cattle. Thus, he is applying for a loan. This loan will help him to buy one head of cattle and forage for cattle. He believes that he will increase significantly his herd. On the received profits, he wants to make capital repairs on his house and provide better living conditions for his family. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay and two farm animals

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es: Agueda se dedica ala cría de ganado vacuno, su producción de leche es vendida a la planta PIL ANDINA, su marido le ayuda con el cuidado del ganado, él hace trabajos esporádicos como albañil. Agueda solicita 1000 dólares para la compra de ganado. Este es su primer crédito con IMPRO  y el primero con Kiva. La pareja tiene cinco hijos y radican en el Departamento de La Paz.
texts.en:
Agueda raises milking cows. The milk she gathers is sold to a company named Pil Adina. Her husband helps her care for the cattle and he also takes on construction contracts. Agueda requests a loan in the amount of 1000 dollars to purchase livestock. This will be her first loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner). The couple have five children together and they live in the city of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en:
Garnik D. is from the village of Arpeni in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He is married with three children; a 28 year old daughter and two sons (24 and 27 years old).  Garnik has a high school education from his home town of Arpeni.  His daughter is married and lives in the city of Gyumri.  Garnik assists his daughter’s family with home grown vegetables and financial support.  Garnik supports his family with cattle and sheep breeding.  He has been in this work for over 30 years.  He considers himself a hard working yet modest person.  

Garnik is looking for a loan to purchase additional sheep and feed.  With the loan he is expecting his family income to increase by 20%.  The region around Arpeni is favorable for cattle breeding and the current market prices for meat are fair.  In addition to assisting his daughter Garnik is saving funds for his sons’ weddings.  He enjoys living near his extended family in his village of Arpeni.

loans.use: To purchase additional sheep and feed

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La Sra. Olga se dedica al servicio D. alquileres D. vajillas, decoración para eventos y servicio D. bufett  desD. el año 1980. Inicialmente solo trabajaba con alquiler D. sillas mesas, manteles y vajillas en general. 
Con el tiempo y el aumento  D. pedidos D. servicios fue incorporando las decoraciones y por ultimo el servicio D. bufett.
Ella tiene 51 años, ya no tiene hijos menores D. edad. Hace poco mas D. un año enviudó, por lo que sus hijos la impulsaron a abrir un nuevo negocio en su domicilio, para poder aumentar sus ingresos, pues quedó sola con todas las responsabilidades del hogar. 
Actualmente cuenta con un pequeño salón en el que funciona una Boutique. 
Este crédito será D. mucha ayuda para ella, pues necesita adquirir prendas para la temporada veraniega que inicia y asi satisfacer   los pedidos D. su clientela .Desea  comprar , vestidos, shorts,  remeras, camisas, soleras. 
Su anhelo es poder dejar a sus nietos una microempresa para que los mismos aprendan a ser  emprendedores y sepan generar  sus propios ingresos .
texts.en:
Since 1980, Olga has been renting tableware and decorations for events as well as providing buffet services. Initially she only rented chairs, tables, tablecloths and general tableware.
With time and an increase in demand for her services, she gradually added the decorations, and finally the buffet service.
She is 51 years old and does not have any children who are still minors. A little over a year ago she became a widow, so her children encouraged her to open a new business out of her home to increase her income, since she was now alone facing all the home responsibilities. 
Currently she has a small room out of which she operates a boutique.
The loan will be very helpful to her, since she needs to acquire clothes for the summer season that is starting, and thus meet her customers’ requests. She wants to buy dresses, shorts, t-shirts, shirts and sundresses.
Her desire is to leave her grandchildren a microenterprise so that they learn to be entrepreneurs and know how to generate their own income.

loans.use: To buy clothes for the season, such as t-shirts, dresses, blouses, shorts etc.

loans.name: Agnes Ekua Mansa

texts.en: Agnes Ekua Mansa B. is married and has six children. She has received schooling through junior high. Agnes sells soft drinks at Abura. Her husband is a mason. Agnes uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Agnes will use the loan to stock her fridge with varieties of soft drinks to enable her to attract more customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: stock her fridge with varieties of soft drinks

loans.name: Chilly

texts.en:
Chilly O. is 39 years old and from District III, Sibalom, Antique, Philippines.  She is married to Lucas O..  She is not only a loving wife but a very responsible mother of Frelyn, Lovelyn, Lory Ben, Lory Jan, Cherry Me and Loren Je.  All of their children are still studying and that is why the couple really stretched their bones just to earn an income in order to sustain the basic needs of the family.

As parents, they want to give a bright future to their children so they really strive hard in order to send their children to school despite poverty because they believe that the only weapon to fight poverty is through education.  

Since her 2008 membership in ASHI, she never fails to carry out her responsibilities especially in repayment.  On the other hand, she maintains her good performance, so that is why she received a bigger loan and other incentive loans from ASHI. 

For her next loan she is applying for 19,000 PHP and this will be used as additional capital for her farming project.  

Someday if ASHI and KIVA will grant her a bigger loan, she is also planning to indulge in poultry raising and she is planning to buy farm machines to have bigger production. She aims that their children will reach the peak of success through their hardship and support of the institution.

loans.use: Farm inputs (fertilizers, etc.)

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 30 años, es una  madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 1 años y 2 meses, se dedica a la preparación de anticuchos, parrillas y polladas; vendiéndolos solos los fines de semana. Su punto de venta, es el patio de la casa de su madre, donde hace muchos años funciona como establecimiento de venta de comida, cuya dueña es su mamá. Ahora  ha decidido  trabajar en sociedad con su madre, invirtiendo su propio capital. La afluencia de clientes ha aumentado por lo que sola no se puede abastecer, por lo que pronto tendrá que contratar ayudantes. Le gusta su negocio, por lo que es muy rentable, por lo pronto desea ampliar su negocio y comprar sus utensilios y parrillas para implementar su establecimiento. Es su 11avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar tosas sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará  carnes rojas y pollos al por mayor, para seguir trabajando con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia is 30 years old and is a hard working mother.  She, her husband, and two children live together in her parents’ home.  For the past year and two months, she’s been making and selling grilled chicken and beef kabobs on the weekends, from her mother’s patio.  For many years the patio has served as a point of sale for food.

She has decided to work with her mother and has invested her own money.  The number of customers has increased and she is no longer able to keep up, so she will need to hire helpers.  She likes her business; it is very profitable and she wants to expand it and buy more utensils and grills for the business.

This will be her 11th loan through MFP and she is committed to making all of her payments on time.  She will use the money from this loan to buy red meat and chicken in quantity, so that she can continue working her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion L. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City.  She is 48 years old.  Concepcion is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Concepcion owns and operates a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of bananas like tondal, lakatan and marabiya in the local community.  Concepcion has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.
