In 2009, Concepcion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Concepcion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI.  This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  Concepcion is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas.  This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Concepcion from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La señora Norma es socia del banco comunal El Oriente, del distrito de campo verde, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 35 años de edad, su esposo se desempeña como mecánico, tiene 3 hijos menores y uno recién nacido, por ese motivo estos días está de descanso, su esposo es el único que está trabajando.
La señora Norma se dedica a la venta de comida, es una gran ayuda para su esposo, por los ingresos que genera a su hogar.
Con el nuevo préstamo de S/.1000.00 soles comprará una salchipapera (carro de metal diseñado para la venta de comida rápida)y 2 balones de gas, con eso podrá trabajar más tranquila, podrá comprar un balón de gas para repuesto.
La señora Norma se siente tranquila porque tiene la posibilidad de apoyar a su esposo con algunos gastos de la casa y puede cuidar a sus hijos.
  
En la foto se muestra junto a su hijo recién nacido.
texts.en: Señora Norma is a member of the communal bank, The East ("El Oriente"), of the green field district of the Department of Ucayali.  She is 35 years old and her husband works as a mechanic.  She has three younger children and a newborn.  As such, she has been resting these days.  Her husband is the only one working right now.  Señora Norma works in food sales and is a great help to her husband with the earnings that she contributes towards their household.  With this new loan of 1000.00 soles, she plans on purchasing a "salchipapera" (a metal food cart designed to sell fast food) and 2 gas tanks, with which she would be able to work with greater ease.  She would also be able to purchase a substitute gas tank.  She feels good because she has the opportunity of helping her husband with some of the household costs and in taking care of her children.  The photo shows her with her newborn.

loans.use: Purchase a metal fast food cart.

loans.name: Nubia Del Socorro

texts.es: Nubia Del Socorro tiene 42 años, su actividad es la venta de frutas y verduras. Se dedica desde hace quince años. Eventualmente en el mercado es donde ofrece la variedad de productos durante todos estos años ha podido hacerse famosa en el rubro y actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles. Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito con los que piensa adquirir naranjas, mangos, bananos, mandarinas, chayote, zanahoria, ayote y pipián pues son productos que sus clientes solicitan en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Nubia Del Socorro is 42 years old.  Her business is selling fruit and vegetables.  She has been in this business for 15 years.  She offers a variety of products for sale in the market.  Over the years, she has become well known in this business and she currently has a group of loyal customers.

Nubia would like to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy oranges, mangos, bananas, mandarins, chayote fruit, carrots, ayote squash and cucurbita squash since these are the products that her customers most request during this season.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Chhea

texts.en: Chhea E., 51, is a widow who lives with her child in the Kampong Cham province. She sells clothes and fermented fish at the local market and is able to make about US $7 profit every day. Chhea E. is asking for a loan of US $1,000 to purchase more fermented fish to sell.

loans.use: Purchase fermented fish to sell

loans.name: Morine

texts.en:
Morine is a single mother of three children living in Hioma, Uganda. She is the only breadwinner in the family. She lives in a rented home and her family goal is to buy a house for her children.  

For three years Morine has been running a beauty salon business that she started from savings she had made from selling food items. She faces the challenge of customers who don’t pay. Her business dream is to own a beauty parlor. 

Morine needs the loan to buy synthetic hair and hair sprays for her salon.

loans.use: To purchase synthetic hair and hair sprays for the salon.

loans.name: La Independencia Group

texts.es: Doña Maria Antonia O. C., es soltera, tiene 27 años de edad,tiene como profesion maestra de educacion primaria, quiere solicitar un prestamo para invertirlo en la venta de ropa para niños, ya que quiere ser comerciante, inicia su negocio en su casa, quiere ver un negocio prospero con muchos clientes, por este motivo se decidio a reunir unas compañeras para formar un grupo y solicitar un prestamo que les beneficie a todos los miembros, las integrantes de este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades como: venta de ropa de niños, venta de comida, venta de productos de tienda y venta de lociones. Esperan mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio del prestamos que hacen a ASDIR.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Antonia M. O. is single, 27 years old, and a primary school teacher. She wants to apply for a loan to invest in selling children's clothing since she wants to be a merchant. She is starting her business at home and hopes to see a thriving business with many customers. For this reason she decided to gather some colleagues to form a group and apply for a loan that will benefit all members. 

The members of this group work in various activities like selling clothes for children, food sales, store sales,  and sale of lotions. They hope to improve their living conditions through the loans they request from ASDIR.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Coquetas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Coquetas" se encuentra ubicado en Guerrero en el Estado de México, las clientas decidieron ponerse este nombre porque son muy alegres, está integrado por 9 clientas en el se encuentra la señora María Luisa B. M., quien es la tesorera, tiene 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos, ella platica que ha sido muy difícil sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que con el sueldo que su esposo obtiene como albañil no alcanza para los gastos de la casa, en ocasiones se queda sin trabajo lo que ha complicado que tenga una estabilidad económica siendo que en su localidad las fuentes de trabajo son muy escasas, y por ello la decidió poner una pequeña tienda en su casa para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos, con el crédito invertirá en mercancía, su deseo es que sus hijos puedan continuar con sus estudios y algún día ser unos excelentes profesionista algo que ella no pudo cumplir y desea ofrecerles.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Coquetas" (The Flirts) and is located in Guerrero, in the state of Mexico.  These clients decided to give their group this name because they are all very cheerful women.  The group has nine members, including María Luisa B. M. who is the group's treasurer.

María is 33 years old, married, and has 5 children.  She tells us that it has been very difficult to get her children ahead in life because the wage that her husband earns as a construction worker doesn't cover all their household expenses.  Sometimes he has no work which has made it difficult to achieve financial stability since sources of work are very scarce in their town.  For this reason, María decided to set up a small store in her home in order to support her husband with their expenses.  She will invest her loan in buying more merchandise.  Her wish is for her children to continue in their studies and for them to become good professionals some day.  This was something that she could not achieve for herself but an opportunity that she would really like to offer her children.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise for her store

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 66 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos mayores. Vive con sus hijos en la ciudad de Morropón en el departamento de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, el capital de la región de Lambayeque. 

Desde hace 4 años, Carmen tiene un Bar – Picantería, un establecimiento donde vende comida, piqueos y bebidas como cerveza, chicha y gaseosas. El negocio se encuentra en su propio domicilio. Carmen es muy conocida en la región y cuenta con una clientela establecida.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para invertir en la compra de una nevera. Con esta inversión, podrá mejor conservar su mercadería. Carmen es muy trabajadora y responsable. Posee muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su comunidad. Ha manejado otros préstamos y cumplió con sus obligaciones en una manera puntual.
texts.en:
Carmen is 66 years old, widowed, and has three children who are adults. She lives with her children in the city of Morropón in the Department of Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo which is the capital of the Lambayeque Region.

Carmen has had a Bar – Restaurant for the past four years where she sells food, snacks and beverages like beer, chicha (a drink made from purple corn) and soda. Her business is located within her own home. Carmen is very well-known in the region and has an established clientele.

She has requested a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in the purchase of a refrigerator. With this investment, she will be able to better conserve her merchandise. Carmen is very hardworking and responsible and she has good personal and professional references from her community. She has had other loans and she made her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her restaurant

loans.name: Isedrelita

texts.en:
Isedrelita works hard to support her family. Isedrelita is single and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Isedrelita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for abaca weaving.

Isedrelita has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Isedrelita would like to educate her children and improve the business.

loans.use: to buy materials for abaca weaving

loans.name: Jane Wambui

texts.en:
Jane has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 13 years. She is 38 years old and married to Ben N..

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She paid for her previous loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Jane hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Chrisa

texts.en:
Chrisa G. is 24 years old and is a married woman with four children. Chrisa’s husband works as a driver and farmer.

Chrisa is a farmer working in San  Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. Chrisa has been growing rice and pigs for seven years. Chrisa earns enough income doing farming and having a piggery. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, feeds and fertilizers. In the future, Chrisa hopes to own a bigger farm and a bigger piggery.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, feeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Bok

texts.en:
Mrs. Bok is a hard-working woman who has spent her life cultivating crops. She has a few ponds in which she grows lotus flowers. Three months after planting, she harvests them to sell. Her husband also helps her plant rice crops as well as grow lotus flowers.  They sell their lotus flowers to people who need them  for religious ceremonies. 

This couple has five children, three of whom are now married and have started their own homes. The remaining two are still single and one works in the garment industry as a sewing worker. 

Mrs. Bok will be using her loan to buy a new motorbike to bring her rice crops and lotus flowers to sell in the busy market.  Mrs. Bok says this loan can reduce her traveling expenses.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to transports crops to the market

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 43 años de edad, ella  es soltera vive en casa propia.  Vive en un  caserío llamado Huaca Blanca, ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande en el departamento de Piura, al norte del Perú.

María se dedica al comercio y crianza de ganado  entre ellos pueden ser ganado ovino (ovejas) y caprino (cabras) y  principalmente vacuno(vacas), ella los cría en un corral ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Una vez que los engorda los comercializa en el mercado local.  Esta actividad la realizan desde hace más muchos años, en los que ha podido obtener clientela fija y experiencia en este negocio.

Maria desea ampliar su  negocio comprando más animales con sus respectivos  alimentos por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a  Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que pueda alcanzar sus  objetivos.

Maria es responsable, empeñosa y su deseo es contribuir a los gastos de su hogar, ella desea de esta manera poder alcanzar  una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María tiene 43 años de edad, ella  es soltera vive en casa propia.  Vive en un  caserío llamado Huaca Blanca, ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande en el departamento de Piura, al norte del Perú.

María se dedica al comercio y crianza de ganado  entre ellos pueden ser ganado ovino (ovejas) y caprino (cabras) y  principalmente vacuno(vacas), ella los cría en un corral ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Una vez que los engorda los comercializa en el mercado local.  Esta actividad la realizan desde hace más muchos años, en los que ha podido obtener clientela fija y experiencia en este negocio.

Maria desea ampliar su  negocio comprando más animales con sus respectivos  alimentos por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a  Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que pueda alcanzar sus  objetivos.

Maria es responsable, empeñosa y su deseo es contribuir a los gastos de su hogar, ella desea de esta manera poder alcanzar  una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Comprar mas animales.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her two daughters and her husband. 

They earn money by cleaning vehicles and selling spare parts. With the minimal capital that they have, they sometimes cannot provide the parts required by their customers. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of spare parts to meet their customers' needs. 

She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her daughters, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for resale

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Julieta has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Julieta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: o buy bowls, dishes, plastic buckets and teakettles.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcelino de 47 años de edad es electricista de vehículo hace mas de 17 años, vive con su esposa en domicilio propio donde tiene montado su taller de electricidad del automóvil, tiene tres hijos todos en edades escolares.
Don Marcelino cuenta con buena clientela gracias a la experiencia de varios años adquiridos en dicha actividad laboral, con lo cual  mantiene a su familia junto con su señora quien tiene una pequeña despensa en su domicilio, lo cual genera un ingreso diario para la alimentación de sus hijos.
El se considera un hombre muy trabajador y luchador. Sabe que el trabajo es la única forma de salir adelante.  Sueña con poder tener un gran salón donde poner los autos que repara.
El crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de repuesto para su posterior venta. Su objetivo en la vida es de ver crecer y formarse como persona a sus hijos y poder llegar a cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 47 years old and has been an automobile electrician for more than 17 years.  He lives with his wife in a home of his own, where he has his workshop.  He has three school-aged children.

Marcelino has steady customers, thanks to several years experience.  He supports his family this way and his wife also has a small food store that she runs out of the home.  This generates a daily income so that they can feed their children.  He considers himself to be a hard working man who puts forth a great deal of effort.  He knows that work is the only way to get ahead and he dreams of having a large auto shop where he can repair cars.

He will use the money from this loan to buy replacement parts to resell.  His life’s objective is to watch his children grow and strengthen themselves as individuals to be able to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy auto parts for resale.

loans.name: Rim

texts.en: Rim, 32 years old, is a farmer. Her husband works in a company. Their income is $4 per day. She has two children. They are seven and three years old. One of her children is studying. Every month she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 rent, $10 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use to travel to work. Besides working in the company, her husband also takes time to feed the chickens to sell and it is running well. He could make a good income from selling the chickens. In the future, she wants to feed more chickens to sell so that she will be able to send her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 26, 11 y 7 años de edad, ella junto a su esposo trabajan en la crianza de ganado, tienen 5 años en el negocio, este surgió por el apoyo de una organización que llego al lugar para apoyar a los agricultores y ganaderos, juntos se dedican al trabajo y prácticamente las labores son de todo el día.
Actualmente se encuentra su esposo sembrando maíz y frijol y ella solicita un préstamo para apoyarle con los insumos agrícolas, abono y herbicidas, con estos materiales tendrá un mejor desarrollo el cultivo.
La aspiración de ella es trabajar fuerte al lado de su esposo, para sacar a su familia adelante, en cuanto a los cuidados de alimentación, salud y educación.
texts.en:
Erlinda lives with her husband and her three children aged 26, 11 and 7.   She and her husband work together raising livestock, which they have been doing  for five years.  This work came about through the support of an organization that came to their area to support livestock and crop farmers.  They work together and the work takes them almost all day.

Her husband is currently growing corn and beans, and she is requesting a loan to support him with agricultural supplies, manure and herbicides.  These materials will provide better crop development.

Her goal is to work hard alongside her husband in order to move her family ahead in life with food, health and education.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicides for growing corn and beans.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 21 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su hermano en su casa, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pimentel que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la pesca, agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Carlos desde hace 2 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción de leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o lo lleva a vender al mercado de la zona, con sus ingresos solventa sus necesidades personales.  También trabaja como peón en tierras de cultivo en la zona donde vive.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado y pastos naturales para que se incremente la producción de la leche de vaca y así podrá ofrecerlo aun mejor precio para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Carlos es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es poder poco a poco salir adelante para ayudar económicamente a sus padres que viven en otro lugar.
texts.en:
Carlos is 21 years old, single, and lives at his brother’s house. They do not receive basic services. Carlos resides in the rural section of the District of Pimentel, which is part of Chiclayo Province. This area is known for having developed businesses that involve fishing, agriculture, livestock breeding, and tourism.

Carlos has been raising and selling cattle for two years. The animals are kept in a corral that is situated in an area outside of his house. Their diet consists of balanced feed and natural grasses so as to result in good milk production. Carlos sells the milk to villagers in his area or at the local market. With the income he earns, Carlos is able to cover his personal needs. He also works as a laborer on various farms in the area.

Carlos is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that he can buy balanced feed and natural grasses in order to increase milk production from his cows. This will enable him to sell the milk at a better price so that he can repay the loan and improve his quality of life. Carlos is a hardworking and responsible person who only wants to gradually move forward so that he can financially help his parents who live in another town.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed and fodder for his dairy cows.

loans.name: Rweida

texts.en: Rweida is a 35-year-old Lebanese married woman. She is living with her husband and four school-aged children. She has owned a clothes shop since 2002. She also sells shoes in her store. She cooperates with her husband who works in a local company to satisfy the family needs. With her requested loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, she will be able to purchase the newest clothes and shoes collection to satisfy all her customers' demands. This will be her third Kiva loan and we note that she has a very good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase the newest clothes and shoes collection

loans.name: Belen Aracely

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Belén, tiene 33 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre pero de otra relación que tuvo hace años tiene 3 hijos de 15, 11 y 10 años los mismos que estudian el mayor en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su marido tiene un asadero de pollos.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse su sustento diario desde hace 5 años atrás puso un negocio en el centro de Picoaza en el cual vende ropa de todo tipo, sabanas y cortinas, ella trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 16h00 y por las noches  le ayuda a su marido en el negocio de venta de pollos asados en el centro de la ciudad. Nos cuenta que empezó ese negocio cuando se separó de su primer marido ya que sus hijos estaban pequeños y necesitaban  muchas cosas y que gracias a su negocio pudo sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, ropa de niños, ropa  interior,  sabanas y cortinas.  Lleva cinco años en el banco comunal y le gusta ya que gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The Picoaza Community Bank meets every other week in the Picoaza district in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its commerce, its traditional celebrations for Saint Peter and Saint Paul, and for the rich cultural history enclosed in its mountains.

Here we find Mrs. Belén. She is 33 years old and in a common-law marriage. She has three children from a different man from many years ago. Her children are 15, 11, and 10. The oldest studies in high school and the younger two study at a different school. Her husband has a rotisserie grill for chickens.

To make her daily living, she started a business 5 years ago in downtown Picoaza selling all types of clothing, sheets, and curtains. She works every day from 8:00 am until 4:00 pm and at night she helps her husband with his business selling roasted chicken downtown in the city. She shared that she began this business when she separated from her first husband since her children were small and needed a lot of things, and that thanks to her business, she was able to help her family get ahead.

She will use the loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, children's clothing, underwear, sheets, and curtains. She has been in the community bank for five years and she likes it because it was thanks to her first loan that she began her business. Her dream is that her children never want for anything.

loans.use: Buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, children's clothing, underwear, sheets, and curtains.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a responsible mother who helps her husband to manage a rice farming business to support their family’s needs. She is 48 years old and has three school-age children. Due to financial difficulties, Daisy and her husband cannot afford to finance the schooling of their children who are all at the college level. Daisy and her husband aim to increase their yields and income to support education of their children.

Daisy is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay the labor costs required to plant rice. She hopes that through their patience and hard work, she and her husband will increase their yield and income this harvest season. In the future, they are hoping that their children will earn college degrees and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Nozim

texts.ru: Нозим женат. Имеет двоих детей. Продажей фруктов занимается 10 лет. По бизнесу ему помогает его мать. Данный бизнес приносит хорошие доходы, но для этого следует закупать фрукты оптом по низким ценам и продавать розницу по завышенным. Нозим хочет получить займ для оптового закупа фруктов в преддверье Нового года и получить хорошие доходы от продажи под праздник. Он надеется получить кредит и в вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Nozim is married and has two children.  He has been involved in selling fruits for ten years.  His mother helps him in this business.  This business brings in a good income, but requires that fruits are purchased at low wholesale prices and then sold at higher retail prices.  Nozim wants to obtain this loan for the wholesale purchase of fruits in anticipation of the New Year's Day and earn a good income from the sales for the holiday.  He hopes to receive your support in obtaining this loan.

loans.use: to purchase fruits

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin is a 41-year-old farmer who has five children, all of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming and providing transportation services using a horse cart that she owns. She has been a farmer for almost 20 years and received her first loan from VisionFund in 2010. She paid it back completely and on-time, and is applying for a new loan to cultivate a rice paddy. She hopes that this will allow her to increase her crop yields and earn more money to use to feed her family, keep her children in school and set aside some savings.

loans.use: to cultivate a rice paddy on her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Koukin Yaare Group

texts.fr:
Mme Alizeta est responsable du groupe KOUKIN YAARE. Elle est à droite sur la photo en voulard noir. Elle est veuve et mère de 4 enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans et le moin âgé a 13ans.1 va à l’école et elle a 4 personne a sa charge.

Elle est tisseuse depuis 30ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter une balle de fils de tisse et 1/2kg de teinture toute couleur confondue.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle économise  pour assurer le remboursement  de son crédit. Elle ambitionne  agrandir  son activité et s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Alizeta is the official of the group KOUKIN YAARE. She is the one wearing a black scarf at the right in the photo. She is a widow and the mother of four children. The oldest is 27 years old, and the youngest is 13. One of the children goes to school. Ms. Alizeta has four persons in her care. 

She has been a weaver for thirty years. Her supplies come from the Sector 10 market. Her customers include men and women. 

She wants to buy a ball of yarn and a ½ kg of dyes of various mixes.  

Using the profits, she is saving money to cover her loan payments. Her ambition is to expand her business and to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy a ball of yarn and a ½ kg of dyes of various colors

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en:
Asmahan is a 55 year-old woman who is married with two sons and two daughters, her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Asmahan wants to replace her old home furniture and purchase new necessary ones such as: bedroom furniture, living room furniture, etc., but she hasn't enough money to pay, so she needs to take a loan from Kiva partner FATEN. When Asmahan gets the loan, she will purchase new home furniture and provide for her family better and comfortable home living conditions. Asmahan is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the picture.

About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to replace the old home furniture by purchasing new one.

loans.name: Tajir

texts.en:
Tajir is from the village of Zemo Sarali, East Georgia. He is 52 years old, married, and lives with his family: his wife Nazakat, 21-year-old daughter, and 17-year-old son. Tajir is a teacher at a local school. Along with his main job, he is actively involved in his family's farm, which is their main source of income. They own 0.65 hectares of land, where they grow cucumbers, beans, and potatoes, as well as a greenhouse for growing vegetables. Tajir sells their harvest locally. The family's total average monthly income is 650 laris.

Tajir has requested a loan to purchase seed potatoes and a new polyethylene cover for his greenhouse. The existing cover is torn and can’t maintain the required temperature inside the greenhouse. Tajir will grow potatoes in the greenhouse and harvest them early in the spring, when the price of potatoes is at its highest. He will use the additional income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a cover for his greenhouse and seed potatoes.

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Ana, quiere ampliar más el negocio por eso solicita un préstamo, para tener una nueva experiencia y poder aumentar la mercadería, ella comprará ropa nueva como blusas, pantalones, camisetas, para ofrecerle a los clientes, además comprará maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas, y espera tener una muy buena experiencia con esta nuevo préstamo, ya que el anterior le ayudó mucho tanto en el negocio como en su familia, ahora iniciara con la venta de ropa para diversificar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana wants to increase her business more, so she is requesting a loan to have a new experience and be able to expand her merchandise.

She will buy new clothing such as blouses, pants, and t-shirts to offer to her customers.  She also will buy corn to make tortillas.

She hopes to have a very good experience with this new loan, since the previous one helped her a lot both in the business and in her family.  Now she will begin selling clothing to diversify her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as blouses, pants, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane, 25 years old, is married.  She has a daughter and a son who are six months old and three years old. For the last four years, she has been selling tomatoes, potatoes, pawpaws, bananas and peas to hotels and residents. Her business challenge is insufficient funds to add the stock of fruit and vegetables. She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more potatoes, tomatoes and pawpaw. In the future, Jane hopes to be selling vegetables and fruits at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, tomatoes and pawpaws.

loans.name: Katooke Kwekamba Group

texts.en: 38-year-old, hard-working George lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda with his two children. After failing to continue with school due to a lack of money for school fees, he decided to venture into produce buying and selling. He has been in this business for 17 years. His major challenge is price fluctuation and inflation, and his dream is to diversify and grow crops. George needs the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Olympia

texts.en:
Olympia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Olympia is 60 years old now.

Olympia has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Olympia requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business.

Olympia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Olympia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Madam Comfort O. of Coro Fashion de Paradise is a fashion designer. She is the lady in a white scarf wearing a beautiful smile with her apprentices at work. She sews really nice clothes but on a small scale. It has been her desire for quite a long time to produce on a large scale but does not have the means. She is very much happy and grateful for this help kiva is offering and is therefore seeking a loan of $775.00 to buy more machines, materials, sewing threads, needles etc. Madam Comfort O. will not rest on her oars when given this loan and will work very hard because her dream has come true.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.en:
María Antonia is married and 25 years old. She has a 2-year-old child and her husband has been working as a laborer for world drinks for 2 years. She started her business a year ago by selling her food to help with the expenses at home, counting on extra income to help them support themselves economically and to be able to have better quality of life. Her husband helps her in the afternoons and weekends with the business. María Antonia says that she would really like to move forward and since she is young, she knows that will succeed, because in addition, she wants to save for the future becasue she's thinking about the education of her small child and wants to help him succeed in life.

María Antonia is requesting a loan in the amount of US$150 to be able to buy a taco cart and be able to provide better service to her customers, offering to pay this loan in a period of 3 to 6 months. She thanks you very much for the support you're able to offer and she is certain that, little by ittle, she'll be growing her business, because has a great desire to succeed. With your help, she will.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

María Antonia esta casada y tiene 25 años de edad, un hijo de 2 años y su esposo trabaja como obrero de bebidas mundiales desde hace 2 años. Ella inicio su negocio desde hace un año atrás vendiendo sus comidas para ayudar en los gastos de su hogar, contando con un ingreso extra que les permita mantenerse económicamente y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su esposo le ayuda en las tardes y los fines de semana con el negocio. Comenta María Antonia que tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante y como es joven sabe que lo va a lograr, por que además de ello, quiere ahorrar para el futuro por que esta pensando en la educación de su pequeño hijo y quiere sacarlo adelnante en la vida.

María Antonia esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US$ 150 para poder comprar un carrito de tacos y así darle una mejor atención a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Ella agradece mucho el apoyo que le puedas dar y está convencida de que poco a poco ira creciendo con su negocio por que tiene todas las ganas de salir adelante y con tu apoyo lo logrará.

loans.use: Purchase of work equipment

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.ru:
Ibodat has a secondary school education and after finishing school she did not work anywhere. Currently she is a businesswoman and sells children’s clothing and shoes. She is married, is 41 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is in Russia earning money and sends money home to support the family.

Ibodat’s oldest daughter needs to get married soon and Ibodat would like to use the profits from her business for her daughter’s dowry. She has been a client of MicroInvest for one year and is an exemplary client. She would like to use the new loan to purchase school uniforms.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

У Ибодат среднее образование и после окончания школы она нигде не работала. Занимается бизнесом и продает детскую одежду и обувь. Она замужем, ей 41 год и у нее 3 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России и присылает деньги на содержание семьи. У Ибодат старшая дочь, которая скоро должна выйти замуж, и поэтому прибыль от бизнеса она хочет потратить на приданное для дочери. В Микроинвест она кредитуется год и показала себя как образцовый клиент. Новый займ она хочет потратить на закупку школьной формы..

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Eti

texts.en: Eti is 24 years old and is married with one child aged 5. She sells flavoured blended fruit ice and her husband Ahmad is a driver. He can earn $4 per day. Eti can earn $2.50/day but the profit is only $1 per day. She very much needs this $50 loan to make her shop bigger and more sustainable. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To make her shop bigger

loans.name: Sirri Rebecca

texts.en:
Born in 191949, Rebecca is married and is a mother of four. Her husband F. John is retired and is not able to provide for his family. Rebecca therefore decided to solicit a loan from GHAPE to start a business.
As a new borrower in GHAPE, she plans to use her new loan of 40,000FCFA to cultivate crops like corn, beans cassava on her plot and to sell them in the market. She plans to use the profit to pay school fee for her children, build a house and buy medications for herself. 
She will repay the loan in 12 -15 months with the first installment on the day the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds, transport

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: I need a loan of $350 for my husband’s vegetable business. He sells his vegetables on his donkey cart in nearby areas and makes a profit of $10 a day. We have a daughter and she is one year old; we wish to send her to the best school in town in future. Earlier, we took a loan for the same business and made our profits better. I share my husband’s financial burden by making bangles on contract for $1 a day.

loans.use: Expand vegetables business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 34 year-old man who recently got married. He is a car mechanic and is planning to buy second-hand auto parts and accessories.

Thus, Hassan is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. This is the third time Hassan has applied for a micro-credit from the association. Hassan is a trustworthy and reliable entrepreneur who is eager to continue his relationship with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy second-hand auto parts and accessories

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Mrs. Enma is a member of the community bank San Fernando 2, located on Jr. Sichi Roca 132, District of Calleria, and department of Ucayali. She is 51 years old, mother of 6 grown children, married and her husband works as a driver. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 Soles (USD $100) she decided to invest is a business of buying and selling clothing.

Currently she works in the sale of clothing and vegetables, for which she travels along the banks of the Ucayali River to the different housing areas offering her products for which there is a high demand.

The proceeds of the loan of 1000 Soles (USD $350), which she will repay in 5 months, will go towards the purchase of clothing such as polo shirts, pants, dresses, skirts, shirts, shoes and a variety of vegetables.

Enma tells us that it is relief to work with Manuela Ramos because thanks to the loans her business and income are growing.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Enma pertenece al Banco Comunal San Fernando 2, ubicado en Jr. Sinchi Roca 132, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años, es madre de 6 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo es chofer. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en la compra y venta de ropa.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa y verduras y para ello Enma viaja constante por las riberas del rio Ucayali a los diferentes caseríos ofreciendo sus productos, los cuales tienen mucha demanda.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, el cual será pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de ropa como polos, pantalones, vestidos, faldas, camisas, zapatos y diversos tipos de verduras.

Enma nos dice que es un alivio trabajar con Mamuela Ramos porque gracias a los préstamos, tanto nuestros negocios como nuestras ganancias crecen.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and a variety of vegetables

loans.name: Kayembe's Ujira Mwema Group

texts.en:
Kayembe is 35 years old and married with one 10-yr.-old child. She and her husband also take care of another person, age 58. Kayembe owns a small food store, which she opened in 2005. She works every day from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Kayembe would like a loan of $275 to increase the inventory of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member July , who also has a food vending business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her grocery store

loans.name: Fajar

texts.id:
Translated from bahasa Indonesia by Carlos Patriawan , Kiva Volunteer.

F. activity every day is travelling everyday looking for the second-hand items by driving his motorcycle from Kuta to Gianyar. Usually the second hand item is taken directly from his customer who already prepared the items that already is not used and usually has been paid before.

After that F. afterwards brough the second hand items to his house where his wife Nanik is ready to sort the second-hand in accordance with its quality before ready to be sold.

F. expected the loan as capital to buy second-hand items and hope the profit that after getting the loan at this time is to be bigger thus he should be able to fulfil the requirement for his family.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is an experienced and ambitious entrepreneur who operates a flourishing grocery store in San Cristobal. This businesswoman is also the mother of three school-going children.

She explains that she had been operating a similar store in her hometown. Two years ago, she moved to a rural community in San Cristobal, and opened a new business. This entrepreneur says that, in her business sector, there hadn’t been a grocery store as well stocked as hers, so she seized the opportunity and established her business, which is flourishing at the present time.

With her loan, this entrepreneur will buy an assortment of goods to add to her inventory so she can meet the needs of her customers. Leonarda intends to save the extra business profits in order to start the construction of her own house.

loans.use: To a larger variety of goods in bulk to supply her grocery store.

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.en:
Vegetable sales are a flourishing business in Tajikistan for the simple reason that every home needs vegetables. A. Nuriddin has been selling fruits and vegetables in Dushanbe for the past 2 years. He began his own stall with his hard-earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur.

Nuriddin began selling in “Ganj” market with very little stock to offer his clients. Slowly he began to increase the goods offered until he managed to get a permanent market stall. Currently his stall is his pride and joy, with a zinc roof and ceramic tiles on the floor.

Nuriddin is the father of three young children who are in school. Like any father, he is doing his best in order to offer his children the best future and to make them well-educated. Now he needs a loan of 2400 Somoni ($700) in order to increase the stock of his goods. He promises to repay the loan within 3 months and expresses his gratitude to everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: Increase the range of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan, 32 years old and single, lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He is the owner of a small laundry.  He needs a loan  of US$1,200 to purchase a new laundry machine with more functions than the one he currently owns. Hassan also wants to restructure his shop in order to expand his business. This is the first time Hassan has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase a new laundry machine

loans.name: Giovanny Marizela

texts.es:
Opening a spare auto parts store is the goal of Giovanny, 38 years old, who has the help of her husband who is also a merchant. She has been selling sacs as a traveling saleswoman in Huaraz for almost 11 years.

With four children and a house being built, she struggles with the evictions that the municipality enforces, so she carries her sacs on the shoulder and walking she delivers her sacs on the market days in Huaraz.

She belongs to the “Señor del Cautivo II” community bank. With this loan of 800 Soles, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will invest in her business buying 200 sacs and also merchandise for her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Abrir una tienda de tornos y repuestos de Autos es la meta de Giovanny de 38 años, quien tiene la ayuda de su esposo que también es comerciante, ella vende por casi 11 años costales de manera ambulatoria en las calles de Huaraz.

Con cuatro hijos y una casa en construcción, día a día, ella lucha con los desalojos que les hacen los municipales, así que carga sus costales al hombro y caminando va repartiendo sus costales en los días de feria en Huaraz.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor del Cautivo II”. Con este préstamo de S/. 800 soles, el cual pagará en 6 cuotas, implementará su negocio, comprará dos cientos de costales y también mercadería para su esposo.

loans.use: Purchase of sacs at wholesale prices

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: La Sra. Esperanza habita en el barrio Hialeah, tiene 43 años de edad, con tres hijos de 12,14 y 19 años de edad, los cuales están cursando la secundaria. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada en servicios de vigilancias y siempre está pendiente de la familia. Doña Esperanza alquila cuartos así como también alquila teléfono, tiene tres años de tener este negocio y comenzó con la intención de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar pues el sueldo es un poco bajo, inició alquilando un cuarto, pero ha tenido mas clientela y ahora alquila más cuartos. La solicitud del crédito es para construir una pila grande para almacenar agua, ya que el agua se va a menudo y necesita asegurar el líquido a sus inquilinos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esperenza lives in the Hialeah neighborhood and is 43 years old with three children, who are 12, 14, and 19 years old who are in school. Her husband works in a private factory in security and is always firm with the family. Esperanza rents rooms as well as rents a telephone. She has three years in this business, and she started with the intention of helping her husband with the household expense since his wage is a little low. She started renting one room, but she has had more customers and now she rents more rooms. The loan she is asking for is to construct a large battery to store water, now that the water works less often and she needs to secure liquid for her tenants.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a water tank

loans.name: Elmir

texts.en: Elmir A., 20 years old, is the only bread-winner in his family. Since 2005, Elmir has been running his own office supply and slipper sales business, based in a rented place next to his house. He competes effectively with the big stores in the vicinity by offering prices that are more attractive. As a result, Elmir's business so far has been very successful. At present, he needs a loan of US$1,200 for a term of 15 months to be able to expand the business by purchasing additional office supplies for sale.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Yoen

texts.en:
Mr. Yoen P. and his wife Mrs. Chen Chea, who live in Kandal Leu Village in Kandal Province, are farmers cultivating rice to earn a living. Due to field infertility and low working capital, Yoen is requesting a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and petroleum for the farm pump.

Yoen P. is 64 years old and the father of seven children, three employed in a garment factory while others two are farmers and another two children are at home. His wife is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy seeds of rice, fertilizers, and petroleum.

loans.name: Agip Cell A-Kudra Group

texts.en:
Kudra  N. is a jovial and hard working, single mother of 4,. She operates a restaurant next to the Agip petrol station in Mbarara. She rents the semi permanent structure for 20,000UGX per month. This business came into existence as a result of her small savings. As there is a  lack of the necessary equipment and utensils, the business earns a low income of 5,000UGX per week. She expects that by using the loan to purchase flasks, saucepans, charcoal stoves and other utensils, the business will increase rapidly. With four years experience in the business, her strength in attracting customers has been the remarkable standards of hygiene that she maintains at her premises. For her business to blossom, she wants to install modern chairs, counters and other furniture.

With sufficient funds, Kudra’s desire is to become a matooke (plantain) vendor in the capital where the food is in high demand. Her ambition is to see her children through school and on to university.

loans.use: Purchase flasks, saucepans, charcoal stoves and other equipment

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom H. is a farmer who lives in Svay Ta Thom village in Kampong Cham province. Her husband, Mr. Sot Seng, helps her in the plantation. They have seven children. One is a laborer; one is a horse cart driver; four are attending the local school; and the youngest, who is only one year old, is too young to work or study.

Mrs. Mom H.'s second son, the horse cart driver, has problems with his horse, so Mrs. Mom H. decided to ask for a loan to buy him another horse to re-start his business.

Mrs. Mom H. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a horse to pull a cart

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame F. is divorced and has 5 dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Maame sells clothing at Mpoben in Elmina, which she has done since 1996. Maame uses her income for paying rent, utility bills and other financial expenses.

Maame will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of clothing and fabric to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her large family.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her to increase sales

loans.name: Mrs. Pheakk Kdey Hoem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nine people and is located in Por village in the Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Pheakk Kdey H. is a village bank president. She is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. On her second plantation, she grows beans but unfortunately she faces an obstacle because her field has been damaged by insects. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Pheakk Kdey H. has decided to request a loan to buy pesticides to kill all kinds of insects. She is a 23-year-old widow with a child who is too young to work or study.

All members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides for her plantation.

loans.name: Tat's Group
loans.use: To buy hundreds of kilograms of pork for her business

loans.name: Opeta

texts.en: Opeta A., 39, is married with 4 children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the villagers and the public 4 days per week. She has received 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Opeta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchasing equipment needed for improving her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria Palenapais twenty-two years old and single with no children.  She has two years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the villagers/general public two days a week. She has one previous loan with SPBD, a Kiva field partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $120.  SPBD loans are Victoria’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, needles and a secondhand sewing machine.

loans.name: Msasani Group

texts.en:
Isaac Kiloe has been in business repairing fridges since 1992. He works from 8 am to 5 pm daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $111. He is 41 and married with two children, ages 13 and 7 years.

This will be Isaac’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy gas, copper stick and bronze and has paid back the loans successfully. He hopes to get this third loan to increase his capital so that he can improve his business.

Isaac will share this loan with Subgroup D of the Msasani group. This subgroup has six members, who run a salon, sell charcoal and clothes. These members hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. 

In the picture, Isaac is the only man.

loans.use: To increase capital for fridge repair business

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es: Sixto tiene 56 años, es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia con su pareja, con quien tuvo 6 hijos, y por quienes trabaja duro para darles educación, por lo que todos ellos migraron a diversas ciudades a estudiar. La agricultura y la albañilería son las actividades que realiza diariamente de forma alternada, las veces que le solicitan sus servicios de albañil trabaja de 7 a 10 días corridos en la obra, y el resto de días a sus cultivos de hortalizas, donde mayormente siembra zanahorias y espinacas. Para ello se levanta muy temprano para trabajar en sus tierras, y a eso de las 8.00am regresa a su casa a desayunar, en seguida regresa en compañía de su esposa a seguir trabajando en sus sembríos, puesto que gracias a la agricultura puede brindarles educación y comodidades a sus hijos. Los años le han permitido tener la experiencia para ser un buen agricultor, puesto que esos conocimientos los emplea a diario en sus labores para velar por el buen desarrollo de cada una de sus plantas. Sixto espera incrementar sus sembrios en chacras alquiladas, donde, con la ayuda de su bicicleta, transporta fácilmente todos sus cultivos.  Sixto es un cliente muy responsable y el primero en pagar las cuotas mensuales, asimismo apoya en comunicar a los demás integrantes de haber una reunión extraordinaria de su banco comunal, este es su 9no crédito con MFP, y es muy respetado por los demás integrantes por la responsabilidad mostrada. Con los 1500 soles solicitados comprará fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus chacras de hortalizas.
texts.en:
Sixto is 56 years old and he is a very responsible and hardworking man. He lives in his own house with his common-law wife, with whom he had 6 children. He has worked hard to give them all an education and they have all gone to different cities to study. He works in agriculture and masonry. When his masonry services are solicited, he works 7 to 10 days straight in the job, and the rest of the time he grows vegetables, mostly carrots and spinach. He gets up very early to work his land and returns to the house at 8:00am to eat breakfast. He then returns to the fields, in the company of his wife, to continue working with his crops. It is thanks to agriculture that he is able to provide for the education and needs of his children. The years have granted him the experience that he needs to be a good farmer. He uses this knowledge everyday to work toward the healthy growth of each one of his plants. Sixto hopes to increase his crops in rented plots, from which, with the help of his bicycle, he easily transports all of his crops. Sixto is a very responsible client and the first to make his monthly payments. He also helps out by informing the other members if there is an unscheduled meeting of their communal bank. This is his 9th loan with MFP and he is very respected by the other members because of the responsibility he has demonstrated. With the requested 1500 PEN, he will buy chemical fertilizers for his vegetable plots.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Nuevo Atardecer Group

texts.es: El grupo “Nuevo Atardecer” esta representado por la señora Miguelina, Jenny y Dalia que son su presidenta, tesorera y secretaria. La mayoría  se dedican al comercio de venta de productos como refrescos, comida, cosméticos por catalogo y otros se dedican a la elaboración de chompas de lana y al servicio de enfermería. El M. tiene un alto nivel competitivo pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y a su fuerza de voluntada como lo demuestra la señora Silvia que a pesar de estar impedida para caminar realiza trabajos de tejidos que comercializa para sacar adelante a su familia. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición de  mercadería, materia prima e instrumentos de trabajo que ayuden a genera mayores ingresos y a mejorar la calida de vida de sus familias. A pesar de que el grupo es relativamente nuevo han demostrado entusiasmo, unidad y responsabilidad por lo que la fundación Agrocapital les brinda el apoyo económico que necesitan.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Atardecer group is represented by Miguelina, Jenny and Dalia; they are the president, treasurer and secretary. The majority of them sell products like soft drinks, meals, and cosmetics by catalog. Others make wool sweaters; some are nurses. The market has a high level of competition, but the group members know how to get ahead thanks to their experience and personal strength. Silvia demonstrates this. In spite of not being able to walk, she knits and sells her knitting products to get her family ahead. The loan is to acquire merchandise, raw materials, and work instruments to help generate greater income and improve the quality of life of their families. In spite of the fact that the group is relatively new, they have demonstrated enthusiasm, unity, and responsibility for the Agrocapital foundation. Agrocapital offers them the economic support that they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ebenezer #2 Group

texts.en:
Viola is a widow who is raising her 3 children as well as 4 others who lost their parents.  All of the children she cares for are in school, but she has to send them to government schools, which are not that good in her area. 

Viola’s business is selling drinks like soda, energy drinks, and even beers.  She says that her business seems to be going very well and it really encourages her to see it growing.  She says that her business attracts customers because she has all of her products clearly on display.  

Viola requested this loan from LEAP because she wants to restock her drinks supply. With this loan she will be able to buy cartons of most of the products that she sells.

loans.use: To buy crates of Red Bull, soda, and beer

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus T. is from the town of Benoni, Mahinog Camiguin. She is 42 years old. Venus is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Venus owns and operates a variety (sari-sari) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Venus is just starting this business.

In 2009, Venus joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venus is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Venus from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Mrs. Sor E. is a married mother, 44 years old, who is blessed with six children. Three of her children are employed: two daughters work as seamstresses in the garment factory and one is a plantation worker.

Sor E. and her husband have their current business of fishing. On the other hand, this couple has always cultivated rice on their own farmland during the crop season. Recently, Sor E.’s rice crop, lacking fertilizer, is not growing after planting. She is therefore applying for a loan to buy more fertilizer to fatten her crop yield.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to fatten her crop yield

loans.name: Marcelita

texts.en:
Marcelita L. is from the village of Timogsay, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 41 years old. Marcelita is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelita owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marcelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Marcelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marcelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is thankful because of the blessings that she had received in her life. She is 52 years old and happily married to Wilfredo L.. The couple is blessed with four children. The eldest is Joel who is now 30 years old and a college graduate; next is Julius - 29 years old who is a college graduate also, third is Jeffrey - 21 years old, a college graduate also and the youngest is Jennifer - 5 years old and in grade school. Josephine is a dressmaker and at the same time she is also a dealer of cosmetics products in their village. She needed additional capital in order to strengthen her tailoring business and also to improve her cosmetics direct selling activity. That’s why Josephine is requesting a loan from KIVA amounting to PHP10, 000 for her business improvement. She said that through this amount that she is requesting, she will be able to provide the educational needs of her youngest daughter.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela es casada con el señor santiago Eduardo Garcia y son padres de una hermosa niña de edad escolar.
Ella labora para una clínica como jefa de enfermeras desde hace 2 años, su esposo trabaja para una clínica de primeros auxilios como radioperador, desde hace un año.
Ellos están solicitando este crédito para las instalaciones eléctricas de su vivienda ya que se quemaron y están batallando por concepto de la luz.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gabriela is married to Mr. Santiago Eduardo Garcia and both are parents of a beautiful girl of school age.

Gabriela has been working as head nurse for a clinic for two years. Since a year ago, her husband works for a first aid clinic as a radio operator.

They need a loan to install electricity in their home as it burnt out and they are in dire need of light.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install electricity in her home.

loans.name: San Cayetano (Comitte De Mujeres) Group

texts.en:
This committee formed in the Neighborhood Toro Blanco of the city of Caaguazú. Sebastiana A. knew the Program through her sister-in-law, who is the president of another comittee, and she was very interested to participate in a Comittee of Women program, where 20 women could work that wanted to secure a profession. With much enthusiasm they formed a group where women could responsibily work together. They are independent with their jobs, where they sell clothes, shoes, food, groceries, and they receive credit. Some received 800,000 gs, other took loans for 600,000 gs, 5000,000 gs, and 300,000 gs, and they invested in buying sugar, beef, wheat, eggs, cheese, shirts, and they want to progress with their loans with Fundación Paraguaya. 
Sebastiana A. wants to use her loan for a small grocery store. 
Grismilda B. S. wants to use her loan for a small grocery store. 
María I. S. wants to use her loan to sell new clothes. 
María R. A. wants to use her loan to sell fruits and vegetables. 
Lucia E. wants to use her loan to sell chickens. 
Elvira B. A. wants to use her loan to sell new clothes. 
Balbina A. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Gregoria M. M. wants to use his loan to sell fruit. 
A. M. wants to use her loan to sell animal kidneys and liver. 
I. L. wants to use her loan to sell new clothes. 
Aquilina V. wants to use her loan to sell new clothes and undergarments. 
Mabel A. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Eulalia G. wants to use her loan to sell fruits and vegetables. 
Ildenfonza V. wants to use her loan for a small grocery store. 
Lucia R. M. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Felicia P. wants to use her loan to sell fruits and vegetables. 
Ceferina C. wants to use her loan to be a dressmaker. 
Delia C. E. wants to use her loan for a small grocery store. 
Delos S. A. A. wants to use her loan for her bartending business. 
Claudia E. wants to use her loan for a small grocery store.

loans.use: Produce, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una mujer dinámica y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 20 años, es madre de una niña, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de madera, actividad que realiza con su esposo. Mercedes forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Claritas 2” desde hace un año, su primer crédito fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en venta de gaseosas, leche fresca y yogurt.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será invertido en la compra de listones y tablas para su negocio de venta de materiales de construcción. La meta de Mercedes es tener una tienda de confecciones.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a dynamic and persistent woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, region of Ucayali, Peru. She is a 20-year-old mother of a young daughter and makes a living buying and selling wood, an activity she carries out with her husband. Mercedes has been a part of the "Las Claritas 2" Community Bank for the past year, and her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to invest in the purchase of soft drinks, fresh milk and yogurt to sell. Currently she is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles (approximately $350), which she plans to use to invest in the purchase of wooden beams and planks for her business selling construction materials. Mercedes' goal is to have a sewing shop.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wooden beams and planks

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda M. is from the village of Panduma Sr., Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Minda owns and operates a specialized "saging" (banana or plantain) retail store, buying and selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Minda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional bananas to sell. Minda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: O. Justine

texts.fr: A. O. Justine est née le 09 Mars 1981 à Adja-Ouèrè au Bénin. Justine est mariée à HOUNKPATIN Evrard, un patissier. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et qui vivent avec leurs parents. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Justine a fréquenté jusqu'au cours secondaire. Il y a trois ans de cela que Justine vend des divers (sardine, pâtes alimentaire, sacs de riz, savons, papiers hygiéniques, eau en sachet "Pur Water", etc.)de même que des boissons dans sa boutique sise à Avotrou, à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Justine s'approvisionne. Justine a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé et l'a bien remboursé. C'est pour renforcer son stock de produits et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, que Justine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. O. Justine was born on March 9, 1981 in Adja-Ouèrè in Benin. She is married to HOUNKPATIN Evrard, a pastry chef. The couple has two children who are both in school and living with their parents. The couple provides for the family jointly. Justine has attended secondary school. For three years, she has been selling a variety of goods (sardines, pasta, sacks of rice, soaps, toilet paper, "Pur Water" pouches of water, etc.), as well as drinks in her shop located in Avotrou, Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She once had an ALIDé loan, and she repaid it. To bolster her stock of merchandise and to cope better with the demand of her customers, she’s requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Various goods (sardines, pasta, sacks of rice, soaps, etc.)

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Gracia”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 32 años y es madre de 02 hijos que aun depende de ella.

Carmen Rosa, lleva 05 años dedicándose al trabajo de manualidades, nos cuenta que desde su adolescencia, siempre le aficiono los tejidos y las manualidades. Para iniciarse mas a fondo en este negocio, decidió sacar un prestamo la cual Manuela Ramos la apoyo con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00, implementando su pequeño negocio, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose conocida.

En la Actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y ahora ya tiene una clientela fija que mes a mes realizan sus pedidos, ya que ella trabaja así y como también va ofreciendo a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos, le va muy bien y mensualmente genera sus propios ingresos y con el carisma que tiene sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará materiales para realizar sus manualidades como: hilos de bordar, tren y perlas, felpa, cintas de ceda en diferentes  colores, polipima y blondas en diferentes modelos. 

Carmen Rosa, se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, feliz por que en su negocio le va muy bien. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen Rosa is a member of the communal bank “María Gracia,” which is located in the Moyobamba district, of the Moyobamba province, of the Department, San Martín. She lives with her partner, is 32 years old, and is the mother of two dependent children. Carmen Rosa has worked with crafts for five years. She tells us that she has liked crafts and fabrics since she was a teenager. To develop this as a business, Carmen Rosa took out a loan with Manuela Ramos for 300.00.soles and bit-by-bit gained a reputation. She still has the same business today, now with regular customers who place monthly orders. Now that she is making it, she also sells to her friends, acquaintances, and neighbors. It’s going very well and she earns her own income each month and with the star quality her product has, people come to her by word of mouth. With this loan of 3,000.00 soles, she will buy materials to make her crafts like: thread, pearls and trains, felt, silk ribbons of varying colors, polipima and different styles of doilies. Carmen Rosa is happy with what she has achieved and happy that her business is successful. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business, and for helping lots of other women who want to be grow their businesses. .

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make crafts.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a forty–five year-old married mother of five children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Comfort works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She trades in maize and plantains, which she buys in bags from nearby towns. Comfort has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure more bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk so that she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan Carlos C. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus dos hijos. 
El señor Juan Carlos trabaja como empleado de la administración publica, en el puesto de empleado de mensajería, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de los pisos de su vivienda que en la actualidad son de tierra.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos C. lives with his two children in his own house. They live in the Pasankeri area on the west side of the city of La Paz. Juan Carlos is employed by the public administration as a messenger. This income supports his family. The loan he is requesting is to fix the dirt floors in his house. This is the third time that he has asked for a loan. The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix the floors in his house

loans.name: Rea Richel
