She says prices for her commodities is on the rise and therefore she wants to use the loan to buy more yams and millet to avoid price hikes and frequent trips to the north. She hopes to increase her savings to support her husband and pay the children's school fees. She is a member of the group called Partners. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy tubers of fresh yams and bags of millet.

loans.name: Emma María

texts.es:
Doña Emma is 51 years old. Currently, she lives with two of her three children and her husband.

She has had her pharmacy for three years. This business was a gift from her oldest daughter. Emma brings her knowledge of health sciences to advise her customers on medicines as she is a nurse by profession. Attending to her pharmacy is her greatest satisfaction because she gets to practice her profession and offers only safe medicines brought directly from authorized pharmaceutical laboratories. Sometimes, she has to help her clients who come to her at any hour of the day or night, but, for Emma, this is very flattering.

Emma focuses on the service in her pharmacy because, in the future, she wants to be able to establish many branches and leave them to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Emma tiene 51 años, actualmente vive con 2 de sus 3 hijos y su esposo.

Ella tiene su botica desde hace 3 años, este negocio fue un obsequio de su hija mayor. Emma vuelca todos sus conocimientos de las ciencias de la salud para orientar a sus clientes sobre medicamentos ya que ella es enfermera de profesión. Atender su botica es su mejor satisfacción porque ejerce su profesión, y solo ofrece medicamentos seguros que trae directamente de los laboratorios farmacéuticos autorizados. A veces debe atender a sus clientes que acuden a ella a cualquier hora del día y la noche, pero para Emma es muy halagador.

Emma se esfuerza en la atención de su botica porque desea a futuro poder establecer varias sucursales y dejarles en herencia a sus hijos.

loans.use: Invest in her pharmacy and add to her shop some bazaar-type items

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos tiene 54 años de edad, su esposa le tiene cinco hijos dos varones de 13 y 18 años de edad, y tres mujeres de 16, 20 y 24 años de edad, con domicilio en Villa Reconciliación. Su esposa trabaja como supervisora en un supermercado. Don Carlos vende ropa, zapatos, productos de limpieza y hogar, lleva dieciséis años de estar en las ventas, e inició con dinero propio, desde joven ha sido un hombre trabajador. Con la solicitud del dinero es para comprar mercadería y tener en almacén para ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad y estilo de productos. A largo plazo es  seguir incrementando el inventario para obtener mejores utilidades así como ayudar a sus hijos que se preparen con los estudios universitarios para que gocen de una vida digna
texts.en:
Carlos is 54 years old, he and his wife have 5 children – 2 sons ages 13 and 18 and 3 daughters ages 16, 20 and 24. Their home is in Villa Reconciliación. His wife works as a supervisor in a supermarket. Carlos sells clothing, shoes, products for cleaning and the home. He has be in sales for 16 years, and he began with his own money. Ever since he was young he has been a hard working man. With this loan he is asking to buy merchandise and have a store to offer his customers a variety and range of products. His long term goal is to continue increasing his inventory to obtain greater resources such as being able to help his children prepare for university studies and that they have a dignified life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for cleaning and the home

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ret L., 29, is a vegetable seller. She grows vegetables and sells them to the market, earning approximately US$2.16 per day. She is married with four children, all of whom are students. Ret faces difficulty with insects that ravage her vegetable crop. With this problem, Ret asks for a loan of US$250 to buy insecticide to protect her vegetable crop and to buy more seeds to use for cyclic growing. The loan will allow her to increase her family's income. Ret is the leader of the small group of three members, joined below:

1. Mrs. Leab M., 51, widowed, grows and sells vegetable. Leab requests a loan of US$200 to purchase insecticide to use for her vegetable crop.

2. Mr. Sary V., 28, makes and sells charcoal from his house. Sary requests a loan of US$200 to pay for farmland plowing of growing rice.

3. Mrs. Sophal Say, 38, widowed, is a vegetable grower. Sophal requests a loan of US$250 to purchase insecticide to use for her vegetable crop.

The group members live in Paksneng Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy insecticide to protect vegetable crops and to buy more seeds to use for cyclic growing

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin O. is 42 years old and married with 6 children. Toyin sells drinks wholesale and retail. She has a store where she sells these drinks to her customers. She is a hardworking woman. She needs the loan amount of N61,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday O. repairs bicycles and motorcycles. He is 39 years old and married with 2 children. His wife is a trader. He needs a loan of N30,000 to purchase more motorcycle materials to sell. He says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Parveen M.sharif Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is 50 years old and lives in the village of Kot Radha Kishan, which is about 24 km away from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She is uneducated because her parents couldn’t afford to send her to school. Her husband is M., and makes a living driving a tractor. They have four children, three sons and one daughter. Her oldest son works in a factory. The others go to a school near their home. Parveen baji runs a cloth-selling business, buying items from the famous city of Multan and selling them in her own town. She does this work to earn a good income and to improve her living standards. She is applying for a loan to increase her income by buying more clothes to sell. 

Parveen baji also leads a small loan group that includes Shaheen baji, who wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop and Hafizan baji, who wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Kreiver

texts.es: Kreiver tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos. La casa donde viven es propia. Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 10 años con su motocarro, gracias a su buena administración del dinero ahora es propietario de dos motocarros, los cuales favorecen a fortalecer la economía de su hogar. Con el ingreso que tiene de ambos motocarros apoya a su cónyuge, quién se dedica al a la venta de granos en un puesto del mercado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer muchos lugares y muchas personas. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita reparará uno de sus motocarros ya que se encuentra en mal estado, para ello requiere comprar repuestos y algunas piezas necesarias para en buen funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Kreiver is 47 and lives with his wife and 3 children. They live in their own home. He has transported passengers for 10 years in his motorcycle rickshaw. Thanks to his good money management, he now owns two motorcycle rickshaws, which helps his family's financial situation. With the income from these, he supports his wife, who sells grains at a stand in the market. What he likes about his job is that he gets to meet a lot of people and see a lot of places. This is his sixth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money he is requesting, he will repair one of his motorcycles since it is in bad shape. For this he needs to buy parts and some necessary pieces so his work tool will work well.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle rickshaw

loans.name: Jhomar

texts.en:
Meet Jhomar T.. He grows rice. Everyday he goes out on his farm, touches the loam, wet soil, feels the heat of the sun, and plows the field with his carabou to ensure quality harvest to support his family. He is 19 years old and single. Most of his earnings go to his parents' and siblings' needs.

He is asking for a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI (Kiva's Field Partner). He will use the loan to buy more fertilizers for his farm. The fertilizers will help a lot to increase his yield. He is hoping that he will have more food to give his family in the coming harvest. His loan will enable him to purchase the needed fertilizers for his crops to increase his harvest.

CEVI is helping people like Jhomar T. grow their businesses. Because CEVI provides their clients credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage, they have created an impact and uplifted people's lives.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and herbicides for his farm

loans.name: Kuchkor

texts.en:
Kuchkor R. is 50 years old. He is a livestock dealer. He buys and sells cattle at various markets and has been in the business for the last 16 years. His main customers are butchers and livestock farmers. Kuchkor is married and the father of three children. With the loan from Kiva, he plans to increase his herd of cattle for trade and, if possible, open up his own butchery. This, he says, will increase his turnover. He plans to see his children receive higher education and be able to get good jobs, unlike himself.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchasing additional cattle

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita D. manages a small mango farm in Norala, South Cotabato, a town of 40,744 people in 8,263 households. She is 51 years old, married and has 5 children. Before, she had a small eatery business, but due to downsizing of her customers, she decided to quit her food business and manage her farm instead. Her husband, Rodolfo D., is a farmer. Aside from mangoes, they grow other crops like cassava, taru, and "camote," which is the Philippine local name for sweet potato.

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 with CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her mango farm. These will help her improve her crop yield. This way, she could achieve a better harvest from her farm to support her family.

CEVI is helping her grow more mangoes. She receives credit assistance, training and insurance coverage services that CEVI gives to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for mango plantation

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 20-year-old Jesca N. from Mwanza. She is married. Jesca has been running a tailoring business making clothes and selling them to customers since 2008. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Jesca currently earns about $150 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy a sewing machine, vitenge (African traditional clothes) and thread. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Jesca thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, vitenge (African traditional clothes) and thread

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Victoria es casada, tiene 37 años y 1 hijo, Victoria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende verduras, abarrotes en general, carne, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y teléfono publico.
Los sueños de Victoria son ampliar su negocio y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Victoria is a partner of "Banco Comunal Arco Iris".

She is married, 37 years old, and has 1 son. Victoria has a store at her house where she sells vegetables, groceries, meat, and beverages every day.

Victoria needs a loan of 2000 soles to be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar and a pay phone. It is her dream to expand her business and build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, and a pay phone.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria Huamán R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Catac”, vive en la Av. 31 de Mayo Nº 316, Distrito de Catac, Provincia de Recuay, Departamento de Ancash. Está separada de su esposo, tiene 06 hijos y solo vive con 01 de ellos.  Los demás son independientes.

Con el primer préstamo de S/.  300.00 compró abarrotes para su tienda instalada  en su propia casa.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, donde vende sus productos a los pobladores de la ciudad de Catac.  Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 comprará fideos, azúcar, aceite, leche, arroz, jabón, detergente, etc.
Siempre fue una mujer independiente y con el negocio que conduce logró darles una profesión a todos sus hijos por ello se siente muy orgullosa.
Manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por seguir confiando en ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gregoria Huamán R. belongs to the Community Bank 'The Winners of Catac' and lives at 316 May 31st Avenue in the District of Catac, Recuay Province, Ancash Department. She is separated from her husband, has six children, and lives with just one of them. The others are independent. With her first loan of S/. 300.00 she bought groceries for her store located in her own house. Presently, she continues with the same business where she sells her products to the residents of Catac city. With this loan of S/. 800.00 she will buy noodles, sugar, oil, milk, rice, soap, detergent, etc. She has always been an independent woman and with the business she runs she managed to provide with all her children an occupation which makes her very proud. She expresses her appreciation to Manuela Ramos for continuing to have confidence in her.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy noodles, sugar, milk, rice, etc.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy sensata y precavida. Está casada, vive en su casa propia con el padre de sus 6 hijos, de los cuales, el mayor migró a otra ciudad y los menores están junto con ella apoyándola en sus trabajos agrícolas. Eugenia le tiene un sentimiento muy grato a cada una de sus plantas cafetaleras, porque gracias a la buena atención y a los cuidados que les brinda logró realizar buenas cosechas que le permiten cubrir la educación y alimentación de sus hijos. Se le levanta muy temprano por la mañana para preparar el desayuno y el almuerzo de sus hijos, quienes al regresar del colegio acuden a cuidar de los cultivos de sus padres, mientras tanto Eugenia y su esposo trabajan en las chacras de sus vecinos desde 8.00am hasta las 6.00pm por un pago diario de 12 soles a ella y 15 soles a él. A pesar de cumplir con su trabajo para sus vecinos, no descuida sus propios cultivos, pues se organiza y delega funciones a cada uno de sus hijos, ya que quiere que aprendan el trabajo y valoren el dinero que se obtiene con esfuerzo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo (3 años) se ha ganado el aprecio, cariño y respeto de todos los integrantes de su banco comunal, debido a su responsabilidad y a sus acertadas opiniones durante las reuniones del grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para agilizar la maduración uniforme del café, de ese modo podrá cotizarlo a un mejor precio en las próximas campañas de cosecha.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a sensible and cautious woman of 40 years old. She is married and lives in a house that she owns with the father of her 6 children. Her oldest child has migrated to another city while the younger children help her with her agricultural work. Eugenia is glad for her coffee plants, because thanks to her attention and care, they have given her good harvests, which have paid for the education and feeding of her children. She rises early in the morning to prepare breakfast and lunch for her children. When they return from school, they help to take care of the plans. Meanwhile, Eugenia and her husband work in their neighbours’ small farms from 8am until 6pm for a daily wage of 12 soles (about 4 US dollars) for her and 15 soles (about 5 US dollars) for him. Although Eugenia and her husband work for their neighbours, they don’t neglect their own plants. They delegate specific tasks to each of their children, so they can learn not only how to farm but also the value of money that is obtained through hard work. This is her fifth loan with MFP. Over the last 3 years, she has gained the esteem, affection and respect of all the members of her communal bank, due to her responsibility and her wise opinions during group meetings. She is now asking for money to buy chemical fertilizers to speed up the even ripening of the coffee beans, so she can get a better price for her future harvests.

Translated from Spanish by Zev Lowe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer (Compra de fertilizantes)

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha P. trades in bush meat. She buys the game meat from hunters in her locality. She sells on a tabletop at the market square. She also supplies food vendors and restaurant operators in her community. Agatha has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy meat in bulk.

Agatha is 43 years old, divorced and has two daughters, who are currently in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She wants to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bush meat

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica P. is from the town of Benoni, Mahinog Camiguin. She is 39 years old. Jessica is separated from her spouse and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessica owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Jessica has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In April 2009, Jessica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional capital. Jessica is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jessica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en: Ouk T., 43 years old, is a single mother of four children, three of whom are employed as domestic construction workers and provide their income to support their family’s living expenses. Ouk, a rice farmer, is requesting a loan to buy seed and fertilizer in order to grow a rice crop during this farming season. She thanks lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer in order to grow a rice crop

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela M. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog Camiguin. She is 56 years old. Fidela is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Fidela owns & operates a business venture in the service sector and does repairs. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing battery charging, repairs and other services for the local community members. Fidela has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Fidela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fidela is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for her repair service business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Fidela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for her repair service business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 48-year-old married woman with six children between the ages of 12 and 26. Four of her children go to school. She owns a three-room house, where she is staying with her children. Ruth takes care of additional family members.  There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala.  

Ruth rents a stall where she sells raw food (matooke, or green bananas). She sells to an average of 15 people a day.  Ruth uses public transport to and from work. Her major monthly expenses are health care and school fees. Ruth has been with MCDT for five years and is servicing her 10th loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more stock.
.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda B. lives in the village of Brgy, San Juan Gingoog City. She is 45 years old, married and has 11 school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells a wide range of products to people in her community. She has been engaged in this business for more than four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP from her work.

Earlier this year, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and expand her small business. She is applying for a loan, her first from HSPFI, to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to support the education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es: Don Cesar Antonio R. de 45 años de edad, vive en Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, de oficio albañil con experiencia de 23 años trabajando con la dificultad que el trabajo no es fijo, ya que cuando termina el contrato de la construcción, tiene que esperar otro. Su esposa es ama de casa cuida a sus niños los cuales cursan la primaria, con este crédito comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y ladrillo que quiere poner en la sala para mejor higiene y presentación de su casa, pues poco ha construido todo de concreto para mayor seguridad de su familia, ya que los materiales están caros, con los financiamiento se logra el mejoramiento continuo de las viviendas.

loans.use: Comprar ladrillo,cemento,arena para poner en la sala

loans.name: Mereñita

texts.es:
Mereñita  es una socia dinámica y emprendedora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 48 años, madre D. cuatro hijos todos mayores D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes al por menor, también alquila motocarro, ella se encuentra muchos años separada, pero siempre se dedico a trabajar arduamente para salir adelante. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “ Ricardo Palma” desD. hace cuatro años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles, que invirtió en gaseosas para vender.
Con este crédito D. 1000 soles, le permitirá invertir en productos para su tienda (arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, etc.). La meta D. Mereñita es tener su negocio bien implementado y crecer en sus finanzas.
texts.en:
Mereñita is one of our dynamic and enterprising members. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in Ucayali region. Mereñita is 48 years old and the mother of four adult children. She has a retail store where she sells groceries as well as a motor taxi that she offers for rental. Mereñita has been separated for many years, but she always worked hard in order to get ahead.

She joined the Ricardo Palma Communal Bank four years ago. Mereñita used her first loan of 300 soles to buy sodas to sell. She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles to acquire products for her store (rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.). Her goal is to manage her business well and grow financially.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a hairstylist and she also sells hair extensions and hair cream at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is a focused, hard-worker who is determined to excel in her business and family life.

Patience is married with five children and she is 42 years old. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell.

This is the high season for her business and services and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa N. est âgée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Avec son prêt elle fabrique et vend des jus naturels et de glace, elle vend également des cacahouètes. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille à partir des bénéfices qu'elle réalise.
texts.en:
Awa N. is 37 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. With her loan, she is making and selling natural juices and ice cream. She also sells peanuts. From the profits she earns, she takes part in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.es:
La señora Lastenia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”, Distrito de Rioja, Provincia de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 53 años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Lastenia, lleva varios años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, ya que teniendo conocimiento en este tipo de actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente atiende a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y necesitan el servicio. Trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan y siempre regalando una sonrisa y con amabilidad sus clientes se sienten muy contentos y satisfechos. En la actualidad, se siente muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Lastenia is a member of the Communal Bank “La Mujer Riojana”, which is in the District of Rioja, Rioja Province, Department of San Martín. She is 53 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 4 children who are all independent.

Lastenia has been producing garments for several years. Since she possessed the appropriate knowledge, she did not hesitate in establishing her own dressmaking shop. Her business is located in her house, which is well-equipped for accommodating her regular customers who know her and come by every day in need of her services. Lastenia’s work is based on the orders she receives in advance. She always greets her customers with a smile, which makes them feel happy and satisfied. At the moment, Lastenia is very pleased and proud of her achievements.

With this loan of 3000 soles, she will buy meters of fabric in different styles and colors, as well as tools such as scissors, large spools of thread in various colors, hand sewing needles, sewing machine needles, pins, and buttons. Today Lastenia feels like an accomplished woman who has more desire to achieve and fulfill her other dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting many other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials & supplies

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata S. is 35 years old and is married to a police officer attached to a local area unit where they are living. She has three children all of whom are attending school. Aminata herself has never been to school as preference was given to boys in the area where she was born.

Aminata sells baby clothes along one of the main roads in the town.  She has been in this business for nineteen years. She started hawking (going door-to-door) but she now has a stall.

Aminata is determined to send all her children to school and to help her husband to construct a small house for the family. The loan she is requesting will help to raise the much needed funds to support her ambition.

Aminata has been a client with ARD for the last two years with a very good credit history. She is honest and very serious about her business.

loans.use: To buy more baby clothes

loans.name: Angelana

texts.en: Angelana A. is a farmer. She plants vegetables on her farmland and sells them at wholesale and retail prices to farmers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to clear her farm and plant more vegetables to sell. Angelana is 45 years old, married and has five children. She is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.) Angelana says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seedlings to plant

loans.name: Rahima Akbar Group

texts.en:
Robaba is the leader of Rahima Akbar Group. She is married and has 5 children. She assembled a group of four members, each of whom has a different business. Robaba will use this loan for her tailoring business. She wants to buy a new sewing machine for her business. 

The second member of Rahima Akbar group is Kamila who wants a loan for her son, who sells dried fruit from a car. With this loan, he wants to complete his inventory. 

The third member, Taiba, wants a loan for her husband. He sells fresh fruit from a cart. With this loan, he wants to buy more fresh fruit for his cart. 

The last member of Rahima Akbar group is Rahima, who is a carpet weaver. With this loan, she wants to buy more equipment for her business. 

They requested a group loan of 40000 Afghani and to further their work and be good clients of Kiva and AFS. Robaba ensures that they can repay the loan on time and says that she can control the whole group. She would like to thank everybody who helps with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa Elena Z. Díaz tiene 33 años de edad y nació en la ciudad de Teustepe Boaco, tras las pocas posibilidades de trabajo en su ciudad natal decidió buscar nuevos horizontes en la capital, ella es casada y tienen dos niñas de las edades de 11 y 2 años de edad, el mayorcito estudia la primaria. Ellos trabajan en una zona franca como operadores de maquinas y de esta manera comparten los gastos del hogar.

Dentro de los gastos está el terminar la construcción de su hogar, de esta manera es que solicita este préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, esto beneficiaria de gran manera a la familia en la vivencia de criar a sus hijos en un lugar cómodo y seguro que ayude al buen desenvolvimiento de los niños hacia un futuro mejor, pero para realizar este fin primero desea invertir capital en la compra de mercadería para vender a su clientela, esto le traerá mejores oportunidades económicas que le aportaran a futuros planes que tenga programado.
texts.en:
Rosa Elena Z. Díaz is 33. She was born in the city of Teustepe Boaco. Because there are few work opportunities in her native city, she decided to look for new horizons in the capital. She is married, and they have two daughters, 11 and 2 years old. The oldest is in primary school. They work in a tax-free zone as machine operators. This way they share the household expenses. Among the expenses is finishing the construction on their house. She is asking for this loan to buy construction materials. This will greatly benefit the family in the house as they raise their children in a comfortable place. It surely helps the children develop well towards a better future. In order to do that she wants to use the loan to buy merchandise to sell to her customers. This will bring better economic opportunities that will contribute to her future plans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila A. is a 39-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Culipapa, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store, a piggery and fishing.

Mila and her husband, William, have two children who are 15 and 17 years old. The children are currently going to school and help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Mila joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hopes that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store, a piggery and fishing. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000 from her business activities.

Mila is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 was used to fund operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing PHP 8,000 for her 11th loan, which she intends to use as additional capital for her general store, piggery and fishing businesses. Mila is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy corn

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 27 years old, married and the mother of four children: Titus, Lydia, Kelvin and Dan, ages 10,8, 6 and 4 year.

Gladys operates a salon that she started three years ago, in Kasoiyo. She generates a profit of Kshs, 5,000 per month and has no other source of income. 

Gladys has not borrowed from any other source other than KADET.  She was introduced to KADET by existing clients. She wants to borrow Kshs 20,000 from KADET to purchase stock for her salon, like cosmetics.  If this loan boosts her business Gladys will use the extra profit to educate her children in school.

She has hopes of constructing a big house for her family and also buying a car. Gladys describes herself as active and humble.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics for her salon business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia S. is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Delia is married and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Delia raises crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Delia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Delia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Delia from GDMPC. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efrain de 29 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Gissell Jaime con quien tiene una niña de nombre Yunieska de 6 añitos estudiando el 1er grado de primaria. Su esposa trabaja como empleada domestica y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Efrain trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 3 años como policia municipal.  

Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado y poniendole perlines para que dure mas, y si el dinero lo permita poner el piso a su casa para que su niña tenga mejor comodidad en su casa.  

El mayor deseo que tiene es poder tener una casa bonita, con las condiciones basicas, para que su familia se sienta comoda y que su hija crezca en un ambiente agradable.
texts.en:
Efrain, 29, is married to Gissell Jaime; they have a 6-year-old daughter, Yunieska, who is in first grade. His wife is a domestic employee and she helps him meet household expenses. Efrain has been a police officer for the city of Juigalpa for three years. He is asking for his 3rd loan to make some home improvements; he needs to replace the roof which is in poor condition adding metal edging so that it will last longer. If funds are sufficient, he will also install flooring in his house so that his daughter will have more comfort at home His greatest wish is to have a pretty home with basic condition so that his family will feel comfortable and his daughter will grow up in pleasant surroundings

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace the roof and install flooring.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 33-year-old businessman who makes a living running a food kiosk in Nairobi. He has been in this business for three years and has one employee. Before he began this business, he was an employee at an independent company. He has applied for a loan for Kes. 50,000 to buy 10 bales of unga wa mahindi (or maize flour), 10 bales of unga ngano (wheat flour) and five cartons of soap. Samuel has four children, and hopes to expand his small company into a wholesale operation and then a supermarket. He says that Faulu Kenya Ltd is helping make this possible and has raised his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy new supplies of flour and soap to sell to his customers

loans.name: Banco Del Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; Nuestros socios viven en el distrito de Huanchac provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Eva; ella tiene 39 años, la socia es casada, y tiene 2 hijos adolecentes, La socia solicita el préstamo para ampliar su pequeño negocio Nuestra socia tiene un pequeño bar en la calle meloc y la socia acondicionará un espacio mayor al que ya tiene y lo decorará y comprará nuevos vasos y algunas bebidas. Nuestros otros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades del hogar con el negocio como, prestar servicio de transporte, protesista dental, ingeniero electrónico, secretaria, empleados en negocios de restaurantes.
  
Los socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members are part of the communal bank, “'Banco del Desarrollo,” or, Development Bank. Our members live in the Huanchac province in the department of Cusco [region around the city of Cusco]. One of our members is Eva; she is 39-years-old, married, and has two adolescent children. She is requesting this loan to expand her small business. She has a small bar on Meloc Street which she will convert to a larger space than she now has, decorate, and buy glasses and some drinks. Our other members alternate their different household activities with businesses and jobs such as: transportation provider, dental technician, electronic engineer, secretary, and as employees in the restaurant business. The partners are thankful for and value greatly the support provided by this means and promise to meet the payments on their debts in the specified time.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Loan to expand small bar.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
K. Mahmud is 48 years old and lives with his wife and four children. His plans for his family are to improve their quality of life and give a better education to all his children. 

Mahmud began working in the fields two years ago. It was his father who taught him how to work with the earth. Mahmud works in farming and also raises cattle, which he sells to bring in extra income. With this loan he will buy farming supplies so his harvest will be good and he can sell it for a good price in the market. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. 

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion V. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Presentacion is married and has nine adult children. To make a living, Presentacion owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Presentacion has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Presentacion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Presentacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Presentacion is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Presentacion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en: Adoracion B. is from the village of Mangcuram. She is 47 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Adoracion owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Adoracion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Adoracion is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.es: Vitaliana, de 44 años de edad, es viuda y padre de cuatro hijos. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva tropical peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tiene su techo propio. A Vitaliana nunca le ha gustado depender de nadie, ya que ella misma se la consigue por su propia cuenta, desde luego que su gran fortaleza son sus hijos, debido a que lo motiva a trabajar constantemente en su chacra, en donde cultiva y comercializa su producto de cacao, por el cual  recibe buenas ganancias, incluso cuenta con clientes que siempre compra su producción. Espera con el tiempo ampliar su producción de cacao a gran escala, adquiriendo nuevos terrenos de cultivo y de esa forma mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Pero por el momento continuara trabajando duro y parejo, de esa manera con lo ahorros ganados pueda cumplir su objetivo trazado. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero en temporada de cosecha necesita la ayuda de sus peones para que lo puedan facilitar la extracción de cacao y luego venderlos en los centros de acopio de su propia localidad. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además augura buenos éxitos a su grupo comunal, por la solidaridad y responsabilidad que existe. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abonos, para que de esa forma le dé un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Vitaliana, age 44, is a widow. She has four children, and they live in the beautiful tropical Peruvian jungle. She has her own home in the Santa Rosa area. Vitaliana has never liked depending on anyone else; she can do things for herself. Her children are her great strength. They are her motivation for constantly working on her farm. She grows and sells cacao. She gets good earnings from this, and she has customers who always buy her product. In time she hopes to increase her cacao production on a large scale. She wants to get new land to cultivate. This will improve her family’s quality of life. For the moment she will continue working hard and consistently. That way, with her savings, she will be able to reach her planned objective. Sometimes her children help her, but during the harvest season she needs workers to help her collect the cacao. The cacao is later sold at local collection centers. This is her second loan with MFP. She pledges to faithfully make her payments. Also, she predicts good success for her communal bank because of the existing solidarity and sense of responsibility. She will use the requested loan to buy supplies and fertilizers. That way she will give her cacao crops adequate maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide adequate maintenance on her cacao crops

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani has applied for a loan for the expansion of her son’s milk-selling business. With the help of the loan, her son will buy another buffalo which will help him increase his sales and income.

Rani is a 55-year-old lady who has been living with her husband and family in a three-room brick house in Kasur, Pakistan, for the last thirty years. She is the mother of three children; unfortunately none of them could get an education. Her eldest son has taken over his father’s business of selling milk due to his growing old. Her second son drives a horse and cart and her daughter stays at home and manages the household chores with Rani.

Rani hopes that by using the loan to purchase a new buffalo, her son will be able to increase his profits. Milk selling is Rani’s family business and she is confident that it will be improved with this investment and she will be able to save money from the profits for the marriage of her only daughter who is now 17 years of age.

Rani is a regular loan user and is on her 3rd loan. In her previous loans she paid her installments on time and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To enable her son to purchase another buffalo for the family dairy business

loans.name: Martina Janett

texts.es: Martina Janet tiene 36 años, ella se dedica a un bar y comedor. Hace más de 2  años que tiene este negocio, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Su comedor está ubicado en las afueras de la ciudad y por medio de los financiamientos ha logrado salir adelante pues no es la primera vez que ha realizado financiamientos. Ella ofrece diferentes platillos variados en donde sus clientes escogen el que más les gusta muchos asisten a su local por es un lugar familiar. Este crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, gaseosas,  pollo, carnes entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Martina Janet is 36 years old and she runs a restaurant bar. She has had this business for more than 2 years. She is a single mother and she has her son in her care. Her restaurant is located in the outskirts of the city and it is thanks to past loans that she has been able to advance. This is not the first time she has received a loan. She has various foods in her menu to offer clients. Many people help out in her restaurant as it is a family setting. This loan will be used to purchase basic grains, soft drinks, chicken, meats and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane Y. is currently in the business of selling dried fish. She is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and more dried fish to sell.  

Jane is 32 years old and is married to a peasant. She has five children and four of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy goats to rear at home.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes and more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Madame Bintou Traoré est une femme mariée de 48 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui vit avec ses enfants chez son époux dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
Ayant vite abandonnée l’école, elle décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus telles la fabrication et vente des jus de fruits devant une école de la place, la vente de pagnes et de savons. Finalement Bintou opta pour la vente de savons  depuis maintenant  plus de 10 ans. Elle est très sollicité et appréciée à Bougouni. 
Ainsi après 8 prêts solidaires, elle décide de venir  au prêt  individuel où elle est à son premier prêt. Tous les autres prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
C’est dans le souci de satisfaire davantage sa clientèle en nette croissance, qu’elle décide de continuer à collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des cartons des savons de différentes sortes. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali). Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes. La vente se fait dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni, d’une façon ambulante et à domicile, en détail et au comptant.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000 FCFA. 
Elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise pour devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
Ms. Bintou Traoré is a 48-year-old married woman and the mother of six children.  She lives with her children at her husband's place in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni.  Having quickly dropped out of school, she decided to operate revenue-generating businesses, such as making and selling fruit juices in front of a local school, selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and selling soaps.  Bintou has been in business for over ten years now.  She is in high demand and much appreciated in Bougouni.  

And so, after eight solidarity loans, Bintou decided to go with individual loans and is now on her first loan.  All the other loans have been correctly repaid. Concerned about further satisfying her customer base, which is clearly growing, she decided to continue to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to buy boxes of soaps of different kinds.  She gets her supplies in Bamako (capital of Mali).  

Her customer base is composed essentially of women. Cash or credit sales are made at home and by going door-to-door in the different districts of Bougouni.  Bintou expects to make a monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA.  Her ambition is to expand her enterprise to become a wholesale merchant.

loans.use: Buying soaps

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa e hijos en el sector Bodegones, una zona rural y agrícola del distrito de Lambayeque, se encuentra situada a media hora de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a trabajar en labores agrícolas, el cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar menestras y forraje para animales. Cuando ya es temporada de cosecha las suele vender en su mismo terreno a los comerciantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad el trata de sacar adelante a su familia.

Es esta oportunidad Juan ha sembrado frijol y su cultivo ya se encuentra listo para la cosecha. El no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para realizar esta acción, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Juan es una persona bastante trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien honrado y de confianza.
texts.en:
Juan is a 32 year-old father who lives with his wife and their children in the Bodegones neighborhood, a rural farming area in the Lambayeque district, located a half hour from the city of Chiclayo.  

Juan has been working in agriculture for 10 years; he has some land where he often cultivates beans and forage for animals.  When it is time to harvest, he often sells to the traders who come to visit his area.  With the income this provides, he supports his family.

Now Juan is cultivating beans and his crops are ready to harvest.  He lacks sufficient resources to carry out the harvest, and so he is requesting for the first time a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 500 Peruvian soles.

Juan is a hardworking person who has a strong desire to get ahead.  The people who know him consider him to be an honest and trustworthy person.

loans.use: to cover expenses related to the harvesting of his bean crops

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 22-year-old single man.  He runs a grocery store and also sells charcoal.  Its three years now since he started the business.  He also runs a retail shop so as to earn extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to run his business professionally.  He hopes to have a family and to stabilize his business in the future.  He sees himself growing his business into a wholesale business in the future.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy onions, beans, maize, bananas and lettuce.

loans.use: To buy onions, beans, maize, bananas and lettuce.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana lives in Lahore, famous for its history and culture. She lives there with her family in a 2-room brick house. Farzana is a very caring and supportive lady. She supports her family financially by doing embroidery work. To earn an income, she receives orders from her neighborhood clients and completes the orders on time. 

Her husband is a private entrepreneur and makes beautiful colored jewelry boxes. He makes the boxes from wood and glass, which give an attractive look to his work. His clientele are jewelry sellers. He is very skillful in his art and receives regular orders every month. Timely delivery of products is the key to a successful business and her husband follows this.

Farzana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy glass and wood in larger quantities, which will help him to make more jewelry boxes to fulfill the orders of his customers. 

Farzana is hopeful that her husband will successfully be able to improve his business with the help of a loan investment.

loans.use: To buy wood and glass for jewelry box business

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron K. is 43 years old and a resident of Saos Trading Centre in Koibatek town. He is married with eight children. His spouse is Jane, an horticultural farmer. They both support their family. Haron buys and resells livestock as a source of income, and from this business he gets an average profit of Kshs 5,000 a month.
 
Haron has borrowed a third  loan of Kshs 30,000 from Kadet after successfully paying off the second loan. He intends to use Kshs. 10,000 to purchase 10 goats and Kshs. 20,000 to buy young steers for resale later when they are grown.
 
Haron plans to use the anticipated profits to buy more cattle. His hopes and dreams are to become a cattle supplier to  Kenya Meat Commission and also be able to give his children the best education possible.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase beef

loans.name: Yegana

texts.ru:
Yegana M. 37 let. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom , ona pereselenec iz Kalbadjar regiona i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione so svoyey semyoy. Ona ne zamujem i ne imeyet detey. 

Yegana uje 8 let kak rabotayet uchitelnicey. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit knigi i testi dlya svoix uchenikov.
texts.en:
Yegana M. is 37 years old. She is an Internally Displaced Person from the Kalbadjar Region, now living in the Absheron Region with her relatives. She is single, without children. 

Yegana has been working as a school teacher for eight years. At present she needs 2,000 AZN in order to buy books and tests for her students.

loans.use: Purchasing books and tests for her students

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn S., 45, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. raises pigs, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 41 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a plot of farmland to generate more income from their farming business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan O. is 57-year-old woman and mother who lives in the province of Kompong Tom. Chan O. has no a life partner because her husband died of senility many years ago. She has four children, and all of them are married. Three of her children are employed in different careers, and they always share their benefits with Chan O.. 

Chan O. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. Chan O. has been cultivating rice since 1990, and she always gets good success with her planting following dry season and rainy season. 

Chan O. will be using her loan to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming. The loan will provide her with an additional new asset. 

Note: Chan O. and her grandson are in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth, tiene 29 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y viven en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Yaneth está trabajando en la provincia de Puacartambo en la comunidad de Patria como docente pero ahora está de vacaciones en la ciudad del Cusco, ella nos cuenta que tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la ciudad del Cusco y está a cargo de unos de sus hermanas. Ya son varios que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más. El sueño de Yaneth es abrir un jardín de niños. 

Yaneth pertenece al banco comunal “Kantus” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 29 and lives with her two children in Cusco, Perú. Yaneth works in Puacartambo Province, in the town of Patria as a teacher, but is currently on leave in Cusco.  She has a small general goods store in Cusco, which her siblings help her manage. Business has been very good and so Yaneth seeks a loan to buy more products such as rice, sugar, pasta and other products to increase the store's selection. Yaneth dreams of own day opening a child care center. 

Yaneth belongs to the “Kantus” communal lending bank of the Asociación Arariwa and is grateful for the credit access the group allows her.  She is committed to the timely repayment of her loan.

loans.use: To buy inventory such as sugar, pasta, rice and other products

loans.name: Jay

texts.en:
Jay A. is from the village of Muñoz West. He is 34 years old. Jay is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jay owns & operates motorcycle services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to community members. He also keeps busy buying and selling scrap and waste materials in their community. Jay has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jay joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jay has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase used bottles and newspapers to sell. Jay is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair the motorcycle used in the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Jay from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair the motorcycle used in recycling and transport

loans.name: Gnien

texts.en: Gnien S. is a 51-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to plants rice crops. Her husband is a carpenter who is good at building wooden houses. He earns a profit of approximately $1.50 a day to share responsibility with Gnien S. for the entire family’s expenses. Gnien S. is looking for a loan to buy fertilizers and purchase an ox because her old ox can't support her farm work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and purchase an ox because her old ox can't support her farm work.

loans.name: Kibondo Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamis B., who is in her mid-forties, is married with three grown-up children. She has been running a food vendor business for two years.  She works from 6:00am to 9:00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Mwanahamis's tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to go to Kilosa, which is about 320 kilometres from Dar es Salam, to take ladies' clothes, pants, and petticoats and sell them to the villagers. She also sold charcoal at her place, Kimara. She paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to go to Kariakoo, which is about three kilometres from the city centre, to buy Arab-style traditional dresses (very long and large, say free-size) and sell them door-to-door.

Mwanahamis will share this loan with her loan group "Kibondo" which has a total of 18 members.  The members of the group will hold each accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Mwanahamis is in the back, fourth from right, just next to a lady in pink.

loans.use: To go to Kariakoo Market and buy long and large dresses.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert K. K. is sixty years old and is married to a business lady. They have three children aged between 33 and 28 years old. His business is located at the busy Likoni market in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attractions,  not forgetting the Indian ocean white beaches. 

He sells fruits and vegetables to the local people. He has operated this business for the past twelve years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenges he faces are financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 60,000 to buy fruit and vegetables to expand his business. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He also hopes to get permanent premises from which to run his business. He describes himself as determined and patient.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bitres

texts.en:
Bitres is a single woman who lives with her brother's three children. They live at a rental house that has electricity but lacks piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a second-hand clothes-selling business. She sells at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Bitres faces a major challenge of competition from other second-hand clothes merchants in the market. She dreams of establishing her own retail shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bales of second-hand clothes and to pay transportation costs. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand clothes and pay transportation costs.

loans.name: Juvie

texts.en:
Juvie is from the village of Dioyo, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Juvie is single and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $187 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Juvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, rice and corn grits for resale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with three children. She plans to fund their education through the income that her loan provides.

Jocelyn is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 10 years. Jocelyn earns PhP 3,000 per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to buy a bigger farm to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Akutwala Ekiro Nakawuka Group

texts.en:
Zzeridda's cinema business is now 7 years old. This kind of entertainment is a booming business, especially in many urban areas of western Uganda. Zzeridda mostly shows Nigerian movies, which are the fascination of many people in Uganda at present.

Zzeridda, a 27-year-old happily married mother of one, says her best friend inspired her to join this business. Before that, she was mostly inclined to a modest poultry business. Zzeridda says success in her business has come from hard work and being friendly to her clients. The business generates 120,000 UGX weekly. Zzeridda plans to use this loan to purchase new movie DVDs to show at her cinema.

loans.use: to purchase new movie DVD'S to show at her cinema

loans.name: Helenita

texts.en:
Helenita is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Helenita has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Helenita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Helenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Abduzarif

texts.ru: Абдузариф проживает в районе Руми. Женат. У него трое детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Более пяти лет Абдузариф печет  лепёшки и продаёт их. Кредит берет для закупа муки.
texts.en: Abduzarif lives in the region of Rumy. He is married and has three children. He has secondary education. Abduzarif has been making and selling flat breads for more than five years. He is taking the loan to buy flour.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila tiene 57 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo Samuel de 53 años y su querido hijo Bryan de 16 años, a quien desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Lucila a base de trabajo y perseverancia logró situar su negocio en la ciudad de San Francisco, donde hoy su ferretería es una de la más conocida y visitada de la ciudad, debido a la gran variedad de productos que tiene en venta. Ella se esfuerza por tener su negocio bien surtido, es por ello que cada fin de mes viaja a la ciudad de Lima a comprar los materiales que se agotaron. Considera que le agrada ayudar a sus clientes a elegir los mejores productos para sus construcciones, lleva 27 años realizando esta actividad y menciona que lo más difícil es tener que cargar los pesados materiales que trae desde la capital, pero aun así ella sigue firme en sus metas. Con el crédito solicitado comprará materiales de construcción como clavos, fierros y calaminas. Con el tiempo desea, ampliar las instalaciones de su ferretería, para poderle brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es el 11avo crédito con MFP y espera el apoyo de ustedes para llevar a cabo su propósito, además se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es una socia jovial y siempre está pendiente sobre los acuerdos del grupo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, viajará a la ciudad de Lima a comprar más materiales de construcción para implementar su ferretería.
texts.en:
Lucila is 57 years old.  She’s an unassuming, hard working woman living in her own house together with her husband, Samuel, 53, and her beloved son, Bryan, 16, who she wants to provide a better quality of life for.  Based on hard work and perseverance, Lucila managed to establish her business in the city of San Francisco.  Today, her hardware store is one of the best known and most visited in the city due to the large variety of goods she stocks.  She strives to keep the business well stocked and this is why she travels to the city of Lima each week to buy the merchandise she’s run out of.  She enjoys helping her customers choose the best products for their construction projects.  She’s been in this line of work for 27 years and mentions that the most difficult part is having to carry the heavy materials she brings from the capital.  But, even so, she continues firm in her goals.
